loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.use: To connect her home to Haiti’s first solar hybrid smart electricity grid

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn is 56 years old, widowed, and has four children, one of whom attends school. Janilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sacks of charcoal and rice, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc. 

Janilyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sacks of charcoal and rice, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en: Ahed is a 22-year-old single lady living in Irbid, Jordan with her family consisting of six members. She is a fourth year university student majoring in Sports Training. Ahed also works in the evenings at a mall. She is seeking her Bachelor's Degree so that she will be able to work in her field. Ahed has applied for this loan because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad. 

Luz es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que es viuda desde hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a fabricar y vender productos de uso domestico tales como productos para la limpieza e higiene del hogar.

Actualmente Luz tiene unos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar materia prima como químicos y aromatizantes para así continuar fabricando sus productos.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking person who, through their daily efforts, has managed to get her son ahead by providing him with a high quality education. Luz is a single mother and head of the household, as she has been widowed for some time. This has made her economic situation very difficult, but her business has given her great strength, and she has managed to get ahead. 

She has been making and selling household products, such as cleaning hygienic products, for many years. Luz currently has some orders from her customers, but because she does not have a lot of capital, she is seeking a loan to buy raw materials such as chemicals and scents in order to continue making her products and fulfill these orders. Her dream is to make her business more successful, and with that, be able to offer her child a good quality of life and improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as chemicals and scents to continue making household cleaner products.

loans.name: Furaha Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Saumu is in her forties, married, and has four schooling children. She supports her family with income from her business. She employed herself in a business called mamalishe where she provides breakfast and lunch food service. Saumu has been in her business for ten years now and is able to realize a good profit each month. She works from 06am to 04pm daily.

Saumu has been a borrower with Tujijenge Tanzania for eight loan cycles. She has paid back all previous loans successfully, which she used to improve her food business by replenishing her supply of rice, maize, baking flour and cooking oil. She received profit which she used to cover part of her household expenses and school fees, and she also bought a plot of land. 

Saumu is now requesting her ninth loan which she will use to buy cooking inventory for her mamalishe. In the coming years, she would like to grow her portfolio with a new business of motorbikes. 

Saumu will share this loan with her group "Furaha Tegeta" which consists of three members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking inventory for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 42 years old, married, and is raising four children. In 2002, while looking for additional sources of income, she started breeding livestock and cultivating plants. She started her business with 300 AZN. Naila has given all she had to grow her business and now has one cow, five sheep and one mare. Her husband helps her in this business.

For further growth of her business, Naila has come to Aqroinvest CU and Partners for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to buy a stallion to feed and resell. In the future she plans to expand her business and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy a stallion to feed and resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 62 years old, is married and has five children, one of whom is in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, Erlinda has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace mucho ha tenido el sueño de ser un comerciante independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, por esta razón desea comenzar con un negocio de venta de productos de la marca Amway, estos productos los venderá inicialmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares. 

Desde muy niño ha sentido afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y calidad humana.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de la mencionada marca y así poder cumplir su sueño de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Juan is a very enterprising young man with a great desire to get ahead and make progress. For a long time he has had the dream of becoming an independent trader and generating his own income. This is why he wants to set up a business selling products from the Amway brand, which he plans to sell initially to friends, neighbours and family members. Since he was a very small boy, he has felt an affinity with commerce and selling. This is why today he shows good skills in these areas, thanks to his friendliness and his human qualities.

Juan is asking for a loan to buy a range of products from the Amway brand, and thus achieve his dream of becoming independent. He hopes to succeed thanks to the help of good-hearted people who support this type of project.

loans.use: to buy a range of Amway-brand products and thus achieve his dream of becoming independent.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 48 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Marlyn has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from food vending.

Marlyn has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell. Marlyn has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 50 years old and married with seven children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Mercedita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.  Mercedita has been raising livestock for 12 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 52 years old, is married and has eight children, three of them in school. She works hard to support her family. Leonila has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Leonila is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 42 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school.

Noralyn earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for seven years and also earns additional income from running a general store.

Noralyn works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Meet Ade. Ade lives with his wife and their only child in Sukabumi. Sukabumi is a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. 

He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services for his customers.  

He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Ade believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him processing more mobile and bill payment services to his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learn from Ruma. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide bill payment and mobile services to his community

loans.name: Asti

texts.en:
Asti is a housewife who lives with her husband and a child in West Bandung, a regency area in West Java. 

Her husband is a farmer and she contributes to the  family income by running a small business to sell snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

Asti joined Ruma  a month ago because she wanted to expand her network, learn how to use technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She is excited about expanding her business to now sell mobile phone airtime credits. 

She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime transactions to her community on the weekends. 

Asti is pictured in the photo standing in her stall with her daughter. 

Asti thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Raneem

texts.en:
Raneem is a 19-year-old single lady living in Irbid-Jordan with her family, which consists of five members. She is a university student majoring in economics, and she is in her third year. 

Raneem is seeking to get her bachelor's so that she will be able to work in her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Phorn is 58 years old and married. The main source of her income to secure the need in her family is from a cassava plantation of four hectares. She has been with this business for forty years. 

This is the third cycle for her with VisionFund. Via the past loans that she has fully paid back, she has improved her family’s lifestyle to be better than before. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her family will have electricity to use in their household.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is called Isaac. He joined 'Hand in Hand Eastern Africa' to benefit from training on enterprise creation and financial management.

Isaac is fifty-five years old, married, and has six children. He does dairy farming. He is borrowing a loan to boost his farming activities by buying high quality cow feeds. He believes this will help improve on milk production which will thus uplift his family's living standards, since the income from the dairy farming will increase and he will be in a position to meet his expenses, such as school fees for his children.  

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: To buy quality cow feeds.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad, is aged 60, married to a farmer, and blessed with five children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost twenty years and earns a net income of PHP 800-900 weekly. Her income from her business is for the savings of their family. 

Due to insufficient funds from her business Caridad would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings, organic fertilizers and insecticide spray to use in her vegetable production. She's hoping that her vegetable production business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings, organic fertilizers and insecticide spray to use in her vegetable production.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is 34 years old and married, with three children he is sending to school. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. Jerry's wife also helps him in the farming business. Jerry wants to increase his crop production but he has insufficient funds to sustain his crops with additional farm inputs. He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and crude oil to use in farming. Ensuring nutritious crops will lead to a profitable harvest someday. He will save his additional revenue to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and crude oil to use in farming

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 55 years old and a residence of Sto.Nino, Dapitan City Zamboanga del Norte. She joined Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative in the year 2007 and she appreciates the programs and services and continuous education of the Coop. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended for the repair of her motorcycle used as a passenger transport vehicle. Constancia dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo runs a service-based business, providing transportation services to the local community in order to earn a living. It is his main source of income. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for buying new tires. He was determined enough to set aside a savings deposit from his income for he is planning to expand his transportation business in the near future. The business is doing well and he is recently taking a new loan to cover the costs of repairs to his sidecar. Arnulfo hopes to improve the general living situation of his family as well.

loans.use: to cover the costs of repairs to his sidecar

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 45 years old, is married and a resident of Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into the business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. On March 10, 2009,  both Susan and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan to buy more fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia, a 39-year-old mother of two children, settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. She lives in the village which is a little bit from their town and it is the reason for her to build a retail store. She earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband does farming. For over four years, Virgenia has earned well and improved the business. Her earnings are used for her children's education costs. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of improving her business and providing a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lenita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice and pre-paid mobile load. Lenita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, and canned goods for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.
She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business. Marlina  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
WONDERFUL KIVA LENDERS! The above picture presents Janet, a small scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kaboi, in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with six children. For the last 21 years, Janet has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Janet finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm because of a lack of farm inputs. Janet is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. She will purchase quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate to increased income levels. Janet is a very hardworking woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. Janet will use the extra income she will get to repay the loan and increase her farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Nguyet is requesting a new loan to buy soft drinks and dumplings to sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and dumplings to sell from her shop.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
This young lady’s name is Nelli and she is 21 years old. She lives in the village of Pambak in the Lori region. She has a higher education and a specialty of management. Now she works at the village municipality as leading specialist-operator. She is a very active and clever lady, who with the help of a special program works and controls all the work of the municipality of her native village. 

Nelli is married and they already have a year old son. Nelli is asking for this loan since she must attend special training courses within the program with which she works now, and she must get informed about all the innovations in it. She thanks all the Kiva lenders beforehand for the support that she hopes to have from them.

loans.use: to attend special training courses of the program with which she works now.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The lady in the photograph is Hannah. She is thirty years old, single and blessed with two children. She earns her living by operating a salon & beauty parlor.
 
In 2012, she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training on enterprise creation.This has enabled her to manage her business effectively. She is taking a loan to expand her enterprise by buying salon materials such as shampoo, gel and  hair weaves. This will ensure she offers quality services to her clients. This will, in return, help expand her customer base. She hopes that the income she gets from the salon will help meet her household requirements such as food.

Hannah is so happy and grateful to Kiva for uplifting her business.

loans.use: to buy salon materials.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 27- year- old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. In the group picture, Parveen is wearing multicolored shawl. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges from his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Parveen, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a wider variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. 

With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Jane. She is fifty-six years old, married, and has six children. She joined 'Hand in Hand Eastern Africa' so as to benefit from the trainings on enterprise development and financial management. She practices dairy farming.

She is borrowing a loan to boost her dairy farming by buying dairy feeds and to repair the cow shed. By doing this she is convinced that the loan will help improve her life as the income from her dairy farming will increase.  She will comfortably take care of her children's education and meet her personal needs. She is grateful to Kiva and all of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and to repair the cow shed.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She has a business of a food stall and has been in this business for 10 years.  

Mariam has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cabbages, tomatoes, Ground nuts, cassava, sweet potatoes and onions. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and start growing fruit and vegetables. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, onions, cabbages, ground nuts and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en: Vichet is 20 years old, a freshman at a university, and a staff member at a motorcycle company. He is single and lives with his parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He can earn approximately $5.06 a day. Because of a lack of financial support to pay for his first-year tuition fee, Vichet would like to apply for a loan. This loan will help him improve his knowledge. In the future, he wants to find a better job with a better salary to improve his life.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fee.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is married with three children. Marissa is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows string beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farming activities. Marissa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marissa hopes to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has been operating her variety store for many years. She also manages a tailoring business, earning well for her family. Lorna used the income from her previous loan to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her store and she successfully repaid her loan. 

For the third time, Alma is requesting another 13,000 PHP loan now to purchase materials and supplies needed in her tailoring business. She will buy more fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed to improve her service. She will use her loan to improve her sales so that she can improve the general living conditions of her family. Alma appears here in a photo at her tailoring shop.

Alma still hopes of a better life for her family. She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito is a father of four children and has worked as a driver for the past nine years. His business involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his children. 

He asked for a loan to purchase another motor, lubes, and tire for motor maintenance. Angelito wants to increase his income so that he would be able to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase another motor, lubes, and tire for motor maintenance

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruit. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell, like carrots and string beans, etc. for her vegetable vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell like carrots and string beans, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 44 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Myrna has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.  Myrna has been in this business for five years. 

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Lolita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials to repair her fishing boat for her fishing business. Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelfa works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy-and-sell' charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nelfa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her 'buy-and-sell' charcoal business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Nelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Plutarca

texts.en:
Plutarca is 57 years old and married with five children.  

Plutarca is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Plutarca has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Plutarca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly is 42 years old, and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Norly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Norly has been farming vegetable for six years, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Yerevan in the flat of her sister, who lives abroad now. She lives with her nice daughter in this flat. She has been divorced for many years, and she already got used to taking care of her small family alone, with a great sense of duty and hope of having better living conditions. 

Karine now works at the Yerevan State Architectural College as a secretary in the educational department. Karine’s daughter is 18 years old, a very beautiful and clever lady, who studies at the Yerevan State Architectural National University. She is a second-year student. The problem is that she studies at the paid division, which is a great financial hardship for Karine, and she is very worried about the beginning of this new semester. 

Karine is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester. She gives thanks beforehand and wishes all the best to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Sumaira is a 32-year-old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and her husband is a vehicle repair mechanic by profession. Her husband has been providing services to people in the form of vehicle repairing. He has been running a vehicle repair workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop for exchange in vehicles during repair. He needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore his wife, Sumaira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Sumaira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's auto workshop

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is called Catherine. She is 51 years old, married, and blessed with four children whom she lives with. 

She does vegetable farming, which she wishes to boost by buying fertilizer, pesticides, and quality seeds. She looks forward to a good harvest as a result of improved crop yield. Her profits will increase, hence she will be able to meet her family's needs, such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and all the lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and quality seeds.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is a 20-year-old single lady, living in Hashmiya-Jordan with her family that consists of five members. She is a university student majoring in Historical Resources Management, and she is in her third year. Haya is seeking to get her Bachelors’ so that she will be able to work in her field. But because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children, and all them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, who are old parents.  

She has a food stall business, and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of mangoes, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet bananas and Cavendish bananas. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works at the market seven days out of every week. and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

She aspires to becoming a wholesaler, and also to buying a plot of land and building her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, onions, cabbages, sweet bananas and tomatoes.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She is 53 years old and has four children. She, together with her husband, breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every month. 
 
Merla's family is one of those affected by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. She is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan assistance to buy additional hogs and feed and other materials, which are necessary to increase her inventory.
 
In the future, Merla hopes to grow her business and thus her earnings. She dreams that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Pinnie

texts.en:
Pinnie works hard to support her family. Pinnie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Pinnie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her fish stall.
Pinnie has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pinnie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.  Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Sahaya

texts.en:
Sahaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell for her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Sahaya has been in this business for nine years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sahaya has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 33-year-old, divorced woman with children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She took a loan and paid it off well. She deals in foodstuffs and she used the old loan to expand on her stock. She is very hardworking and wants this loan to continue increasing her stock since the demand for her foodstuffs is high, especially if it is season time.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 21 year old, single, young man living in Irbid-Jordan with his family that consists of four members. He is a university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his third year. 

Anas is an ambitious, independent, man who is seeking to get his Bachelors so that he will be able to work in his field and earn a good income that will help him support his family financially. But because he doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Linnet

texts.en:
Linnet is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is single with no children. Currently she lives in the Mwenezi District in Zimbabwe. Linnet lives with her young sisters and brother. Linnet has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Linnet goes door to door selling her clothes. She started this business because it was profitable and she realized that people from her area walk a long distance to buy clothing. 

With the Kiva loan, Linnet will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and also to create employment for other members.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Bavi

texts.en:
Bavi is age of 42, the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh fruits and vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits and vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits and vegetables. 

Therefore, Bavi has requested a Kiva loan so that she can support her husband to expand his current business. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her husband's fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Six months ago, Sayu Komang got into an accident that caused her hand to break. She was helped in her daily activities as a housewife and pig breeder  by her husband. And they can handle it all together. Because the price of 1 kg of pork is getting higher now (it's about 29.000 IDR), Sayu Komang earned a satisfactory profit. 

The Teratai Indah group feels the same, and with their goal to be successful breeders, two of the original group members resigned and continue the business with their own money. They were replaced by a new member.

The Teratai Indah group received their new loan and they decided to use the loan not only for pig breeding, but for farming also. Sayu Komang used her portion of the loan to purchase piglets for fattening and paddy seed. Now is the right time to go to the rice field and start to plant the paddy seed. She works it with her husband. 

Sayu Komang hopes both of her businesses are successful and bring prosperity for her entire family.

Two of the group member couldn’t attend the meeting because of severals reasons.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for fattening and paddy seed.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with four children, all of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income from rental rooms.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring of becoming an importer and also to sell on wholesale only.  She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 41 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetable to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Solita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and selling lamps.

Solita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cocoa

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is aged 36 and living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well, and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calf for one or two years until they have grown up and are healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. He also trades in buffalo as well. He buys buffalo at a low price and sells them to people at a profit. He has been producing milk from, and breeding, the buffalo. His production of milk and breeding procedures have affected his business because he is unable to cope with demand. 

Now he wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and business stable, but he has already invested all his savings into the miscellaneous expenses of dairy farming. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue business smoothly. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new buffalo.

She is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; she is thankful to lenders.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's animal sale business

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres esta casado desde hace doce años y tiene dos hijos Andres vive en la comunidad de Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Andres es agricultor y quiere un credito para la compra de una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios Andres es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Andres has been married for 12 years now and has two children. He lives in the Avichaca community, in an adobe house that he owns. 

Andres is a farmer and is requesting a loan to purchase a motorized water pump to irrigate his crops. 

Andres is the sole source of income for his family, but he is in good health.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Yanal

texts.en: Yanal is a 23-year-old, single man from a village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a humble house. His father works in a restaurant where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family’s needs. Yanal is a student in a local college where he studies Marketing. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses. Yanal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Yanal will be able to complete his studies and find a job faster. Yanal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Yolesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, six in school, Yolesa works hard to support her family.

She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing, raising pigs and food vending. Yolesa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Yolesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from manufacturing bags. Virginia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Susuruka Tumba Group

texts.en: Christine is a group leader, age 42. She is married with nine children aged between 21 and 2 years, and seven of them go to school. The group name is called SUSURUKA, and means “Enjoy” in English. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling in a business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava in order to make more cassava flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest in same business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava in order to make more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and some electric circuits that will allow him to increase his capital and raw materials for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees for her children and invest the balance in her business.

loans.name: Jojina

texts.en: Jojina is a 50-year-old married mother of six children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She has a cocoa garden and also buys and sells cocoa as her main business. She looks after her family using the proceeds from this business and works very hard to have her children attend school. She hopes to expand her business and wants the loan so she can buy more cocoa to sell and realize more income.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell and realize more income.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is an electrician by trade. Her husband has been providing his services to the people of his society as a good electrician for the last ten years. He owns an electrical goods shop where he sells electrical items. He has some basic electrical tools like cables,  switches, fan regulators, lights, etc. at his shop for resale. 

Some tools for his own work were required by her husband. So Asma made contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan for purchasing electricity maintenance tools such as lights, cables, switches, etc. Asma is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's  electricity shop

loans.name: Las Américas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Américas está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, en estos lugares se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades que las que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Las socias son mujeres trabajadoras, amables y carismáticas que luchan por sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Ana, tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos siguientes hijos están en la escuelita, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Ana se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y las vende en la ciudad, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y pollos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus hortalizas.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Las Américas (The Americas) Group is formed of 8 female members and 1 male member, who live near the city of Cuenca. In these places, people work in agriculture and raising animals; people also work in the city in different activities that allow them contribute to the finances of their households. The female members are hard-working, kind, and charismatic women who fight for their families.

One of the members of this group is Ana. She is 34 years old, is separated, and in marriage, had 5 children who are 14, 12, 10, 8, and 3 years old. Her first two children study in high school, and her next two children are in primary school. She doesn’t have her own house, so she lives in a rented property.

Ana works in agriculture. She grows vegetables and sells them in the city. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, and food for her animals. Her goal is to have her own store to sell her vegetables. 

The inset photo is of a member that couldn’t be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and food for animals.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 58 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, salt, etc. to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Indacyemwa Cb Group

texts.en: Josepha is 44 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 18 and 1 year, and five of them go to school. The group is called INDACEMWA, which means “to integrity” in English. The members of the group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their businesses for a better future. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 56-year-old widowed lady with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in farming and has a retail shop. She faces hardships of weather changes and customers who default on payments. Nevertheless, she hopes to buy cows for rearing so as to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Oliver has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra is a 34-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit and vegetable shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges and all seasonal vegetables in his shop. Presently he is interested offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Bushra requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetable from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase stock in her husband's fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Eziresi

texts.en:
Eziresi, a twenty-five-year-old woman, is married with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa gardens and she buys and sells cocoa. She is very hard-working and devotes much effort to her business. When it is off-season, it becomes a challenge for her to earn a living but she still strives hard to sail through.

She wants the loan to buy more cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 48-year-old responsible mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the past 10 years. For many days his rickshaw has not worked properly so he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Khursheed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Khursheed is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 48-year-old hard-working father of six children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in transport and earns a salary. In the future,Patrick hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Patrick needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is Ann. She is fifty years old, married, and living with her four children. Ann is borrowing a loan to help boost her vegetable farming.  She will achieve this by buying fertilizers, pesticides and also hybrid seeds. This will ensure she maintains a consistent supply to the market, leading to more income.   She will be in a position to take care of her expenses, provide balanced and healthy meals for her children, and pay their school fees without difficulties. She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, hybrid seeds and pestcide.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, el cliente vive con sus abuelos en la comunidad de Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Gregorio es agricultor y quiere un credito para compra una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios La esposa de Gregorio lo ayuda fletando disfraces y prendas pero lo que gana no alcanza  para la familia por eso Gregorio requiere su ayuda, ademas el cliente goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Gregorio is married and has five children. He lives with his grandparents in the Avichaca community, in an adobe house that he owns.

Gregorio is a farmer and is requesting a loan to purchase a motorized water pump to irrigate his crops. 

Gregorio's wife helps him by renting out costumes and clothing, but what she earns is not enough to meet the household expenses. For this reason, Gregorio needs your help.

Moreover, he is in good health.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized water pump to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: In the photo the borrower is pictured with her daughter. Sok is 48 years old, a hammock weaver and a married woman with a child living in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been in this work since 2005. Her husband is 50, a Khmer traditional musician. Her daughter is a Khmer traditional singer. Together, they can earn approximately $19 a day. Now Sok would like to request a loan to buy piglets to fatten and resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand her pig fattening and support her daughter to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and resell

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en: Malahat is 32 years old and together with her husband is raising 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming. She helped her parents with this business since childhood and now she runs her own agricultural business. Thanks to Malahat 's hard work, she currently has cattle which she houses in her father-in-law's barns. She also has a plot of land on which she and her husband grow corn and potatoes. Additionally, on a recently purchased plot of land not far from their house, they planted barley and rye. There are also fruit trees on this plot of land. All of her harvested, eco-friendly produce is sold at the local market or to wholesale buyers. Her average monthly income is 170 azn. This year, Malahat did not have enough money to gather the harvest, which is why she turned to AQROİNVEST CU. She is requesting a loan for 1500 AZN to organize plowing and to buy mineral fertilizers. Malahat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business. Specifically, Malahat wants to buy a plot of land where she can grow apples.

loans.use: to organize plowing and to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Las Productoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las Productoras está formado por 11 amigas que viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es visitada por su arquitectura, por su comida y su cultura. Las socias son mujeres trabajadoras que luchan día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar su estabilidad económica para salir adelante, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Esther, tiene 27 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años que en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Esther trabaja todos los días medio tiempo en el arreglo de casas, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su familia y realizar trabajos del campo como la agricultura y la cría de  cerdos, cuyes, borregos y pollos. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos. Su meta es  seguir creciendo en el negocio de sus animales. 
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Las Productoras (The Producers) Group includes 11 friends who live near the city of Cuenca. The city is visited because of its architecture, its food, and its culture. The members are hard-working women who fight day after day in their work to improve their financial stability to move forward. They do this while maintaining the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of the group is Esther. She is 27 years old, is divorced, and in her marriage, had 2 children who are 7 and 5 years old. They attend a primary school in the city. She lives in her own house.

Esther works everyday, spending half her time cleaning houses and spending the rest of her time with her family and doing farm work like agriculture and raising pigs, guinea pigs, sheep, and chicken. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to continue growing her animal-raising business.

The inset photo is of a member that couldn’t be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala,Uganda. She is married with four children and two go to school. She operates a restaurant at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shilling 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, green bananas, beans, flour, cooking oil. Her major challenge includes seasonality which increases operational costs. Her goal is to buy a fridge to start selling soft drinks. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent for her stall.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.  Fe is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 44 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Marjorie has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jillian

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jillian works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Jillian is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Jillian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Emilienne Clarisse

texts.en: Emilienne Clarisse is 40 years old. She is married with three children. She is a student at the university in third year. She has been striving to get the tuition for her studies, but now she is requesting a loan, to pay her tuition fees. She expects that after graduating she will be better-off. She is very thankful to all that will support her in her dream to achieve academic success.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees for her studies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella. She is 65 years old and resides with her family in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs. She and her partner, who works as a mechanic and driver, are working hard, and they are determined to have a better income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Estrella would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippine pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Estrella hopes that her small variety store will soon become a grocery store. She dreams of good health and a prosperous life for her family. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Owees

texts.en:
Owees is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a humble house. His father is a worker and gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Owees is a student in a local college where he studies Political Science. He would like to finish his study and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Owees took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Owees will be able to complete his study and find a job faster. 

Owees appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees  for this semester

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling Natasha products business in the Philippines.

Mildred requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products, such as shoes, sandals, body spray, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers.

Mildred has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as shoes, sandals, body spray, blouses, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 31-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer, a business she started with the hope of employing herself. She faces challenges of customers who delay paying her. She hopes to educate all her children and herself to higher levels of learning.  Annet has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mwihoko Wa Githirioni Women Group

texts.en:
In 2012, a group called Mwihoko wa Githirioni Women Group, located in Limuru, Kenya, was formed so that the members could be trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on resource mobilization and financial management.

Margret, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a member of the group. She is 49 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She does dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and quality seedlings. This will improve her life, since the vegetables will yield more, thus improving income. 

She hopes to use the profits in catering to her family’s basic needs, such as food and shelter.

She is grateful to Kiva and all the lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilzer, planting seeds and pestcide.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия родилась в 1976 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Зулфия 6 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она шьет как национальные женские одежды, так и европейские одежды. Зулфия хочет развевать свой новый бизнес, а для этого она нуждается новой швейной машинке. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала активно. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya was born in 1976. She is married and raising 2 children. Zulfiya started her own business in sewing women's clothing 6 months ago. She sews national women's clothing and European clothing. Zulfiya wants to develop her new business and needs a new sewing machine to do so. She participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women. She actively participated in it. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Farmers in most rural communities in the Kenyenya area of Kenya keep goats as a form of security or insurance in case of crop failure, serious illness in the family, or to pay school fees for children. A goat comes in handy because it can be exchanged for cash to meet these immediate needs. Goats are also culturally part of bride wealth, given from the groom’s family to the bride’s family. 

Mary, a hard working mother of six, has been practicing mixed farming for the past 18 years. Her primary source of income has been selling a variety of food crops and milk. With the little income she makes, she is able to take care of virtually all domestic needs. That includes paying tuition for her six children and meeting their health needs. 

Mary passionately loves dairy goat farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy goat. Through the loan, she will be able to get goat milk that is very important and nutritious. 

Dairy goat keeping is a very important enterprise, especially for farmers with small parcels of land like Mary. Through this loan Mary will be able to sell goat milk, which fetches a high price, to her neighbors and to the local market. Income from the loan will allow Mary to have more self-confidence because she will be able to meet all her needs without waiting for handouts from her husband or getting into debt to make ends meet. 

Mary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 29, is a single mother with a sixteen-year-old son. She is the first-born in a family of six. She describes herself as a simple lady who loves to smile and encourage people around her.

For the past four months Mercy has been running a mobile money shop in Lusaka. It has been successful enough that she has been able to hire two employees. She offers customers money transfer services and airtime sells via her mobile phone. Her business benefits her community because it provides an accessible and affordable financial services platform that allows her clients to send money around Zambia and top up airtime in an easy, quick and safe manner.

Mercy has requested a 5,000 ZMW loan through Zoona so that she can purchase the trading booth that she currently uses to operate her business. This will reduce her operational costs. Her biggest dream is to grow her business so that she can take better care of herself and her son.

loans.use: To buy a Zoona trading booth

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гульбахор 35-летняя замужняя женщина. Она родом из района Вахш, где живет вместе с мужем, двумя дочерьми и сыном. У Гульбахор семейный торговый бизнес. На протяжении 6 лет она вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. В данный момент они на своем магазине продают продукты питания, мороженное и канцелярские товары. С началом учебного года спрос на канцелярские товары вырос, в связи с этим Гульбахор хочет увеличить их ассортимент, чтобы не потерять клиентов и таким образом увеличить объем продаж. Поскольку собственных средств не хватает на закупку товара, Гульбахор запрашивает кредит. Ей не хватает 1400 долларов США. На эту сумму она купит ассортимент канцелярских товаров, а также частично необходимые продукты питания.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a native of the Vakhsh district, where she lives with her husband, two daughters and a son. Gulbahor has a family retail business. She and her husband have been involved in sales for the last 6 years. At the present time, they sell food products, ice-cream and office supplies in their store. The demand for office supplies has gone up since the start of the school year, and, due to this, Gulbahor wants to increase her inventory in order to retain her customers and increase her sales volume. Because Gulbahor does not have enough of her own money to buy the merchandise, she is requesting a loan. She is short 1400 US dollars. She will buy an inventory of office supplies and necessary food products with this money.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of office supplies and necessary food products for resale at her store

loans.name: Dorothee

texts.en:
Dorothee is a mother of seven. She is requesting a loan on behalf of her children, so that all of her children get comfort at their schools without being chased out of classes. 

With the requested loan, she will pay the tuition fees for her children. She is very inspired by the way her children perform in classes; that gives her courage and strength to request the loan, which she believes will help and she is comfortable in repaying.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Kasno

texts.en:
Meet Kasno. Kasno and his family live in West Bandung, a regency area located in a West Java province. To support family living, Kasno runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime to his customers. 

He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall. He was interested to join Ruma because he wanted to explore more business opportunities by adding one more product to the things he sells. 

Now that the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile services in his community on the weekends. 

Kasno is pictured in the photo standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Reni

texts.en:
Meet Reni, a housewife who contributes to her family income by selling mobile phone airtime. Her husband works as a  farmer. They live in Garut, a town in the West Java province that was known as the ‘Swiss van Java’ in the colonial era. 

Reni joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to learn more about mobile technology. She is also planning to seek more business opportunities in the future. Reni hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile services in her community. In the photo, Reni is standing with the Ruma banner. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed, aged 40, is the mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Khursheed's husband has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. He was selling bakery items in large quantities but, according to customer demand, he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour, etc. He does not want to refuse to carry products and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all products which are necessary and consumable in people's daily routines. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well.
