Khursheed has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for his general store. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent his customers' disappointment. Khursheed is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for her husband's general store

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Maria Auxiliadora es habitante de chinandega es casada tiene dos hijos los cuales no dependen de ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de barriles y botellas plásticas, sacos vacíos desde hace 17 años es una mujer trabajadora, humilde que inicia su día de trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de lunes a domingo.



la señora se efuerza por mantener su negocio surtido para mantener su clientela
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora lives in Chinandega, is married and has two independent children.  She sells plastic barrels, bottles and empty sacks and has been in business for 17 years.  She is a hard-working, humble woman who starts her day at 7:00 a.m. and works until 6:00 p.m., Monday through Sunday.

She makes an effort to keep her business stocked in order to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy barrels, containers, and empty sacks to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 34-year-old single woman blessed with three children. She has been operating a clothing shop for a period of four years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Florence was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 15,000 and intends to use this amount to buy additional trousers, shirts, blouses, sweaters, and dresses to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Florence plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, dresses, sweaters and blazers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tuinuke Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, from Tujijenge, Tanzania, is single and a father of one small child. He is aged early 30's. 

For three years now, he has been managing a shop selling phone accessories, a business he has found profitable. Godfrey works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be his first loan cycle to be apportioned among Tuinuke, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
 
Godfrey will use his loan to replenish his shop with new accessories. His desire is to be able to sell more accessories. 

On behalf of his group, Godfrey is so thankful to everyone who will take a portion to support his group.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with new accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 40 years old. He is a second-year student at the university. He is a courageous man with a passion in pursuing his studies, but the only way of getting comfortable in his studies is to request a loan, which will help him. He will repay in installments easily, depending on his capacity.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees at the university.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She operates a kiosk business from home, selling to passersby and neighbors. Bahati cited seasonality and theft as her challenges in the business 

With this KES 15,000 loan, Bahati wants to purchase iron sheets for construction of her house. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Nibunda

texts.en:
Nibunda has operated a cafe business and in addition she sells dry fish, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.

She comes to you again requesting for a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable lending policies. She appreciates for the support and she thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric material to manufacture school uniforms

loans.name: Lukman

texts.en:
Meet Lukman. Lukman and four of his family members live in Sukabumi, a city that is located about 106 km from Jakarta. Lukman is a drinking water and gas retailer. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. Lukman was excited to try selling mobile airtime because he wanted to expand his business. 

Lukman believes that using technology will make the business run more easily. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process bill payments and mobile services for his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business in the future. Lukman is pictured in the photo sitting in his small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to begin selling mobile airtime

loans.name: Muhammad Yazid

texts.en:
Yazid is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in Kudus, Central Java. Kudus was an important holy city in the sixteenth century in Indonesia. Yazid is single and he lives with three family members in the family home. To increase his family's income, he runs a small stall, selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime. 

Yazid joined Ruma about 5 months ago because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He is very excited to sell airtime because it is such a great opportunity to provide mobile services in his community. Yazid hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile airtime transactions in his community on the weekends. Yazid is pictured in the photo sitting in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing sale business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs an additional capital for the growth of his business. For that purpose, Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's clothing sale business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Marivic has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Marivic is committed to rebuild her business, and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear goods to sell.

loans.name: Jean Perre

texts.en:
Jean Perre is 55 years old.  He is married with 8 children between the ages of 16 and 30 years old, with five of them attending school.  He has operated a sales shop for the past 25 years.  

With the loan Jean Perre would like to buy sugar, cooking oil, and books to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and books for sale.

loans.name: Buronga

texts.en: Buronga is 40 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 25 and 6 years, all of them go to school. He has a bar and has been in business for the past 25 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 29 years old. She lives in Chakvi, on the seaside of the Black sea. Teona has a large family: her husband, 5-year-old son, and pensioner parents-in-law. 

Teona and her husband work in the same hotel, Teona as a cook’s assistant and her husband as a security guard. Their existing income is not enough to cover everyday costs, and Teona decided to start an additional business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $600 to begin trading clothes. Teona will purchase clothes at wholesale prices, and she will resell them at higher prices to get additional income and improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes and get additional income.

loans.name: Rizki

texts.en:
Rizki is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in Lumajang, also called “Banana Town”. The regency of Lumajang is about 190 km from Surabaya, the capital of East Java.

Rizki is single and he lives with four of his family members in the family home. To support his family, he runs a small stall that sells stationery, phone accessories and mobile phone airtime. 

Rizki joined Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He is very excited to sell airtime because it is such a great opportunity to provide mobile services in his community. Rizki hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile airtime transactions in his community on the weekends. Rizki is pictured in the photo sitting in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Nabweru Development Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is aged 30 and a member of Nabweru Nansana development group. She is a single mother of 4 children who all attend school. 

She operates a retail shop in Nansana Wakiso district; She started the business two years ago after her husband abandoned the family. With the little savings she had accumulated, Sylvia started up a small retail shop. The shop is steadily growing although she lacks adequate capital to fully stock it like the neighboring shops.

Sylvia and her group members approached Ugafode Micro finance for a loan and Sylvia will use her loan to replenish her retail shop with more sugar, rice, corn flour, bread so that she can boost her business and make more sales.

She faces the challenge of competition from surrounding retail shops which are well stocked with a variety of goods compared to her shop. She is, however, hopeful that with the financial boost she will soon beat the competition. She is hard working.

loans.use: to replenish her retail shop

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a pick-up for the last two years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family. Shehnaz's husband needs to maintain his vehicle because its current condition is not good. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his vehicle. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Shehnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way he can provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Shehnaz also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's pick-up

loans.name: Habeeda

texts.en:
Habeeda, aged 40, is the mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Habeeda's husband is a green grocer by profession and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits and vegetables to his customers, and has been feeding his family through the income generated from this shop. 

The needs of Habeeda's family have suddenly increased and her husband does not have other sources to cope with these needs. He therefore decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. 

Habeeda has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables and fruits. Habeeda thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her husband's fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 54 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Now, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs. So he has decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan so that her husband can buy more vegetables for selling. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Oruc

texts.en: Oruc, 56 years old, is married and has 4 children, all married. Oruc is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and he lives with his wife and elder son’s family in the Bilasuvar region. He is a driver but his salary is not enough to cover his family's needs, so he is raising potatoes on his own land and his wife helps him with this business. Oruc would like to use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for potato production. The profit from the business will be used to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for potato production

loans.name: Cylin

texts.en: Cylin is a responsible mother. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell. By increasing her inventory, Cylin will be able to sell more products and in turn earn more money to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children. His spouse is employed, and she provides additional income for the support of the family. He does a transport business and has been in this business for seven years now.

He will be using the loan to buy spare wheels for his transport vehicle and thereby keep it in good condition for the business. He will be using the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy spare wheels for his transport vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, detergents, cooking fat and cereals to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Tukwatanise is a new group located in rural Ntungamo district. The group's economic activity is majorly crop and animal husbandry on small scale though two of the members own small retail shops to supplement their limited income. 

Annah grows vegetables and tomatoes that are in high demand by the town dwellers. If she plants this season she expects that her harvest will be high and her income will increase. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance for supporting the rural poor. She is hard working and a social member of the community. The lady on the extreme left is a staff member of UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is the age of 40 and the mother of seven children. She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits and vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for the last eight years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits and vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits and vegetables business.

Therefore, Shareefan has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her husband's fruit and vegetable shop.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, and she takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Mariam sells charcoal from home and she has been in this business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She earns additional income from making crafts.

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation challenges.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with six children and all go to school. She has additional family members. She has a shop selling mobile phones and has been in this business for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more mobile phones, charges, batteries and headsets. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include electricity. She aspires to own a fully stocked shop of phones. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and assesories

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre de 59 años de edad, viudo, tiene dos hijas de 40 y 30 años de edad, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es emprendedor, constante, fuerte, responsable, paciente, solidario y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad Cullucachi, este lugar se caracteriza porque durante el periodo incaico su organización se basó en el “ayllu” que durante la colonia se sometió al mando de funcionarios españoles.
Felipe es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara y conoce el español por el comercio. Su trabajo consiste en la cría de ganado, él se dedica a la compra de ganado para su engorde y comercio, explicó que el engorde en confinamiento se refiere alimentar al ganado en corral. "Los confinamientos generalmente comienzan en las épocas de invierno (aunque se lo puede realizar todo el año), cuando terminan las lluvias, pues se van agotando las pasturas naturales o las pasturas cultivadas, Entonces el ganadero saca su producto y los animales para engordarlos en encierro. 
Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida, el necesita realizar la compra de ganado mejorado, de esa manera se beneficiaría económicamente y cumpliría sus sueños.
Es por esos motivos que Felipe solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado mejorado y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 59-year-old man, a widower with two daughters who are 40 and 30 years old. His business is in the cattle market. He is enterprising, reliable, strong, responsible, patient and hard-working. His business is located in the Cullucachi community, given this name because during the Inca period its government was based in the "ayllu" style (traditional Incan form of government) and during colonization it fell under control of Spanish functionaries. 

Felipe is brown-skinned, with short black hair and his native language is Aymara, but he knows Spanish for his business. His work consists of raising cattle. He buys the cows to raise and sell them, explaining that fattening the cattle in confinement means to feed them in a corral. Confining cattle generally begins in the winter (though you could do it year round), when the rains end and they are no longer watering natural or cultivated grazing land. At that time, the cattle herder obtains his supplies and animals to fatten them in the corral. 

His dream is to improve his quality of life. He needs to purchase a better herd and, this way, he will improve financially and achieve his dreams. It is for these reasons that Felipe is requesting a loan to buy better cattle and, with the earnings, improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy better cattle and, with the earning, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Fatenah

texts.en:
Fatenah is a 39-year-old married woman from Beddya, a village near Nablus city. She is a mother for four kids, two sons and two daughters. All of her children attend school. 

Two years ago, Fatenah opened her own business, a kindergarten in the village. It is a very good business and Fatenah loves her job. Fatenah is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy supplies such as toys, chairs, and stationary, for her kindergarten. With this loan, Fatenah will be able to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy some supplies, including toys, chairs, and stationary, for the kindergarten she owns

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has a motorcycle spare parts shop in Kisumu town. He is 35 years old, married to Susan, and together they have been blessed with two children. His spouse also provides additional income for the support of the family.

He plans to use this loan to buy more assorted  motorcycle spare parts to sell . He will be using the anticipated profits to grow his business by buying more spare parts and pay school fees for his children.

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future James hopes to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 37-year-old man who used the previous loan to buy beans for selling.   He deals in farming, mainly maize and beans, and also earns from a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. He faces a problem of limited capital; however, he hopes to build a permanent house. He needs a loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, aged 44 years, is married and has been blessed with two children aged 3 years and 8 months respectively. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a business of selling food to local customers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business. 

With her KES 20,000 loan, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking fat for her food preparation business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking fat for her food preparation business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gladys Ximena

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Caleras hace 5 años, este grupo le ha brindado la oportunidad de estar con sus amigas y pasar gratos momentos, los créditos le ayudan a sacar adelante a su negocio. Vive por el sector de la Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su variada gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora. Gladys tiene 32 años de edad, es separada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en el colegio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar. 
Doña Gladys labora como empleada privada, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a su negocio, ella vende una gran variedad de ropa. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a kind and gentle member who has been part of the credit group, Las Caleras, for five years. This group has given her the opportunity to be with her friends and to make fond memories. The loans will allow her to improve her business.

She lives in the Virgen del Milagro sector of the city Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its historic center and churches, its various foods and its people who conserve their culture and traditions. Gladys is 32 years old and separated, but through her marriage she conceived two children who are now 16 and 14 and studying in school. 

She does not have her own house, so she lives with her parents and shares household expenses. Gladys works as a private employee and, in her free time, she dedicates herself to her business. She sells a great variety of clothing. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Essénam

texts.fr:
-   
Célibataire et mère d’un  enfant  est âgé de  36 ans, Essénam  réside  à  Tokoin. Elle  vend  des produits alimentaires. Elle  s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au  Grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend  à  son  domicile et est ambulante. Essénam sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Essénam, aged 36, is unmarried and a mother of one child residing in Tokoin. She sells grocery items and gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She makes her sales at her home and by hawking. Essénam is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 15 packets of spaghetti, a box of tomatoes, and some grains

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Caleras, este es su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas, vive por el sector de la Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su variada gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora. María tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan económicamente, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la crianza de pollos que vende pelados o en pie, también se dedica a la siembra de verduras que vende en el mercado de la ciudad. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a kind and gentle member who is part of the credit group, Las Caleras. This is her third loan to request alongside her friends. She lives in the Virgen de Milagro section of the city Cuenca. This city is know for the beauty of its historic center and churches, its various foods and people who conserve their culture and traditions. 

Maria is 52 years old and separated, but from her marriage she conceived four children. They are adults, two of them are married and live independently. Her single children work and help out financially. She lives in her own home. Maria works raising chickens which she sells plucked or living. She also grows vegetables that she sells in the city marketplace. She will invest the money from this loan in buying and feeding chickens. Her goal is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy and feed chickens.

loans.name: Lourdes Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora. Lourdes es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Caleras desde hace 3 años, vive por el sector de la Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su variada gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora Lourdes tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto y en esa unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 12, 10, 4 y 1 año, su primer hijo está en el colegio, dos de sus hijos están en la escuela, su esposo labora en la una tapicería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá de manera independiente. 
Doña Lourdes labora como empleada domestica, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos que los vende en pie y pelados, esta actividad le da la oportunidad de poder estar con sus hijos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos. Su meta es tener un taller de tapicería para trabajar con su esposo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a kind and gentle associate who has been a part of the credit group, Las Caleras, for three years. She lives in the Virgen de Milagro section of the city Cuenca. This city is know for the beauty of its historic center and churches, its various foods and people who conserve their culture and traditions.

Lourdes is 29 years old, married and has conceived four children who are 12, 10, 4 and 1 year old. Her oldest child is in middle school and two are in primary school. Her husband works in an upholstery shop. They don't have their own home, so they live with her mother, but are financially independent. 

Lourdes works as a domestic service employee, but she also raises and sells chicken live and plucked. This work has enabled her to be with her children. She will use the money from this loan to invest in the purchase of and feed for more chickens. Her goal is to have an upholstery shop for her husband to work.

loans.use: to buy and feed chickens.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 52 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. She is a farmer in Kisumu where she plants cash crops, such as maize, vegetables, and nappier grass to sell. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years.

She will be using this loan amount to buy farm inputs for use on her farm. These include fertilizer and seeds. She will use the generated profits to improve her farming. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid all her previous loans. In the future, she hopes to improve her farming and be successful.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukokwa est commerçante et vice présidente de la banque communautaire Pacifique, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 47 ans, mère de 6 enfants  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  du salaire du son mari. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes depuis 7 ans. Son conjoint est un conservateur de titres immobiliers. Elle va acheter 35 pièces de pagnes. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: This client, Mukokwa, is a merchant and the vice-president of the community bank Pacifique. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 47 years old, and the mother of six children provided with education. She started her business with funds from her husband’s salary. Mukokwa has been a vendor of ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for seven years. Her husband is a keeper of real estate records. She is going to purchase 35 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She would like to grow her credit and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 35 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies for his university classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy woven floor mats and a dining room set to fix up his house.

loans.name: Plamedi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndagano est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise Plamedi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 2 gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique à domicile dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle va acheter de divers produits manufacturés:le savon en poudre, sardine, riz,  sucre, biscuits, bombons etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Ndagano, is an energetic merchant from the ’banc villageois’ Plamedi. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 35 years old, and the mother of five children, of whom three are in school, and two are very young. She started her business with funds from her husband. 

Ndagano has been the owner of a store in her home in a district in town for three years. She and her husband mutually assist one another. She is going to purchase various shop goods: powdered soap, sardines, rice, sugar, cookies, candies, etc. She would like to grow her credit and to feed her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase various shop goods: powdered soap, sardines, rice, sugar, cookies, candies, etc.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Asteria is 30 years old, married and has three children who are still at school. Since 2001, she has been a tailor making dresses, trouser and repairing clothes. She starts to work at 6:00 am and works until 8:00 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 18th loan request to be apportioned among Ustawi, a two member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credit, Asteria bought a tailoring machine, materials, sewing machine and opened another branch. She managed to repay all loans successfully. She earned a profit which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. Asteria bought a plot of land and built a house. She dreams that one day she will be able to be an international businesswoman. 

She will invest her loan portion to buy materials and sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 19 years young, single and lives at Candura, San Juan, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she  raises pigs and she applied for a loan from Paglaum for capital. 

The business is doing well and she wants to to buy additional hogs and bags of feed. She has now applied for another loan for her funding needs. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family and to be able to set aside savings from sales. Someday, she wants to own a meat shop in the market.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs and bags of feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale and help her family with her earnings

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is driven by passion in selling. She is 43, and a widow in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She runs a store that primarily supports for the family. Everyday she never tires of tending her store. 

Jesusa is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously to provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rossy Rosalia

texts.es:
Rossy es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de Quinua Real.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, alegre, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de Batallas distante a 65 kilómetros, a 1 hora, de la ciudad de La Paz.
Rossy es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el aymara. Sus deseos de superación y con el apoyo de sus padres, ella a logrado realizar estudios superiores en una universidad privada y se encuentra cursando el último año de la carrera de derecho. Junto a sus estudios desde muy pequeña se dedica al comercio de la Quinua y por esos motivos le ha faltado capital de trabajo para su negocio. Su sueño es terminar su carrera y conseguir su título de provisión nacional. Ella necesita realizar la compra de Quinua por mayor para poder seguir pagando su universidad y los materiales de estudios.
Es por esos motivos que Rossy solicita un préstamo para la compra de Quinua por mayor y con los beneficios terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Rossy is a 26 year old single woman, no children, and her business is selling Royal Quinoa. She is enterprising, optimistic, happy, responsible and very hard-working. She developed her business in the community of Batallas, located 65 kilometers or 1 hour from the city of La Paz. Rossy is of medium height, long dark hair, stylish, and her first language was Aymara. Her dreams are to be successful and with the support of her parents, she has been able to attend a private university and she is in her last year studying law. Along with her studies, recently she has started a business selling quinoa and she needs working capital for her business. Her dream is to finish her studies and be able to receive her national license. She needs to make the quinoa purchase at wholesale to be able to continue paying her university tuition and course materials. Therefore she seeks a loan to buy the quinoa at wholesale and with the proceeds finish her university studies.

loans.use: to buy quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Yessica Michelle

texts.es:
Yessica Michelle es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Hola, mi nombre es Yessica Michelle, tengo 18 años de edad, nací en Santo Domingo y actualmente vivo en Lucerna, sector perteneciente al este de Santo Domingo. Tengo un hermano 4 años menor que yo.
Mis padres se separaron prácticamente al nacer mi hermano y mi madre ha hecho el papel de padre y madre.  Labora actualmente en una veterinaria como vendedora, pero lo que gana mensualmente no nos alcanza mas que para lo básico,  alimentación y gastos del hogar. 
Todas esas experiencias vividas viendo a mi madre tomar las responsabilidades de un hogar sola son las que han fortalecido mi deseo de estudiar y hacerme una buena profesional para triunfar en la vida y que mis hijos no tengan que pasar necesidades.
Tengo como meta, desde niña, hacerme una gran Medico Cirujana, para poder ayudar mi comunidad, dándole servicio a las personas más necesitadas que no tienen ingresos suficiente para pagar un buen médico en este país. Llevo 2 cuatrimestres cursados en la Universidad Nacional Pedro Henríquez Ureña (UNPHU), pero por la situación económica que en mi familia estamos atravesando no me será posible continuar de no ser que ustedes me aprueben este préstamo, ya que tengo el deseo y la voluntad de culminar mis estudios pero sin el dinero no me será posible.  Es por eso que necesito el préstamo, de lo contrario no podría seguir estudiando y cumplir con todo lo ante mencionado.
texts.en:
Yessica Michelle is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan to be able to cover her educational costs. This is her story: 

“Hello, my name is Yessica Michelle. I am 18 years old. I was born in Santo Domingo and presently live in Lucerna, a region to the east of Santo Domingo. I have a brother 4 years younger than me.” 

“My parents separated practically at my brother's birth and my mother has had to play the role of father and mother. She works at present as a sales person in a veterinary store, but what she earns monthly will cover no more than the basics, our food and household costs.”

“All these experiences I have lived through and seeing my mother take responsibility for the home are precisely what has fortified my desire to study and make of myself a good professional, in order to triumph in life and see that my children will not have to suffer such necessities.”

“Since childhood, I have had as my goal to become an excellent medical surgeon and to be able to help my community, offering services to the more needy people in this country who lack sufficient income to pay for a good doctor. I have completed two quarters at the Pedro Henriques Urena National University (UNPHU), but due to the economic situation my family is currently passing through, I will not be able to continue if this loan is not approved. I have the desire and the will to complete my studies but without the money, it will not be possible for me to do so. That is why I need the loan; otherwise, I will be unable to continue my studies or achieve all the things I have mentioned.”

loans.use: cover the costs of higher education and attend medical school.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nazokat works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in Tajikistan and has had this business for seven years.

Nazokat has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from Imon International Organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money. In the future, Nazokat hopes to improve her business.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes for the new autumn season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to sell for the new season.

loans.name: Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia Margarita pertenece al banco comunal CUSCO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 35 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando para una empresa privada en el área de cocina, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma a seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
La socia solicita el crédito para la construcción de su casa.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: Margarita belongs to the CUSCO communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco state. She is 35 years old, has 3 children and is married. Margarita alternates her daily activities with working in the kitchen of a private business. She has worked there for some time and wishes to continue working into the future to support her family.  This loan is part of a credit line from Asociación Arariwa in the name of Credi Yapa. The line of credit is awarded to lenders with a good credit history, meeting certain characteristics. The member is grateful for the awarded loan and promises to meet the established payments. The members in the adjacent photograph asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their work.

loans.use: for home construction.

loans.name: Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Chinchero y departamento de Cusco.
 La socia es la Sra. Valeriana, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio  de venta y crianza de ganados, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "Tres Barrios de Ccoricancha".  This bank is located in the Chinchero District which belongs to the Chinchero Province, Department of Cusco.
The partner is Valeriana.  The partner continues to make a living through the business of selling and raising livestock.  The partner has many years working this business which goes well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  The partner also continues to make a living with agriculture.  The partner wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. 
The partner is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.
The other partners make a living with an animal sales business, handicraft sales business, grocery shop business, and food sales business.
The partner thanks those who are part of this dream through this means and promises to follow through with the repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds..

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma  se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norma is in the handicrafts business.  She sells woven goods, sweaters, blankets, and textiles.  She sells different woven items, and she works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for eight years, and it is going very well for her.  

Her dream is to expand her business of selling woven goods and textiles.

She is requesting the loan to buy woven goods, sweaters, and textiles.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy woven goods, sweaters, and textiles.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La socia Viviana tiene un negocio de internet, ella tiene computadoras y da servicio de internet, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de internet. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Viviana has an internet business, with computers and internet service.  She has had this business for several years and it is going well.  Her dream is to grow the business so she is requesting the credit to buy a computer.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to complying with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 50 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the community bank La Imaculada, located in the Kosñipata district, Paucartambo Province, in the department of Cusco.  He is fifty years old, has one son, and is married.  He alternates his daily activities making a living in transportation.  He has made a living in this way for some time and it goes well for him thanks to the good work he puts into it daily.  He wishes to be able to continue working to continue supporting his family.  

He requests the loan for the maintenance of his car.  He is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to complying with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to maintain his car

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is 40 years old and living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing building and houses for the last ten years. He is very expert in his art; he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level, which have been wearing out. He wants to buy new tools and a grinder machine to continue his construction work but he does not have cash in hand. 

Therefore, Haleema has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy tools and a grinder machine for construction. Haleema thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and a grinder machine for her husband's mason work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fridge for his home.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA INMACULADA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Patria, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Teresa   se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos y yucas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “LA INMACULADA” communal bank, located in the Patria district, Paucartambo province, Cusco state. Teresa is a farmer. She has land where she grows plantains and yucca. She works from 6:00 AM until 5:00 PM. She has been farming for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her farmland. She seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. Teresa is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her registration fee and travel expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and labor to enlarge her home and repair the bathroom

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende medias y calcetines en el centro del municipio de Medellín. 

Inicio el negocio hace 5 años y a pesar de su edad y de las adversidades, nunca se ha rendido y ha hecho lo posible para sostener y sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para esforzarse aun más en su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de medias y calcetines en variados colores y estilos con los que actualmente no cuenta y así podrá mejorar su oferta.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Francisco is a man with a lot of enthusiasm to take on the world and to work hard in order to have a full life.

He owns a small business where he sells stockings and socks in the center of Medellin. He began this business five years ago and, despite his age and the challenges he faced, has continued ahead and done everything possible to sustain and provide for his three children.

Francisco wants to grow his supply so that he may improve his sales.  He is therefore requesting a loan so that he can give himself a better opportunity to be independent and to strengthen both himself and his business.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of stockings and socks in various colors and styles that he currently does not carry; this will allow him to improve the variety of products that he is able to offer his clients.

He has great hopes for his business.  He believes that his future can improve considerably thanks to these types of entities that do everything possible so that people can dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy stockings and socks so that he may stock his business and move himself ahead.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 57 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceité entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “La Inmaculada”, which is located in the District of Kosñipata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco. She is 57 years old, in a common-law relationship, and divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery business. The borrower sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. She has been in this business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. The borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, and other products. She is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es: DELMIRA de 21 años de edad  madre de un 1 hijo y convive con su pareja, DELMIRA tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace un 1 año. DELMIRA,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  DELMIRA  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.   DELMIRA se encuentra sentada en el medio se le distingue por su chompa de color gris, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Delmira is 21 years old, in a common-law relationship with her partner, and the mother of one child. For the past year, she has been managing her small business of selling beauty products. Delmira has been able to gain the loyalty of her customers, which helps her to generate income to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own shop where she can sell her products. This would help her generate more income. The loan she received will be invested in the purchase of more products for her cosmetics business. This will help her continue satisfying the needs of her customers, which would allow her to get ahead.

Delmira and the rest of the group members are grateful to Kiva for the loan that has been offered and for the trust that has been placed in them. In the photo, Delmira is seated in the middle and wearing a gray sweater. She bids farewell by promising to accomplish all of the goals that she has set for herself.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: G.s. 20 De Agosto De Taulabe Group

texts.es: Martha, tiene 34 años de edad, está viviendo en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos, reside una aldea del Municipio de San José de Comayagua. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en cultivo de frijoles y maíz y hace 6 años cultiva café, siendo esta actividad su mayor fuente de ingresos. El café lo vende en pergamino a los intermediarios de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es de 5,000 lempiras en forma grupal y lo invertirá en la siembra y limpieza de la finca de café. Considera que le ayudara a mejorar su finca para una mejor producción. Su meta es poder cultivar una manzana mas de café y obtener mayor producción. El grupo se llama 20 de Agosto de Taulabe, y está integrado por 4 personas, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El monto de préstamo grupal es por 14,000 lempiras para siembra y mantenimiento de la finca de café. En la foto se identifican a la izquierda está Juana, sigue María, Martha Leticia y Martha Lidia a la derecha.
texts.en:
Martha is thirty-four years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has four children with her husband. They live together in the municipality of San José de Comayagua. She has always made a living in agriculture, particularly in growing beans and corn. Six years ago, she also began to grow coffee; she felt that this crop would provide her with a greater source of income. She sells the coffee to intermediaries in the area.

The loan she is requesting as part of a group will be invested in the planting and cleaning of her coffee farm.  She feels that this will greatly improve her farm and allow her to have a greater production.  Her goal is to be able to cultivate an additional plot of coffee and to thereby increase her production.

The group is called 20 de Agosto de Taulabe (20th of August of Taulabe) and is comprised of four individuals who make a living in agriculture and who live in the same area.  The group is requesting 14,000 lempiras for the planting and maintenance of the coffee farm.  Pictured left to right in the photo above are Juana, Maria, Martha Leticia and Martha Lidia.

loans.use: to invest in the planting and maintenance of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of new agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 25 años de edad, que desde que terminó sus estudios, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades para sobrevivir, actualmente montó una tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de Sincelejo con el objetivo de poder sacar adelante a su hijo de 10 años.

El negocio lo tiene hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y a su hijo no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Carlos, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 25-year old man who, since he finished school, has worked in different businesses in order to survive.  He has currently opened a small grocery shop in the city of Sincelejo.  His goal is to get his 10-year old son ahead. 

Carlos has had the business for five years.  He works every day from 7:00am to 8:00pm.  Despite the competition in the area, he has had good results.  Carlos generates a sufficient income to make sure his wife and son have everything they need. 

The loan Carlos is requesting is helping him to purchase wholesale stock (pastries, dairy products, cookies, grains and other items).  It will allow him to offer a greater variety of products for sale and to meet the immediate needs of his customers, which will increase his sales and the income he receives for his labor. 

Carlos has a "self-improvement" spirit and a desire to get himself and his family ahead.  His family motivates him to keep working hard and advancing so he can meet his goal of acquiring his own house.  Then, he and his family could enjoy a better quality of life and he could provide his son with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock, such as pastries, dairy products, cookies and other items to supply his store and support his son.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz.

Trabaja como zapatero desde muy pequeño, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia ya que la esposa trabaja como lavandera en domicilios particulares, en ocasiones, porque quien solventa todos los gastos de la casa es él, el credito que solicita es para continuar con las reparaciones de su vivienda Apolinar no tiene a quien mas acudir y lo que gana su esposa no es suficiente
texts.en:
Apolinar is married and has five children. He lives at his parents’ house in the city of La Paz.

Apolinar has been working as a shoemaker from a very young age. This trade allows him to support his family. His wife works occasionally as a laundry woman at private residences in order to cover all of the household expenses.

The loan he is requesting will be used to continue the repairs to his home. Apolinar has no one else to turn to and the income his wife earns is not sufficient.

loans.use: to continue the repairs to his home.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Este es el segundo crédito que solicita Pabla, una joven que persevera por alcanzar sus sueños y cumplir sus objetivos. El crédito anterior le permitió consolidar su emprendimiento de cría y engorde de pollos, Gracias a esto pudo generar un ingreso económico adicional a su hogar, y mejorar las condiciones vida, así como ayudarle a su esposo a  cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia como alimentación y estudios de uno de sus hijos. Este nuevo crédito es la oportunidad de aumentar su producción y venta de pollos, Así que lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos, alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas para su desarrollo. Su próximo reto es contribuir con su esposo en la reparación de su vivienda que está en muy mal estado. Junto a Pabla está en el grupo Doña Lorena que se dedica a actividades comerciales.
texts.en: This is the second loan that Pabla has applied for. She is a young woman who perseveres to reach her dreams and complete her goals. The previous loan allowed her to strengthen her business of raising and fattening chickens. Thanks to this, she was able to generate additional economic income for her household and improve the living conditions, as well as help her husband to cover the basic necessities of their family, such as food and schooling for one of their children. This new loan is the opportunity to increase her production and sale of chickens, so she will invest it in the purchase of more chickens, feed, feed concentrates, and vitamins for their development. Her next challenge is to contribute, along with her husband, to the repair of their home, which is in very bad condition. Next to Pabla in the group is Doña Maria Lorena, who works in commercial activities.

loans.use: to invest in her business raising chickens

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, a sus 60 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de tres hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, comenzó a comercializar mercancía como ropa y cosméticos para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía como ropa y cosméticos al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de Amor y Amistad, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de de gente; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Genoveva manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de mercancia y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Genoveva, at her 60 years of age, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman.  

Being the mother of three children was her main motivation to work tirelessly, day after day.  She always looked for alternate ways to earn a living and support her children. 

Approximately eight years ago, Genoveva started selling merchandise, such as clothing and cosmetics, to all kinds of customers.  Her products are high quality and she sells them at excellent prices, which has allowed her to become well-known in her area and follow a good career path. 

She was motivated to request a loan in order to strengthen her inventory.  She will purchase wholesale merchandise, like clothing and cosmetics, which will allow her to meet the increasing demand during the season of Love and Friendship.  Genoveva has the advantage of living in a well-populated neighborhood, which helps her to improve the income she receives for her labor.  

Genoveva states that her age doesn't stop her from continuing to do what she loves.  That is why she is always giving herself new goals, one of which is to become a large merchandise distributor and provide employment opportunities.  That way, Genoveva will be able to improve her quality of life and the well-being of her family as well as the well-being of those who help her with her daily labors.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise, such as clothing and cosmetics, so she can meet the increasing demand during the season of Love and Friendship.

loans.name: Umoja Nyambari Women Group

texts.en:
In 2014, a group called Umoja Nyambari Women Group, located in Limuru, Kenya, was formed to benefit from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's trainings on group mobilization and financial management and also to help promote their economic growth.

Jane, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a member of the group. She earns her living by running a vegetable farming business.  She is borrowing a loan to boost her farming by buying quality pesticides, hybrid seeds and fertilizer. She looks forward to a bounty harvest and higher income. She believes that this will improve her family’s living standards and go a long way in ensuring food security in her household. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy pestcides, hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Шарофат вот уже 15 лет как занята в сфере сельского хозяйства. Она на протяжении этих лет занимается растениеводством и животноводством. У Шарофат имеется большой земельный участок, на котором она сеет рис, кукурузу и разные овощи. Одновременно она разводит коров и телят. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве две коровы с теленком. Она собирается увеличить поголовье своих скотов. Шарофат берет кредит для купли 4 голов молодых бычков. Период ее откорма скота составляет 60 дней, после чего Шарофат выводит скот на рынок на продажу. От этой деятельности она получает хорошую прибыль. 
Шарофат 49 лет. Она со своей семьей живет в городе Турсунзаде. Ее муж является мастером по ремонту домов и его работа является сезонной, то есть во время зимнего сезона у него почти не бывает заказов. Поэтому он в холодные нерабочие месяцы помогает жене в ее бизнесе животноводства.
texts.en:
Sharofat is 49 and lives with her family in the city of Tursun-zoda. She has been farming for 15 years. During this time she has been occupied with both agriculture and animal husbandry. She has a large piece of agricultural land on which she grows rice, corn and various vegetables, and at the same time she raises cows and calves, and currently has two cows and one calf. Her husband works repairing houses and his work is seasonal, since during the winter there is hardly any demand. Therefore in the cold months he uses his free time to help his wife with her animal husbandry business.

Sharofat is preparing to increase her head count of animals and wants to use this loan to buy four young steers, which she will fatten for 60 days and then sell at the market for a good profit.

loans.use: to buy four young steers to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 47-year-old refugee. She was married and has two daughters and two sons. She is a widow and lives with her children in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. She earns money for her family by growing and selling fruit. She has been working in this field for 24 years and has gained good skills. Her monthly income is 200 AZN and it doesn't cover her big family’s demands. 

Tarana grows fruit in the garden of her house and her children help her to sell them at a local bazaar. She has a grocery stall for rent at the bazaar and pays money every month for it.  She knows everything about gardening and knows customers’ demands. She grows fruit carefully and properly in order to get a harvest of high quality. 

Tarana loves her children and she knows how hard it is to live without a man in the family. Her children support her in everything and she wants to provide them with a good and happy life. She has applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a stall at the local bazaar and not pay for rent every month. This will save money and cover her family’s demands.

loans.use: to buy a stall at a local bazaar

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old, married, and he and his spouse have been blessed with 3 children. He does plumbing services and has been in this business for 4 years now. He fixes water pipes, installs water machines and also sinks. Right now his monthly income is 35,000 KES. In addition to plumbing he also sells clothes.

He will be using this loan to buy plumbing materials for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is Patrick's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy plumbing materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Amílcar

texts.es:
Amílcar de 37 años de edad, es agricultor en pequeño, no estudio en su época de adolescencia. Dice que en el tiempo de guerra fue que no le permitió estudiar.

Hoy en día está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos de sus hijos;  solo dos están estudiando en la escuela de la misma comunidad pero los que dependen de él son cuatro hijos y su esposa.  

Amílcar se dedica de lleno a la agricultura desde hace unos 20 años, su lejanía de la ciudad lo condena a que se dedique únicamente a la agricultura, esto lo aprendió de sus padres mismos que están ancianos y que dejaron todos sus esfuerzos trabajando; pero que se encuentra orgulloso de ser un agricultor. La ciudad está a 15 kilómetros, los caminos son escabrosos solo se puede viajar a pie, en cuanto al trabajo lo realizan entre todas las familias y trabajan unas ocho horas diarias.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes para el frijol, sembrara 21,000 metros cuadrados y la mitad de la semilla que va a sembrar, foliares y mano de obra para la siembra.

El sueño de Amílcar es trabajar para su familia y enseñar a sus hijos a trabajar y a que sean responsables y se siente satisfecho porque todos han aprendido a leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Amilcar is 37 years old. He is a small-scale farmer. He did not go to school during his adolescence. He says that in the time of war he was not allowed to go to school.

Now he is married. His wife does the domestic tasks and cares for their children. Only two of them attend the school in the same community, but those who depend on him are his four children and his wife.

Amilcar has worked in agriculture for about 20 years. His distance from the city limits him to working only in agriculture. He learned this work from his parents, who are senior citizens and who put all their efforts into working. But he is proud of being a farmer. The city is 15 kilometers away, the roads are rough, and he can only travel on foot. With regard to the work, it is done by all the family, and they work about eight hours a day.

The loan that he is applying for from CrediCampo is to buy fertilizers for beans (he will plant 21,000 square meters), half of the seeds that he is going to plant, foliar sprays, and labor for planting.

Amilcar's dream is to work for his family and teach his children to work and have them be responsible, and he feels satisfied because they have all learned to read and write.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for beans (he will plant 21,000 square meters), half of the seeds that he is going to plant, foliar sprays, and labor for planting

loans.name: Tsaka

texts.en:
Tsaka is a married woman with three children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her family.

Tsaka wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vendor in the area. With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit,  such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit, such as oranges, mangoes, and watermelons

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. Mary owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mary operates a vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her area. With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en: Maria Cristina is juggling a business as well as supervising the renovation of her home. Maria Cristina hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of 30,000 PHP. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. Maria Cristina has prioritized this matter as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all of her financing needs in her retail business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He busies himself raising pigs in his own backyard. He has four children and two of them go to college. Now, he is applying for a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. His plan after this loan is to a purchase a second-hand motorcycle unit which he can use for easy transport. He deeply wishes to have a higher quality of life for his children's future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Karen Andrea

texts.es:
Karen es una joven mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora por sus sueños.

Ella trabaja en una marquetería que le dejo su padre, ya que este no pudo continuar con su manejo a causa de quebrantos de salud, Karen decidió tomar el negocio y sacarlo adelante con gran coraje.

El negocio consiste en un taller de marquetería en el cual se hacen trabajos de arreglo de cuadros, fabricación de parqués, espejos, entre otros. 

Ella siempre estuvo familiarizada al negocio y por eso es que se siente tan segura frente a él. 

Ella solicita un préstamo puesto que quiere impulsar su actividad y darle una inyección de capital comprando materiales como madera vidrio y pegantes. 

Este crédito le dará una gran posibilidad de mantner su negocio a flote y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman who is willing to work toward and fight for her dreams.

She runs a marquetry business left to her by her father, who couldn't continue working because of failing health. With great courage, Karen decided to take it over and make a go of it.

The business is a marquetry workshop where she makes marquetry pictures, parquets, mirrors, etc.

She feels sure of herself in this business because she's always been familiar with it.

She is requesting a loan to promote her business and inject it with capital, in order to buy materials such as wood, glass and glue.
