This loan will enable her to keep her business afloat and increase sales.

loans.use: buy material, such as wood, glass and glue to promote her business and improve her income.

loans.name: Benendeta

texts.en:
Benendeta is a married woman with grown children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 52-year-old married man with seven children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, owns rentals, and has a drug shop alongside growing food crops like onions and ground nuts. He faces challenges of bad debtors. However, he has hopes of expanding his retail business to new places and becoming a wholesaler. Richard needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marlene de 33 años de edad, es una persona que estudio 9° grado de educación básica, no siguió estudiando porque prefirió acompañarse algo que sabe que eligió mal; porque ahora quisiera por lo menos el bachillerato, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad no están en la escuela por su edad.

El  negocio de Marlene, es la crianza de animales domésticos, es a lo que se dedica comprando y vendiendo, así ayuda a los ingresos de la casa, con sus ganancias están comprando un terreno para construir; porque hoy en día viven con los suegros, para el negocio le facilita que hay un mercado a pocos kilómetros de sus casa donde aprovecha de comprar y vender, también se involucra el esposo.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cerdos, ya que por ahorita está bueno para ese negocio, así mejorara su negocio y tendrá mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
  
El sueño de Marlene es terminar de comprar el terreno para construir su vivienda y con respecto a sus hijos quiere apoyarlos hasta que sean unos profesionales y dará todo su esfuerzo para alcanzarlo.
texts.en:
Marlene, who is 33-years old, went to school through 9th grade.  She didn't finish school because she decided to get married.  She knows she made a bad decision because now she would like to at least have a high school diploma.  Marlene's husband works in agriculture, and their two children, who are 4- and 2-years old respectively, are too young for school yet. 

Marlene's business is raising domestic animals.  She makes her living buying and selling the animals so she can contribute to the household income.  With her earnings, she and her husband are purchasing a plot of land to build a house on.  They currently live with her in-laws.  Her business is made easier by that fact that there is a market a few kilometers from their house, where she is able to do her buying and selling.  Her husband his involved in the business too. 

The loan that Marlene is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase pigs, which is good for her business.  It will improve her business and give her a better income and thereby a better quality of life. 
  
Marlene's dream is to finish buying the land so they can build their house.  With regard to her children, she wants to support them until they become professionals, and she will put all her effort into making it happen.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, which will be good for her business, improve her business, earn her a better profit and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Misaela

texts.en:
Misaela, age 40, is from Disud, Sindangan, Philippines. She is married with four children. Misaela joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store (general store) business. From her desire to help her husband in supporting their family, she gives her best effort tending her store in order to continue putting food on the table for her family. 

Misaela is now trying to expand her resources; she decided to engage in clothing sales to earn more income. She asked for financial assistance amounting to 50,000 PHP from Paglaum MPC. The loan is intended for clothing sales capital. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and she wanted to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to provide her family a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing and store inventories

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jevie

texts.en:
Jevie, age 23, is happily tending to his little store. He is single and from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. The store is his means of earning a living.

Jevie is now trying to expand his resources; he decided to engage in a clothing sales business. He has applied for a loan for store merchandise and more clothing stocks. He wanted his business to be well known and he wanted to build good business management for his loyal customers. He is a hardworking man and wishes to sustain the store to enable him to offer a good standard of living to the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing and store merchandise

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Arminda De Jesus

texts.es: Arminda de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos una joven de 17 años y 3 varones de 19, 16 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, apoyada en su pequeña venta de sandalias, ropa de dama y caballero y productos de belleza los cuales vende desde hace 8 años de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos a su localidad. Arminda ha hecho todo lo que está en sus manos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, por lo que acaba de terminar de construir su vivienda, pero aun no cuenta con pila, lavadero, baño y servicio sanitario por lo que desea iniciar con la construcción lo antes posible, pero al no contar con los recursos económicos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: taza lavable, ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro, grifos y mano de obra para construir lavadero, pila, servicio sanitario y baño en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Arminda, aged 37, lives in her own home with her four children: a young girl—aged 17—and three young boys—aged 19, 16, and 11.

She is a woman who, through her hard work and determination, has managed to get her children ahead by working as a peddler. She has been selling sandals, clothing for women and men, and beauty products in the hamlets close to her home, for eight years now.

Arminda has done her utmost to give her children a better quality of life. She has just finished building her home; however, the water basin, the washing basin, and the bathroom are yet to be built. For this reason, she wishes to start their construction as soon as possible. Since she cannot afford to do so, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase brick, cement, sand, gravel, iron, faucets, and a flush toilet; and to pay for labor to build a washing basin, a water basin, and a bathroom in her home.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, gravel, iron, faucets, and a flush toilet; and to pay for labor to build a washing basin, a water basin, and a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan  is 45 years old and divorced with a daughter and two sons. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the region of Bilasuvar.  Natavan is a poultry farmer and her monthly income from this business is 220 AZN.

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy more birds to expand her poultry project. Her major problem has been the lack of money to buy birds and feed. She is a hardworking lady who is very focused on her dreams of a better future for her family. Natavan thanks Kiva for their support of her business ventures.

loans.use: to buy more birds to expand her poultry project

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 58-year-old, married man with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells charcoal while at the same time rearing cows and growing tea. He faces challenges of inadequate capital. He hopes to expand his business to new areas in order to generate more income. John needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 71 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con ellos en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Ella tiene su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace 14 años en su casa, donde ofrece productos alimenticios como ser, harina, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, queso, mantequilla, manteca, churros, galletas, entre otros. Antes tenía un trabajo asalariado y con ese dinero estableció su negocio. Ha solicitado a ODEF 6  préstamos con el actual que es por 8,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en el negocio surtiendo de granos básicos, churros, golosinas, productos lácteos y otros con el fin  aumentar sus ventas y clientes. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en: Doña María is 71-years old, single and has two children who she lives with in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Doña María has had her own grocery business for the last fourteen years.  The business is set up in her home, and she sells foodstuffs such as flour, beans, sugar, bread, milk, cheese, butter, lard, "churros," cookies and other items.  She previously had a salaried job and with that money opened her grocery business.  Doña María has requested six loans from ODEF.  The current loan is for 8,000 lempiras (USD $400), which she will invest in stocking up her business with basic grains, "churros," sweets, dairy products and other items.  She wants to increase her sales and her customer base.  Doña María's dream is to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, "churros," sweets, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Gatarakwa Great Vision Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Gatarakwa Great Vision group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from trainings on savings mobilization, enterprise creation and financial management.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Veronica. She is 40 years old, married, and living with her children. She practices vegetable farming, growing kale, spinach, tomatoes, and cabbages and also farming poultry. 

She is borrowing a loan to buy hybrid seeds and chicken feeds. She believes that the loan will assist her in increasing her income level, thus allowing her to feed her family, provide good clothing, and pay school fess for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the support they have given members.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and chicken feeds

loans.name: Firidun

texts.en:
Firidun is a 30-year-old refugee. He is married with a daughter and two sons. The family has lived in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement for a long time and the parents try to provide their children a bright future and education. The mother of the family earns money working as a teacher and Firidun is a gardener. He raises seasonal vegetables and greens in the backyard and sells them. He earns 200 AZN monthly and this is the main source of income for the poor family.

Firidun has sold his harvest next to his house in a small grocery for 4 years and local people attend it very often. They know that Firudin sells quality and fresh produce.

Though he loves gardening very much, the income from the grocery doesn't cover the family’s demands. Firudin applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to purchase a small parcel of land for more vegetables and fruits. He wants to make a high income and help his children live a normal life, as it was before they became refugees.

loans.use: to purchase a small parcel of land for more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas used the previous loan to pay school fees. He still does farming, mainly cassava, and earns additional income from a pension. He faces challenges of price fluctuation of agriculture inputs. He desires to educate all of his children to higher levels of learning. Thomas needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his childre

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is married and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconut selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Tweyambe Women Farmers Group

texts.en: Mary is married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a member of Tweyambe Women Farmers Group. Mary is a farmer, growing crops such us rice, maize, onions, and beans. She has been in commercial farming since 1980. She has been in the farming business in order to raise an income for the family. Mary has a dream of getting more profits from farming. Mary wants money to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for labor

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Nancy. She is married and a mother of nine children. She is 43 years old. She is a dairy farmer, and she has been in this business for the last nine years. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management, enabling her to manage her farming enterprise effectively. She intends to expand this enterprise by buying quality fodder to enhance milk production. This will enable her to keep up with milk demand in Nakuru. She hopes for improved income which will help her meet her family's needs. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fodder.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a cloth-selling business for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Kalsoom has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of different cloths for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she hopes to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy stocks of different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Radharani

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Radharani is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She is married to Basudeb and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). All of her children go to school and are in different grades.

Radharani‘s husband is a fruit seller who sells fruit in the market. Radharani decided to give support to her husband financially. Thus, she wants to sell cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she will be able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to start her business by selling milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese.

Radharani seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With this business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Radharani will be able to reach her goal, which includes constructing a new and better house and to provide a better education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for this monetary support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Marubala

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Marubala hails from the village of East Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.  She is married and a mother of one school-going son. He is in grade 11. 

Marubala's husband is a green grocer. He purchases vegetables from the wholesale market and sells in the local bazaar. To give financial support to her family financially, Marubala started livestock breeding to provide proper food, health and education. She rears a dairy cow and sells the milk in her locality. Now she decided to grow her business.

She went to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow milk in the rural belt, so she believes her monthly income will increase with the growth of her business. The loan will enable Marubala and her family to have a secure and dignified life and the best education for her son.

She is thankful to the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to grow her milk supply business.

loans.name: Nadiah

texts.en: Nadia used the previous loan to buy clothing to sell. She is still in the same business of selling clothes in a busy market. She faces the challenges of competition and has hopes of having a well-built permanent house. Nadia needs a loan to buy bed sheets, blankets and curtains to sell

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, blankets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida is a hardworking, supportive woman from Dhupguri, West Bengal. She is 45 years old and married with three children. Sahida is a homemaker who looks after her children, does all the household work and in her spare time, helps her husband in his agricultural work. 

Sahida’s husband is a farmer who grows and sells paddy in the local market. He is engaged in farming, growing rice and other vegetables. He has farmland, which is his investment and inheritance from his parents. He struggles hard to grow good quality products. He is a person who is looking to his family's wellbeing. Moreover, his children and wife are his greatest motivation in life and they are also who he fights for in order to provide them with a good lifestyle. He wants to grow more paddies in order to earn more profits. 

So, Sahida requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for rice cultivation. She believes that the loan will help provide all of her husband's farming needs and in that way, obtain higher revenues.  Thus, her husband will be able to improve the wellbeing of his family.

Sahida wants to upgrade their present business with the profit earned and she is thankful to her lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 24-year-old hardworking woman and a mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. By this time, she has become popular for her fine stitching. She uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues and generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali hails from Dhupguri. She is 20 years old, married and a housewife.  She and her husband Subal, together, are raising two children (one son and one daughter).  Her children are too young for school. They live in a small village in East Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district in their small mud house. 

Dynamic and hard-working, Shefali's husband is running a business growing seasonal vegetables.  Though a housewife, Shefali helps her husband in every way and especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal nature of his job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household.  Now, they have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland. With the addition of cultivation of paddy, he will be able to increase his monthly income as paddy is a staple food in West Bengal. It is an all-season crop and is in high demand in the market.  They are looking for a loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies.

In order to help her husband, Shefali has applied for a loan from BJS.  She wants to use the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start cultivation.  The loan will help Shefali keep her family afloat and stable financially. She dreams of constructing a better and decent house for them in the future with the profit from the business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a wood-selling business. She sells wood to the people of her community, as they use it in making the handles of knives, for furniture and for burning purposes. Over time, Mumtaz has become famous in her area for providing good quality wood of different types. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase bundles of wood of good quality and some cutters. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wood of good quality and some cutters.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 50-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children. She started the business of buying cloth from the city and selling it in her locality. The reason why she started this business was that it was very difficult for her to meet her family's household needs with the insufficient income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in providing for the family. Today, she plays a vital role in supporting her family. She is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of cloth in a larger variety, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She hopes that her business will flourish in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of cloth in a larger variety

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Irene operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Chesa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand on the photo is Nicodemus. He is a member of the Chesa Self Help Group. He is 60 years old, married and a father of four.

He does bee keeping, and with the training he got from Hand in Hand he has been able to commercialize his honey business. He is able to get more profits from his business now than previously.

He would like to purchase more bee hives to expand his honey business and to ensure that he can supply more honey to the market. He hopes this will greatly boost his income and enable him to cater for his family's needs, such as food and clothing.
 
He is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to use it wisely and pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola who used her previous loan to buy more chicks to rear and sell is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in poultry where she rears chicken and owns a bar as her side income. She started this business to generate more income to sustain her family. Her main challenges are poultry diseases that attack her chickens and cause their death, and inadequate capital to buy equipment. She has hopes that in the future, she will have a big farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks to rear and sell.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to sell.

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en: Sabran is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns four cows. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her sixth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Christ The King Group

texts.en:
Josinta is 28 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is a member of Christ the King Group, where members guarantee each other in order to access credit. 

Josinta runs a retail shop in which she sells sugar, salt and soap among other items, and she has been in this business for five years. She wants the loan to buy cassava flour, sugar, rice, soap, soda and salt to sell.

She began the business to sustain herself, but now she dreams of educating her children and having a better life.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, sugar, rice, soap, soda and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anjama

texts.en:
Anjama is 38 years old. She is from Dhupguri, a remote region in Jalpaiguri district. She is a widow who lost her husband a few years back.  Anjama is also a very hardworking woman and a farmer. She pursues the domestic duties in her home and is involved in agricultural activities. After the death of her husband, she began looking after his agribusiness. She grows potatoes, beans, bottle gourds, chilies etc. She learned agricultural activities from her husband.

Now she wants to cultivate paddy in her farmland, which is an all-season crop in much demand in West Bengal.

So, she is applying for financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. to start to cultivate paddy. Anjama hopes she will get an excellent result from this. 

Anjama also aspires to purchase more agricultural lands in the future with the profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Caroline operates a food-making business, making comestibles like beans and chapatti (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Mrusi

texts.en:
Mrusi is a married woman who lives together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

For the past three years she has been operating a charcoal selling business, and she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal and paraffin for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal and paraffin for resale

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Matia wants to start a vegetable and fruit-selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw to sell. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju hails from Dhupguri. She is 39 years old and works tirelessly on her farm rearing goats. She lives with her children and husband in their own kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw-made). She sends her children to school and wants them to lead their lives with a good education. 

Her husband is associated with the medicine business.  To support her husband financially, she began rearing livestock like goats. She buys baby goats, raises and fattens them, and at the time of sale, she charges a price according to the weight acquired by the animal. Sometimes she also sells goat milk in her neighborhood to generate additional income. 

Anju is a hardworking, thriving woman, who does her best every day to get ahead, motivated by her family. She is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase goats to fatten and sell. Anju hopes to advance one step closer towards the fulfillment of her principal dream to provide her children the opportunity for a better education and good living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her business.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a hardworking farmer from Nyaruhandgazi, Mbarara. He is happily married with four children aged between 10 and 20 years old.

He ensures quality education for his children in spite of not having any fixed employment. The youngest child is now in Primary Four while the eldest is in secondary school.
 
He achieves all this thanks to his hard work in agriculture and the financial assistance he has been getting from UGAFODE. Because of the diminishing value of money, the school fees are increasing day by day. Providing for his children's education is very hard, given that he is also the sole bread winner in the family.

Asaph's business is also struggling because of diseases, in particular ‘banana wilt', and he faces competition from fellow business men who have sustainable sources of income. All this has limited his income. 

He will use the loan to pay for tuition for his children so that they are able to complete their third term. This would have been really hard if he had had no access to finances from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To pay for his children's tuitiion

loans.name: Asalata

texts.en:
Asalata is a rural young woman of only 19 years. She is married to Narayan, a 25-year-old farmer. They are blessed with one toddler (a son). They live in North Bairatiguri, a small village in Jalpaiguri district. 

Her husband is a very hardworking man. He cultivates his ancestral land. He mainly grows paddy rice. He thinks his business goes well because he has a lot of knowledge about its production and always offers quality products. He supplies his paddy and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demands, Asalata is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover the operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

Asalata is very thankful for Kiva and BJS. With this investment, at the end of the harvest, he will be able to have a better production, and with his earnings, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

Her dream is to construct a better house for them with the profit from the business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is a Ugandan male, 45 years old, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with children. He deals in a transport business around Kagadi, a business he started in order to earn a living. He also owns a retail shop and a restaurant that’s being supervised by his wife. His dream is to build a permanent house and educate his children. He wants a loan to buy vehicle tires to serve his clients better.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires to serve his clients better.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and married with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise, and he has been in this business since 2012. He also owns a mobile money shop for additional income. 

He began the business in order to cater for his family's needs, and he dreams of expanding. Joseph wants the money to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and general merchandise.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 40-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for the past 10 years. She has two cows for milking. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of two and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  This is her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support. Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow.  She wishes to grow her business to bear the daily expenditures of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises es viudo y ha quedado a cargo de 3 hijos Moises vive en Huancollo en una casa de adobe  que le pertenece a sus familiares, la casa tiene luz y agua, Moises es productor de leche y quiere el credito para comprar una vaca lechera  para mejorar sus ingresos MOises es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en: Moises is a widower and has been left in charge of three children. Moises lives in Huancollo in an adobe house that belongs to his relatives. The house has electricity and water. Moises is a dairy farmer and wants the loan in order to buy a dairy cow so he can improve his earnings. Moises’ work is the only source of income in his household, but he is in good health.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru:
Мичгона 22-летняя незамужняя молодая девушка. Она с 18 лет начала зарабатывать на жизнь путем предоставления услуги швеи. Мичгона у своей старшей сестры научилась этому делу и после окончания школы самостоятельно начала работать. В данный момент она работает в ателье своего города. Мичгона живет в городе Вахдат с родителями и старшей сестрой. Она ответственная и добропорядочная девушка. Мичгона берет заказ только на пошив женских национальных платьев. Ее услуга всегда востребована. 
Сейчас Мичгоне не хватает тканей для шитья и других необходимых швейных принадлежностей. Чтобы не потерять клиентов и продолжить деятельность она запрашивает кредит. Мичгона надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mijgona is a 22-year-old single young woman.  She has been making a living since she was 18, providing sewing services.  She learned her trade from her older sister, and started working independently as soon as she graduated from school.  At the moment, she is working in a sewing shop, in town.  Mijgona lives in the city of Vahdat with her parents and her older sister.  She is a responsible and respectable young woman, and she only takes orders to sew traditional women's dresses.  She receives a high demand for the services she provides. She currently does not have enough fabrics for sewing, and she also needs to buy other necessary sewing supplies.  She is taking this loan because she doesn't want to lose any customer, and because she would like to be able to continue her activity.  She is hoping to receive some financial support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other necessary sewing supplies.

loans.name: Muthoki

texts.en:
Muthoki is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Muthoki operates a fruit stall business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation cost in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a thirty-three year old man married with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells second hand clothes and this is his sole source of income. He works hard to look after his family especially to ensure that he gets basic needs of life for his family. He is affected by seasonality, which at times lead to low proceeds from his business. He hopes to build a house in Bundibugyo town and become a landlord in the future. He wants a loan to buy more clothes to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
YANELA mujer de 27  años de edad - vive en San Antonio con sus 2 pequeños hijos- es separada con el padre de sus hijos a consecuencias del alcohol.
YANELA se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mas de un año- con el fruto de su trabajo, ella ha podido solucionar gastos de la casa, alimentación y salud de sus hijos - afortunadamente sus hijos están en la escuela y crecen sanos y felices.
este es el segundo crédito que YANELA gestiona en FODEMI y se siente contenta y satisfecha de contar el apoyo de esta institución.
con el crédito recibido, ella comprará ropa de niños-(es la que mas se vende)- blusas - pantalones - sabanas y toldos mosquiteros - de esta forma se abastecerá de mercadería y venderá mas a sus clientes.
menciona que gracias a este negocio puede tener un nivel de ingresos que le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades y la de sus hijos.
se siente muy contenta por estar trabajando con estos créditos - que verdaderamente ayudan a la gente pobre de nuestro país.
YANELA espera tener en poco tiempo acondicionado un espacio en su casa para servir mejor a los clientes de su comunidad y pueblos vecinos.
texts.en:
Yanela is 27 years old and lives with her two young children in San Antonio. She is separated from the children's father due to alcohol problems.

Yanela has been making a living selling clothes for over one year. With her earnings, she has been able to cover household costs, and pay for food and healthcare for her children. Yanela's children are in school and, fortunately, growing up to be healthy and happy.

This is Yanela's second loan from FODEMI and she feels happy and satisfied to be able to count on this support.

This loan will be used to buy children's clothes (the highest selling items), blouses, trousers, bed sheets and mosquito nets. This will allow the borrower to stock up on merchandise and sell more to her customers.

Yanela says that, thanks to her business, she earns and income in order to pay for necessities for her and her children.

She is very happy to be working with these loans, which really do help poor people in Ecuador.

Yanela hopes shortly to set up a space in her house where she can better serve the customers from her community and neighbouring town.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes (the highest selling items), blouses, trousers, bed sheets and mosquito nets. This will allow the borrower to stock up on merchandise and sell more to her customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Mariam operates a clothes selling business where she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Mariam dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es:
Maritza Antonia tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, una zona rural del centro poblado Nueva Arica, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Maritza Antonia se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, hace 7 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; ella solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de ropa para la temporada de Primavera, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en lo concerniente a prendas de vestir de la temporada, esto con la finalidad de poder satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas; mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza Antonia is 55 years old. She has a partner and children and lives in a house owned by the family. The family lives in a rural town called Nueva Arica, in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province. This is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Maritza has been making a living selling clothes for men, women and children for seven years. Her business is in her home. Maritza is applying for a loan in order to invest in working capital: she will use it to buy clothes for the spring season. This will allow Maritza to have a great variety of seasonal clothes to sell in order to satisfy her customers' demands. She will then increase sales and profits and, as a result, have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy clothes for the spring season.

loans.name: Maria Noelia

texts.es:
Maria, a sus 55 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 10 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
At 55 years old, María is charismatic and helpful. She makes a living working at her own business, a grocery store that she started following a need to earn an income to help her family to get ahead.

In spite of difficulties, María has had the strength and determination to rise up and move forward. She has now been working at the business for ten years.

María's goal in life is to continue moving forward and so she wants to strengthen her business by adding more stock, such as groceries, grains, fried snacks, fizzy drinks, and other basic staple goods. With these items, María can offer her customers better quality goods and better service. She can then make a notable increase to sales and to the income she makes from them.

María says that her greatest wish is to continue expanding her business and, in the future, she would like to turn it into a supermarket where customers can find everything that they need. This way, María can improve profitability and can offer her family a higher quality of life.

By supporting this loan, you will be help Colombian women to get ahead!

loans.use: to buy stock for her business, including groceries, grains, fizzy drinks, fried snacks, liquors, and other consumable goods; these items will stock up María's business and improve her work.

loans.name: Munir

texts.ru:
Муниру 49  лет. Он женат имеет 3 детей. Он работает  инженером в одном из цеху. Дети  Мунира уже взрослые и каждый из них имеет большие расходы. В  этом году поступает его старший сын он также желает своим детям дать хорошее образование и что бы они получили достойную работу. Зарплату которую он получает  недостаточно сразу оплатить за обучение сына, поэтому он  обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  Мунир в первую очередь хотел бы поблагодарить МДО Арванд за поддержку. В очередной раз Мунир берет  кредит для оплаты за обучение.   
Без помощи этих (кредит)средств,  было бы трудно для его сына  поступить и окончить своё образование, поэтому Мунир хочет помочь своему сыну и с помощью кредита оплатить его обучение в университете.
texts.en: Munir is 49 years old and he works as an engineer in a local factory.  He is married and the father of three children who are getting older and whose expenses are increasing.   His oldest son is enrolling at university this year.  Munir wants to give a good education to his children, so that they all have decent jobs.  Munir's salary is not enough to pay for his son's tuition, which is the reason why he has contacted MDO Arvand to get a loan.   First and foremost, Munir would like to thank MDO Arvand for granting him a previous loan.  With this second loan, he will pay his son's tuition.  Without this loan / financial support, it would be very difficult for Munir's son to enroll at the university and to complete his studies.  Munir really wants to help his son and to be able to pay his tuition fees, thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in motorcycle transportation and also does farming as a side income activity. He started the business in order to raise funds to look after his children and eradicate poverty. He faces a difficulty of poor roads that cause him constant mechanical break downs. In spite of this, he desires to own more motorcycles and educate his children so that they can go to higher institutions of learning.

Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Phoern's Group

texts.en:
Phoern, 46, is a married father living in a rural village of Bakan district of Pursat province. He has three children who are in school. He is a hard-working farmer who has grown rice for 20 years. With hard work, he can earn about 20,000KHR per day and save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Phoern’s group of two, who have been members of VisionFund for two loan cycles. Phoern successfully used the past loans to gradually improve his family’s standard of living. Now he and his group member are applying for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland, and will use a portion of the loan to spend on land plowing and labor. He hopes to grow more rice and increase his family’s income so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Ekomefeemo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Ekomefeemo. It is composed of three women who wish to make a big impact in their respective businesses. They just started their second loan cycle after finishing the first cycle without issues. They all have been living in the same neighborhood for years and maintain good relations in the spirit of togetherness. They mainly work selling bags, gari (cassava flour), beans, rice and palm oil.

Lydia, 40 years old, is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four; all boys. She sells bags on a pavement in Teshie. She needs this loan to buy more bags and sell to her customers. The group will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags and sell to her customers for her retail business.

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani is a homemaker of 23 years who looks after her husband and two sons. Her sons receive an education and are in grade 6 and grade 4, respectively.  They live in a small mud house in College Para in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri District. 

The couple has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Mamani's husband cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they have decided to cultivate a crop that is profitable and an all season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Thus, Mamani has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Mamani to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize their cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest.  They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of upgrading her house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizer and seeds for growing paddy.

loans.name: Miriam Elisbet

texts.es:
Miriam Elisbet tiene 28 años, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos de 04 y 08 años de edad. Vive en casa de familiares en condiciones sencillas, junto a su esposo e hijos. su familia es muy unida; vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Miriam Elisbet se dedica a la venta de picarones, champus y cachangas en una esquina de la cuadra en donde vide desde hace 02 años. Su esposo percibe ingresos como chofer en la ruta Chiclayo – Saltur y cuenta con una mototaxi que la entrega a un tercero para trabajar. Ella necesita del crédito para la inversión en compra de mercería para cocina, realizar arreglos en cocina de casa para poder realizar la preparación de los alimentos que ofrece al público con mayor facilidad y comodidad, dandole de esta manera una mejor calidad en su producto y con ello tendrá una mayor y mejor atención e ingresos y por ende mejoras en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam Elisbet, 28, has a common-law husband and two children, ages four and eight.  She lives with relatives in a simple house with her husband and children.   The family is very close and lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock farming in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Miriam Elisbet sells snack foods, fritters and shampoos on the corner of the block where she lives and she has been in business for two years.  Her husband works as a driver along the Chiclayo - Saltur route and also rents out his motortaxi.  She is in need of a loan to buy kitchen utensils and renovate her kitchen to make it easier to make the food she sells.  This will increase the quality of her products and attract more customers so she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate her kitchen to make cooking easier.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 49-year-old widowed woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is the head of her family with the full responsibility of looking after her children. She works very hard in her business of foodstuffs and hopes to expand her business rapidly. Seasonality is a key challenge to her but she still strives hard to see that she survives. She wants the loan to buy more food stuffs for sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in farming in addition to earning a monthly salary. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning. His greatest challenge is unpredictable seasonal changes. Robert needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Manoara

texts.en:
Manoara is a very energetic young woman of 22 years from Dhupguri, a town located in Jalpaiguri district. She has a secondary education.  Due to the lack of economic resources of her parents, she was not able to peruse a higher education.  She is now married to Abul.

Manoara's husband Abul is a mason by profession.  Abul’s income is inconsistent, thus they face difficulties to manage their household expenses.  She is hardworking and responsible with a great desire for personal as well her family's success. She runs a grocery store.  She sells food products, grocery items in her shop such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, detergent etc.

Now she aims to extend her business to obtain a better income. Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  The objective for her loan is to invest in buying more grocery items so she can give financial sustenance to her family.

Manoara is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her existing grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale to meet demand for the "Amor y Amistad" season in Colombia.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Nelly, a 26-year-old farmer from Kericho, which is a small, rural town in the Rift valley of Kenya. The mother of three is interested in many farming activities. Currently, she is doing dairy farming, tea farming and horticulture. She has put the last 10 years of her life into agriculture. She loves it. Her main sources of income are milk and tea. She makes extra money on the side through venturing into other personal businesses. She is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustainable returns! This enables her to enjoy profits and expand. 

Nelly is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device that she will use in cutting straw or hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed her cows. Nelly has been having problems feeding her cow and most of the time her cows refuse to eat but through this loan, the chaff cutter will aid the animal's digestion and prevent the cows from rejecting any part of the food. Through proper feeding, her cows will produce more milk and hence increase income through selling milk. Nelly believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. A healthy cow is more productive, and that means more income for the owner. Through increased income from milk selling, she will provide a better life for her family and afford her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Grupo Trabajadores De Chuitzanchaj Group

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza José de 26 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, 1 ya tiene familia aparte y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad, (José es la que se encuentra de primero de derecha a izquierda y tiene puesta una camisa cuadriculada)

La actividad que le realiza es la siembra de de café, frijol y maíz, el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de café y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad, el siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El se a convertido en un gran ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas emprendedores se han unido a José para emprender juntos con el para tener éxitos en un futuro y tener ingresos económicos para sus familias.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de café. Una de las metas de José es incrementar su producto de café y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de café.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed with hands that enjoy working on it and taking care of it.  Men who are dedicated to this work over many years and for a lifetime carry out a dignified occupation.  Without farmers dedicated to cultivating it, the land would not bear the fruits that generally support an entire generation.  This is the work that is done by José, 26, who has three children, one who has his own family and two who are excellent students at the community school (José is the first from the right in a checked shirt).

His activity is growing coffee, beans and corn which he chose to do because the land and climate is apt for coffee growing.  It also generates a good income for him.  He also works as a day laborer in his community, always with the aim of helping his neighbors.

José has become a great example in his community and therefore a group of entrepreneurs has joined with him to work together to become successful in the future and earn an income for their families.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.  One of Jose's goals is to increase coffee production and improve his handling of the crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Dolca

texts.es: Jefa de hogar vive con su hijo, estudiante de primaria, y sus padres, adultos mayores, a los que cuida. Comerciante de mucha experiencia, con más de 13 años de haber iniciado su actividad productiva, que nació a raíz de cubrir necesidades básicas de ella y su hijo.  El negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante, sale a vender su mercadería cuando uno de sus familiares le ayuda a cuidar a sus padres, sin embargo esta no es una limitante, ya que también muchos de sus clientes llegan hasta su casa para solicitar sus productos, tiene muy buen trato con sus clientes, y esto hace que la prefieran, vende blusas para dama y camisas para hombre, ropa interior, además de joyería fina. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para reforzar su actividad, comprando mercadería y prepararse para la temporada alta de los comerciantes. Los créditos anteriores le han permitido crecer, superarse y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This head of household lives with her son, who is in primary school, and her elderly parents who she takes care of.  She has much experience, having begun her business over 13 years ago in order to support herself and her son.  Dolca works as a street vendor and goes out to sell when a relative can help care for her parents.  She also has many customers who visit her at home to buy her products, because of her good customer service.

Dolca sells women's blouses, men's shirts, underwear and fine jewlery.  Now she is requesting a loan to reinforce her business and buy merchandise for the high season.  Her previous loans have helped her grow, develop and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy women's blouses, men's shirts, underwear and fine jewelry.

loans.name: Raquel Marisol

texts.es:
Raquel de 33 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, se dedica todo el tiempo a su negocio. Actualmente vive alquilando en un mesón y ahí la acompaña solo su compañero de vida quien desempeña un empleo como motorista en la Centro de Gobierno.
Raquel está iniciando su negocio (tienda), ya tiene 5 meses de haberla aperturado y cuenta con productos de consumo alimenticio y de uso personal.  

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más productos como: golosinas, galletas y bebidas, ya que este mes ha comprado una refrigeradora y tendrá más productos para acompañar sus golosinas.

Raquel quiere en un futuro tener una tienda mucho más surtida de productos, ya que las ventas son muy buenas y es que no cuentan con competencia cercanas.
texts.en:
Raquel, 33, is a very hard-working entrepreneur who dedicates all her time to her business.  She currently lives in a rented inn with her common-law husband who works as a driver for the central government.  Raquel started her business (a store) five months ago and sells food and personal care products.

The loan will be used to buy more products such as sweets, cookies and beverages since she bought a refrigerator this month and will have more merchandise to accompany the sweets.

Raquel wants to have a well-stocked store in the future as sales are very good and she has no competition nearby.

loans.use: To buy more products such as sweets, cookies and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more earrings, necklaces and bracelets. The Christmas season is coming and it is necessary to have a good selection of everything in her locale so she can improve sales in December.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao de 73 años de edad,  es una persona trabajadora y comprometido con el bienestar de su familia y el desarrollo de la comunidad, logro estudiar solamente tercer grado de educación básica. Pero con su iniciativa a logrado salir adelante con sus actividades productivas. Está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar; actualmente viven con él dos hijas y tres nietos.

Estanislao trabaja en cultivos de hortalizas bajo invernadero desde hace 10 años, cultiva tomates, chiles, pepinos y berenjenas; esta actividad la aprendió gracias a técnicos que capacitaron a un grupo de agricultores de su comunidad, en proyectos comunales. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la agricultura tradicional, cultivo de granos básicos, estos al aire libre.

El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos, materiales y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de hortalizas bajo invernadero. La adquisición de insumos la realiza al inicio de cada ciclo productivo, por gastos en mejoras de la infraestructura (invernaderos), se ha quedado sin recursos para comenzar a cultivar.
Su sueño es tener mayor infraestructura protegida (invernaderos), para incrementar su producción y poder comercializar las hortalizas en un mercado formal donde se obtienen mejores precios.
texts.en:
Estanislao is 73 years old. He is a hardworking person and committed to his family's well being and the development of the community. He was able to go to school only through the third grade of primary school, but on his own initiative was able to get ahead with his productive activities. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. Right now, two daughters and three grandchildren live with him.

Estanislao has worked growing vegetables in a greenhouse for 10 years. He grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers and eggplants. He learned this activity thanks to technicians who trained a group of farmers in his community in community projects. Previously, he worked in traditional agriculture, growing basic grains outside.  

He will use the loan to buy materials and to pay for labor for the vegetable crop in the greenhouse. He acquires materials each productive cycle. Due to expenses from improving infrastructure (on the greenhouses), he has no resources to start growing.   

His dream is to have more protected infrastructure (greenhouses) to increase his production and be able to sell the vegetables in a formal market where there are better prices.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to grow vegetables in a greenhouse.

loans.name: Luchar Es Vivir Borbon Group

texts.es:
CARMEN vive en Borbon con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. sus esposo trabaja en su propio taller de mecánico de motos . CARMEN tiene 28 años de edad y desde hace 8 años inicio con su propio negocio con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. en conjunto con su esposo trabajan y sus hijos gozan de buena salud y van a la escuela. 
ella se enteró de los créditos de FODEMI por la promoción de asesores en la zona. y con familiares y amigos formaron el grupo para poder acceder al crédito.
ella con este que es su segundo crédito, comprará para surtir su tienda - arroz azucar aceites, panela, pan, queso, y embutidos. 
CARMEN es una mujer muy dinámica que con su carisma se ha ganado el cariño de sus vecinos y amigos. trabajan juntos con sus vecinos en la limpieza de su barrio y en las mingas comunitarias.
ella con su trabajo- espera que en un tiempo de 3 años poder incrementar su negocio, brindando mayor comodidad a los clientes y amigos.
es una oportunidad contar con una organización como FODEMI ya que ayuda a los pobres a tener su propio negocio y poder atender mejor a los niños.
texts.en:
CARMEN lives in Borbon with her husband and 3 children. Her husband works in his own motorcycle mechanic shop. Carmen is 28 years old and 8 years ago she started her own business with a small grocery store. She and her husband work together and their children are healthy and go to school. She found out about the loans from FODEMI through the consultants in the area and with relatives and friends they made the group to be able to access the loan.  

This is her second loan. She will use it to stock her store with rice, sugar, oils, brown sugar, bread, cheese and deli meats. Carmen is a very dynamic woman who with her charisma has won the affection of her neighbors and friends. They work together in neighborhood clean ups and mingas [community projects].  

With her work she hopes that in 3 year she can expand her business, offering more convenience to her customers and friends. It is an opportunity to have an organization like FODEMI because it helps poor people have their own businesses and attend to their children better.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store such as rice, sugar, oils, brown sugar, bread, cheese, and deli meats. These are the products that sell the most in her store.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reina, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada, vive con un hijo en una aldea del Municipio de Taulabe. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura de granos básicos. y hace 4 años decidió comprar cerdos para cría y engorde para vender. Esta actividad de negocio la tiene en su casa. Los cerdos los vende para destazo. El préstamo es por 10,000 Lempiras este es el cuarto ciclo que va invertir a su negocio, con el dinero va comprar concentrados y productos veterinarios para la cría de los cerdos. Su plan a futuro es mejorar el corral y tener mayor número de cerdos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina is 62 years old, married, and lives with her son in a village in the city of Taulabe. Previously she worked in basic grain agriculture. Four years ago, she decided to buy pigs to raise and fatten up to sell. She does this at her house. She sells the pigs to butcher. 

The loan is for 10,000 Lempiras. This is her fourth cycle that she's used to invest in her business, and with the money she's going to buy pellets and veterinary products to raise her pigs. Her plan for the future is to improve their pen and to have a greater number of pigs to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy pellets and veterinary products to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como agricultor de maíz dicha actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, cultivando una manzana de terreno. Miguel es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante y todos los días sale a cultivar la tierra, pero desea seguir sembrando maíz y sembrar también frijol, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para recoger su cosecha y seguir sembrando, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abono, frijoles y maíz, además deberá pagar mozo para recoger su cosecha y sembrar más.
texts.en: Miguel is 52 years old and lives in a modest home, but it is his own. He is a hardworking man who works as a corn farmer, which he has done for over 10 years, cultivating a block of land. Miguel is a a man who puts great effort into moving forward and he cultivates the land every day. He would like to continue sowing corn and would also like to grow beans, but he doesn't have the financial resources that are necessary to collect his harvest and continue planting. He is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in: fertilizer, beans and corn, and also to pay a young man to harvest and continue planting for him.

loans.use: to invest in: fertilizer, beans and corn, and also to pay a young man to harvest and continue planting for him.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su cuñada, hermano  y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su familia apoyada en su oficio de agricultura, la cual realiza desde hace 6 años, además buscando tener mejores ingresos se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su vivienda. Vilma desea ampliar sus cultivos y su crianza de cerdos, ya que ha observado que tiene una buena demanda, pero al no contar con los fondos económicos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijoles, cerdos y concentrado.
texts.en: Vilma is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her sister-in-law, brother and her family. She is a woman who makes an effort every day to get ahead, together with the support of her family and their farming business, which they've had for 6 years. In order to increase her income, she also raises pigs at her house. Vilma would like to increase her number of crops and pigs she will raise, as she knows that there is already a high demand for them, but doesn't have the financial means necessary. This is why she's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in: corn, beans, pigs and pellets.

loans.use: to invest in: corn, beans, pigs and pellets.

loans.name: Benedita

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 50 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 4 netos e 1 sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha na Educação a mais de 20 anos como Auxiliar Administrativa aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende reabilitar a sua casa  adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e varões. Este é seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e mais tarde adquirir uma viatura para transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Benedita was born in Maputo, is 50 years old and a widow. She is the mother of 5 children who are all of age and are currently studying. She is also responsible for 4 grandchildren and 1 niece who lives in her house.

She has worked in Education for more than 20 years as an Admin Assistant and makes a sum of money which she uses for household expenses. With this loan she plans to fix her house by buying construction materials such as sand, cement and rods. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku.

In future Benedita plans to start a business selling essential products and later purchase a vehicle to transport her goods.

loans.use: fix her house by buying construction materials such as sand, cement and rods

loans.name: Benadine

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Benadine from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Benadine is 24 years of age and a proud mother of one child that she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing domestic chores, Benadine is a very hardworking farmer who has been doing farming for the past four years and has gained so much experience through those years of farming. 

Benadine practices mixed farming. That is, she grows tea and keeps dairy cows and, through these, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed her cow “Tilya” and she really enjoys taking care of her animals. 

Although Benadine has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. Her farm has not been producing as much harvest because of lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests, and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to be able to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Benadine will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate to more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Benadine will reap more and this will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Benadine’s plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money, so that she can buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: candy, sweet bread, cold drinks, sugar, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Deborah dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice and soaps for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, lime and propane gas.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married mother of three children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a hardworking lady from Rwemigna, Mbarara district. She is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a private soldier in search for money in South Sudan.  

The husband can spend months without any communication or financial assistance. The husband is also less caring as he has another fresh young lady as his wife.

Given the situation in which the client finds herself, she quite often finds it challenging to cope with the rising demands of the family including schools fees for the children. As a result, she decided to begin a small retail shop around the Bishop Stuart University in a rented room so as to boost her income. However, all this has demanded a lot of capital which has left her helpless.  

After trying all other means and failing to meet all the demands, she finally came to UGAFODE for financial rescue.  She is requesting UGX 800,000 and she has demonstrated resilience in financial management. She appreciates the financial assistance to help her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, salt, soap, and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Libardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Libardo es un hombre de 54 años de edad con un feliz matrimonio con tres hijos, es un hombre amante del campo y de los animales que tiene como actividad productiva una tienda ubicada en zona rural, donde ofrece sus productos de la canasta familiar a diferentes campesinos que no pueden producir ciertos alimentos en sus fincas. 
Sueña conseguir brindándole bienestar económico a sus esposa e hijos y para ellos tiene que tener su tienda muy bien montada por eso solicita un crédito para surtirla comprara granos, productos de aseo personal este último es muy importante pues es bien sabido que los campesinos son muy aseados y solicitan diariamente dichos productos. 
El crédito le permitirá seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes lo que le hace crecer cada día.
texts.en:
Libardo, 54, is happily married and has three children. He loves the countryside and animals. He owns a store in a rural area, where he offers basic need products to different rural people that can't produce certain products on their properties.

He hopes to continue to provide his wife and children with economic stability. In order to do this, he needs to keep his store well stocked, which is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy grains and personal hygiene products -- this is very important as it is well known that rural people are very clean and desire these products on a daily basis.

This loan will help him satisfy his customers' needs and help grow his business every day.

loans.use: buy basic provisions for his store so he can satisfy his customers' needs and keep them coming back to his store for groceries.

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es:
Juana de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, no le gustaba mucho el estudio por lo que decidido dedicarse a apoyarle a su mamá con los oficios del hogar.
