Está casada desde los 22 años, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 3 hijas la primera va a sexto grado, la segunda estudia quinto y la de seis segundo grado, quienes se dedican solo a sus estudios, nadie más vive con ellos.
	
Ella es tortillera, le ayuda a una tía quien le paga por la prestación de  este servicio, todo esto lo aprendió cuando estaba en casa de sus padres lo que hoy en día le sirve para ganarse la vida, ya tiene 3 años de realizar esta actividad; también le apoya a su esposo en los trabajos de la agricultura, ellos se dedican al cultivo del plátano. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, la distancia que recorre es de 500 metros, el recorrido lo realiza a pie, nadie más se involucra con la actividad que realiza, el horario de trabajo es de las 7:00 am a 11:00 am.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en el cultivo del plátano, ya que van a sembrar más de lo que tiene, lo que comprara es abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y pago de mano de obra. La necesidad satisfecha será el poder expandir más la producción.

Desea seguir trabajando para sus necesidades y las de su familia, también apoyar a su hijos en el estudio, para que sean personas preparadas y de bien, las ganancias del negocio serán invertido en la manutención del hogar y en sostener el negocio, también del mismo se cancelara la cuota generada por el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is 28 years old, she studied up to the 7th grade, she didn't like studying much so she decided to help her mother with the household chores. She married at 22 years of age, her partner works in farming, they have three daughters, the first is in sixth grade, the second in fifth and the six-year-old in second grade, they dedicate themselves to their schoolwork, no one else lives with them.

She is a tortillera [makes tortillas], an aunt helps her who she pays for her services, she learnt all of this when she lived with her parents which nowadays helps her earn a living. She has been in this line of work for 3 years; she also supports her husband with the farm work, they work on a banana plantation. They don't have any other jobs they work in, the distance they travel is 500 meters, they go on foot, nobody else works in this work, the working day is from 7:00am to 11:00am.

The loan is needed to invest in the banana plantation, as they are going to plant more than they need, so they will buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide and pay for manual labor. They will fulfill the need to be able to further expand production.

She wants to keep working for her and her family's needs, also to support her children in their studies, so that they will be prepared people and good people, the earnings from the business will be invested in maintaining the home and keeping the business going, also it will be used to pay the installments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide and pay for manual labor, to plant bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Koja

texts.en:
Koja is a divorced mother of four children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Koja dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is 58-year-old Vivian. She is married, and has two children, both unemployed.  

In 2004, Vivian established her retail business: jewelry, slippers, children's wear and African wax-print cloth. Working seven days a week and from morning to evening, and she earns good profit every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of GHS 1,800. Vivian requires a loan in order to purchase more jewelry, slippers, children's wear and African wax-print. 

In the future, Vivian’s main focus is to maintain and improve her existing business and acquire a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase  more jewelry, slippers, children's wear and African wax-print to sell to customers.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman who has been blessed with two children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

Asha operates a fish-selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Asha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 58 años de edad, muy dedicada a su familia y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 12 años comenzó a vender mercancía como ropa en un pequeño local en el municipio de Andes.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de mejorar su capital y aumentar su venta de mercancía, por lo que invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas) y ajustará el capital de trabajo con unos ahorros para poder comenzar a generar recursos mucho mejores para sus sostenimiento, brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Maria tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is a 58-year-old, enterprising and dynamic woman. She's dedicated to her family and is an independent business woman, who 12 years ago started to sell merchandise, such as clothing in a small locale in the Andes municipality.

The loan she is requesting is to strengthen her business and is an opportunity to improve her income and increase sales. She'll invest this loan in an assortment of wholesale jeans, shirts and t-shirts and she'll use her work capital to generate better recourses that will go toward supporting and providing more comfort and better service to her clients, which will make her business more profitable.

Maria's main purpose is to move forward with her business project, as she wants to become a successful business woman and guarantee her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy an assortment of wholesale jeans, shirts and t-shirts, among others, to increase the selection in her locale.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is a hardworking gentleman from Rubindi, Mbarara district. At the age of 31 years, he is happily married and has a suckling infant. He dropped out of school at the level of senior after failing to get registration fees.

He decided to hawk clothes from where he learnt about other businesses, in particular, investment in the music business. He started working towards achieving that very target and started buying the necessary gadgets one by one. He finally got the system and marketed himself by playing music in churches and markets for free. Currently, he has the market and the necessary experience and is seeking a loan from UGAFODE so as to satisfy the needs of the business and also compete favorably.

This is not the first time the client is coming for assistance as he is a repeat client who services his loans well. He encourages fellow youth to make targets in their lives and work towards achieving those goals. He appreciates the assistance that will be given him.

loans.use: To buy music machines.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон - мужчина 55 лет,женат . Родился и вырос в сельской местности. С детства работает на поле:собирает урожай,ухаживает за домашним скотом. Рахмон любит свой домашний скот , ему нравится ухаживать за ними .Рахмон занимается козоводством. В настоящее время на своем участке земли имеет 50 голов коз.Мясо,молоко и шерсть,полученную от коз,Рахмон продаёт на рынке. Ко всему прочему, Рахмон откармливает коз и продаёт их за хорошую цену.Ему помогают жена и дети. Рахмон хочет приобрести корм и  несколько голов молодых коз .Но на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Рахмон заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Rahmon is 55 and married. He was born and raised in a rural area and has been working in the fields since he was a child, gathering the harvest and taking care of the livestock. He loves his animals and enjoys taking care of them. Rahmon raises goats and currently has 50 of them on his property. He sells the meat, milk and wool from them at the market. In addition, he fattens goats and sells them for a good price, all of this with the help of his wife and children.

Rahmon wants to buy feed and a few head of young goats but he doesn't have enough money at the moment. Therefore he has turned to microfinance organization Arvand for financial support. He thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and goats

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a 19,500 PHP (Philiipines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angelita has been in this business for 11 years. Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai is a married woman with three children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chai wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Delphina

texts.en:
Delphina has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, and hence, her perishable goods leading to losses.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat for sale in her business. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Ester Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ester de 28 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, eran muchos los hermanos y ella era de las primeras,  por lo que su mamá nunca la dejo ir a la escuela por el trabajo que se tenía que realizar en casa. Esta acompañada desde los 24 años de edad, su esposo se dedica también al comercio, vende jugos, sodas y agua en los buses. Tiene dos hijas de 7 y 6 años de edad, ambos van a la escuela una a kinder y la otra a primer grado.

Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas con cuajada en los buses, las  tortillas se las compra a una hermana y la cuajada a un vendedor, ella  es una mujer emprendedora ya que el negocio que tiene ella se lo invento en la zona, ya que nadie más se dedica a eso. Tiene 5 años de realizar esta actividad, el negocio lo aprendió de su esposo quien antes que ella se dedicaba a vender en los buses, solo que ella tomo otra actividad. También es ama de casa, al regresar a casa le toca dedicarse a sus hijas, durante el día paga quien se las cuiden mientras ella trabaja. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, la distancia que recorre de su casa a donde trabaja es de un 1 km, el recorrido lo hace a pie por lo que no tiene gasto en transportarse. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar jugos, sodas, agua  para la venta de su esposo y cancelara un pedido de bebida y cuajada que tiene pendiente, también necesita $200 los cuales debe ya que tuvo que cancelar un crédito que tenía en sociedad con un hermano, y le correspondía cancelar su parte. 

La necesidad satisfecha será el poder seguir trabajando con el dinero que obtengan del préstamo.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para sus necesidades y las de su familia, también apoyar a sus hijas en el estudio, para que sean personas preparadas y de bien, las ganancias del negocio serán invertido en la manutención del hogar y en sostener el negocio, también del mismo se cancelara la cuota generada por el préstamo.
texts.en:
Ester, 28, did not go to school. She had many siblings, and she is one of the eldest, so her mother did not want her to go to school, but to stay at home and take care of the household chores. She has been married since she was 24; her husband is a businessman who sells juices, sodas and water on board buses. She has two daughters aged 7 and 6. Both go to school; one is in kindergarten and the other one in first grade.

Ester sells tortillas with cottage cheese on board buses. She buys the tortillas from her sister and the cheese from another person. She is an entrepreneurial woman, the first one to start with this business in the area where she lives. She has been doing this for five years. She learned from her husband, who started selling on board buses while she was doing something else. She also works as a housewife. When she comes home, she has to take care of her daughters. She pays someone to take care of them while she is working. She does not have any other activity and has to walk one kilometer to go to work, so she does not spend in transportation.

Ester is requesting a loan at CREDICAMPO to buy juices, sodas and water for her husband to sell, and will pay for some cheese and beverages she took on credit. She also needs $200 to pay off her share of a loan she took together with her brother. This loan will help her to continue working.

Her dream is to continue working to provide for her family. She also wants to support her daughters with their studies, so that they grow to be good people and good professionals. She will use the profits resulting from her business to maintain her family and keep her business afloat, and to pay the installments.

loans.use: to buy juices, beverages and water for her husband to sell, and pay off some debts she has.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 54 years old and married with five children.

Gleceria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gleceria has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and coconut-wine vending.

Gleceria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Juliet has been in this business for four years now.

Juliet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like woods, paints, nails, etc. for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like woods, paints, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Tuwatikanaye Group

texts.fr: Ndakasi est commerçante, entrepreneur depuis 30 ans et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Tuwatikanaye», âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville. Son conjoint est un policier. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter des condiments et épices. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son père. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ndakasi has been a saleswoman-entrepreneur for 30 years, is a member of the "Tuwatikanaye" Business Association, is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children, all in school. She is a saleswoman of food products in the market in the city. Her husband is a police officer. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. She is going to buy vegetables for making sauces and spices. She started her business with funds received from her father. In the future, she wishes to build a house and educate and feed her children. She would like to thank Hekima for its support for non-bankable women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for making sauces and spices.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. Corazon is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Corazon has been in this business for four years now.

Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ermoda

texts.en:
Ermoda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ermoda is 47 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Ermoda has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Ermoda requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods like belts, slippers, bags, etc., to sell to her customers.

Ermoda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ermoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods like belts, slippers, bags, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and has six children. Evangeline is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for engine oils, filters, tires and general foodstuffs

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Abdou, il est chauffeur et a acquis son véhicule depuis 2008. Il est marié et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Il loge à quelques kilomètres du guichet, mais cela ne l’empêche pas d’alimenter régulièrement son compte. 
Abdou vient pour la 4ème fois solliciter un crédit qui va lui permettre de réfectionner le moteur de son véhicule. Abdou conduit seule son véhicule et n’a pratiquement pas d’heures de travail.
A partir des recettes de son activité, il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et du payement des factures de courant.
Puisqu’il est en location, son vœu le plus cher sera d’avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower, who is called Abdou, is a driver and acquired his vehicle in 2008. He is married and does not yet have children. He stays several kilometers away from the office, but that does not prevent him from regularly supplying his account. Abdou is coming for the fourth time to request a loan which will allow him to refurbish his vehicle's motor. Abdou drives his vehicle alone and has practically no regular working hours. Aside from the takings from his business, he cares for his family's daily expenses and keeps his bill payments up-to-date. Because he rents, his dearest wish is to have his own house.

loans.use: to service his car motor.

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr:
Tacko est une dame qui s’active dans l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée, et mère de six enfants, dont son ainé, un garçon âgé de 20 ans et la cadette âgée de 4 ans. Tacko loge à quelques kilomètres du guichet et fait parti des premiers clients, actuellement, elle est à son sixième crédit. Un prêt qui lui permettra de continuer dans son activité d’aviculture. Elle va acheter 100 poussins et de l’aliment volaille pour les nourrir. Elle possède une clientèle régulière qui achète le produit dès que les poulets sont à terme. Tacko est active toute la journée, elle s’occupe elle-même de sa volaille.
Elle n’a pas de charges sinon le payement du salaire de sa ménagère et ses petits besoins au quotidien. Tacko a pu mettre de l’argent de coté, changer l’ameublement de sa maison grâce aux financements reçus de l’IMCEC. Reste le grand projet qu’il veut réaliser un jour, celui d’avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Tacko has been raising poultry for more than ten years.  She is married and has six children, the eldest is a 20-year-old boy and the youngest is a 4-year-old girl.  Tacko lives several kilometres from the field partner, UIMCEC's office, and was one of their first clients.  This will be her sixth loan and will be used to support her poultry-raising business.  She plans to buy 100 chicks and poultry food to rear them.

Tacko has regular customers who buy her poultry once it is fully grown.  She is busy all day long as it is her that actually tends to her flock.  Tacko has no expenses to provide for apart from the salary of her house keeper and her own personal expenses.

Thanks to the loans which she has received from UIMCEC, Tacko has been able to build up her savings and buy furniture for her house.  One day, she would like to be able to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy a flock of 100 chicks to rear and then resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Gloria has been in this business for 13 years now.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Era works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling cellphone accessories.

Era is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like yeast, sugar, milk, etc. for her bakery. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. Era successfully repaid her previous loans and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like yeast, sugar, milk, etc. for her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter, a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces to mix with other forage to feed the cattle

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Âgé de 26 ans, Abdou a commencé à apprendre le métier de tailleur en 1999. Huit ans plus tard, il a ouvert son propre atelier de confection et pour renforcer un peu, il vient solliciter un crédit de cent mille francs pour pouvoir acheter une machine à coudre et augmenter la production. Abdou est actif toute la journée de 8h 30 mn à 21h de l’après-midi. 
Abdou est mariée et père d’un enfant. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et paie les frais de location de son atelier.
Abdou a comme ambition d’acquérir sa propre maison et y prévoir même un grand espace où il pourra ouvrir  un atelier de confection et de couture.
texts.en: 26 years old, Abdou began to learn the tailoring trade in 1999. Eight years later, he opened his own tailoring workshop and to strengthen it a little, he has come to request a loan of 100,000 francs in order to be able to buy a sewing machine and increase his production. Abdou is busy all day from 8:30 in the morning until 9 at night. Abdou is married and the father of a child. He takes care of his family's daily expenses and pays the costs of renting the workshop. Abdou's ambition is to acquire his own home, and he imagines even having a large space there, where he could open a tailoring and sewing workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a simple sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items - oil, tomatoes, coffee, soap, sugar, chocolate, sweets .... - to be delivered to shops.

loans.name: Lara Jane

texts.en:
Lara Jane is 29 years old and married with three children. She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lara Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Lara Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Cristina works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (palm leaf thatch) roofing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.

Cristina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa (palm leaf thatch) to sell in her roofing business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 36 years old and married with four children. She earns a living with her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Marissa has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Marissa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Lilia has been in this business for seven years now.

Lilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEYA est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  fruits
à l’image de DIALA qui est la seule femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 45 cartons de pommes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badeya Group is made up of 7 women who are married and are, on average, 35 years old and have 4 children.  They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni.  The women know one another through neighbourhood ties, friendship and business.

In order to improve their working capital and their businesses, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their seventh loan, the previous six loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Diala, who is the only woman sitting in the photo, sells fruit.  She plans to use her loan to buy 45 boxes of apples from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She then sells her produce at the market and at home, for cash or on credit, to both men and women.

Diala expects to earn a monthly average profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 56 years old and widowed with six children. With two children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them. 

Miguela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, canned goods, cereals, etc. Miguela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, where she offers a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, canned goods, cereals, etc

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Hello, world. Meet Eliud. He is a 34-year-old farmer with dreams of being a successful poultry farmer. He is based in Nandi Hills, which is a remote location in the South Rift region of Kenya. Eliud has been farming for the last three years. He makes an income selling milk, offering motorcycle transportation services, and engaging in other side businesses.

Eliud is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. By venturing into poultry, he will be diversifying his product portfolio. This will help him not only to make profits, but also to spread risks that may be associated with his other products. The demand for poultry products is always very high, yet most farmers are stuck in dairy farming due to traditional factors. With your loan, Eliud is going to grow his business. He is a natural farmer. His most enjoyable farm activity is milking! The income that he is going to generate from poultry will help him to comfortably afford the high farming expenses. His end game is to pull his family out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy poultry to diversify his farming activities

loans.name: Mirna Esperanza

texts.es:
Mirna de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado, esta acompañada, se dedica a su negocio propio,es comerciante en la capital,ella vive con sus padres, sus dos hijos asisten a la escuela.

Mirna tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa que vende de casa en casa y vende productos de revistas, se ha  dedicado a estos negocios con el propósito de ayudarle un poco a su compañero de vida y que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para  encielar una habitación. De esa forma, lograra la vida de sus hijos este mejor y la necesidad hasta ese momento quedara satisfecha.
 
El sueño de Mirna es terminar su proyecto de mejoramiento de su casa y  espera para sus hijos que estudien que se superen, ya que a ella no le dieron sus padres esa oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Mirna, 26 years old, attended school until the 4th grade. She has a partner and her own business. She is a merchant in the capital. She lives with her parents and her two children attend school.

Mirna has a small business selling clothing from house to house. She also sells journal merchandise. She runs these businesses with the goal of helping her life companion a little and so that her children will have a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO in order to put a roof on a bedroom.  In that way she will make her children’s life better and that need will be satisfied.

Mirna’s dream is to complete her home improvement project.  She also hopes that her children will get an education and that they will be successful since her parents did not give her the opportunity to better herself.

loans.use: to put a roof on a bedroom.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela de 48 años de edad, no estudio,esta acompañada,él se dedica a albañil, tienen dos hijos de once y cinco años, uno va a la escuela,viven en casa propia.

Angela tiene su negocio de antojos de pasteles,riguas y nuegados por quince años,aprendió su trabajo debido a la necesidad de darles todo lo necesario y  apoyar al padre de sus hijos,el negocio le queda cerca a unos diez minutos.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar frutas como:guineos,manzanas,papayas,piña etc,de esa forma tendrá otros ingresos y de esa forma lograra que su vida y la de su familia sea mejor.

El sueño de Angela, es siempre mantener su negocio y que sus dos hijos vivan en mejores condiciones de vida y seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Angela is 48 years old and is in a relationship. Her spouse is a bricklayer.. She has two children, aged 11 and 5. One of them goes to school. Angela did not study. They live in their own house.

Angela has had a business selling snacks like pastries, riguas (made from sweet corn) and nuegados (made from yucca) for 15 years. She learned this work due to the need to provide for herself and help the father of her children. Her business is close, 10 minutes away from her house.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fruit like bananas, apples, papaya, pineapple, etc and in this way have another income to improve her life and that of her family. Angela's dream is to keep her business running so that her two children live in the best living conditions and to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas, apples, papaya, pineapple, etc.

loans.name: Amirhon

texts.ru: Амирхон - мужчина 27 лет,женат,молодой отец . Он специалист по облицовке из строительного материала алькапон.Амирхон со своей бригадой  разъезжает по объектам ,где  занимается  облицовкой потолка ,паркета и стёкол .Заказов много,но этот доход недостаточен для семьи Амирхона.Жена Амирхона не имела возможности поступить в высшее учебное заведение,так как воспитывала ребёнка. Теперь ,когда их ребёнок подрос, Амирхон хочет,чтобы его жена поступила в университет , получила образование и финансово помогала семье.Ко всему этому,у Амирхона есть сестра,которая в этом году окончила школу .Родители на могут оплатить образование дочери,поэтому Амирхон хочет помочь своей сестре .Амирхон знает,что без образования не получишь хорошей высокооплачиваемой работы и хочет ,чтобы его  жена и сестра были образованными женщинами и финансово самостоятельными.  На данный момент Амирхон не имеет нужной суммы,поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Амирхон заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Amirhon is 27, married, and a young father. He is a construction veneer specialist. He and his team travel to sites where they veneer ceilings, floors and glass. They get a lot of jobs, but the income is not enough for Amirhon's family. His wife did not have the chance to go to university because she was raising a child. Now that their child is older, Amirhon wants his wife to go to college to get an education and help the family financially. In addition, Amirhon has a sister who is finishing high school this year. Their parents cannot pay for their daughter's education, so Amirhon wants to help his sister. He knows that it is impossible to get a good job without an education and he wants his wife and sister to be financially independent. He does not currently have enough money, so he applied for a loan with MDO Arvand for financial assistance. He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support and confidence.

loans.use: to pay for his wife and sister's tuition

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Antonio que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el es de 23 años de edad  que tiene 1 hijo de apenas 4 meses de nacido por la cual el está decidido a luchar por la vida y por su hijo.

La actividad que Antonio ha venido realizando desde hace 5 años es la plantación de flores, frijol y cafe el aprendió dichas actividades de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Antonio es para la compra de semillas de flores y abonos químicos con el fin de obtener buenas cosechas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.

Antonio quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la compra de terreno para dejárselo a su hijo para que viva en condiciones adecuadas y brindar educación a su hijo para sea un profesional en la vida.
texts.en:
The environment is an essential component of this planet, so it is good to know that there are people who work to preserve it. This is the case of Antonio, who has always wanted to stay in his community and grow different types of crops. He is 23 years old and has a son who is just four months old. Antonio is determined to fight for his life and for his son.

Antonio has been growing flowers, beans and coffee for five years. He learned these activities from his parents; this knowledge is the only thing he inherited from them. He has used it to generate some income for his family and make some profits to support them. He also works as a day laborer.

Antonio wants to request a loan to buy flower seeds and chemical fertilizers to improve the harvest, and as a result, his and his family’s living conditions.

Antonio wants to be different from his parents. One of his biggest dreams is to buy a piece of land so that his son can inherit it. He also wants to improve his son's living conditions and pay for his education so that he can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 31 years old, married, and has two small children. He still lives in his parents' house.  

He has a cloth-painting business. He has work in this craft since he was a little boy.  Juan Carlos is asking for a loan to buy a drier for his business. He believes that it will help him provide a better service to his clients. 

His goal is to provide financial stability to his family and become more independent.

loans.use: To buy a drier for his cloth-painting business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

Mercedita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Mercedita dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is 66 years old, married  and has three grownup sons, only one still lives with him and is studying college. They own a house and for the last 24 years, Jesus has owned a spare parts (used) retail store. He describes himself as enjoying sports, living a life without any vices and working to getting a better life. Jesus is asking for a loan to buy spare parts in bulk. He says that by doing that, he will be able to get a discount of 35%-40% and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in bulk and get a big discount.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 2 años Margarita de 32 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 2 hijos por quienes lucha cada día los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la crianza de pollos y la venta de porciones de pollos y papas de forma ambulante en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la de oficios domésticos.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de una refrigeradora para poder almacenar  pollos en ella para que no se descompongan y solo así puede tener pollos frescos para las personas que necesitan de dicho producto.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la venta de porciones de pollos y papas y que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the characteristic businesses in Sololá is to raise animals of all types. Foe the past two years Margarita who is 32 years old and lives in her community has been raising chickens. This business generates a satisfactory income to help her family and improve the living conditions of her children. She has two children who she fights for each day and who are students at a school close to their community.

Her business is raising chickens and selling portions of chicken and potatoes itinerantly in the community in which she lives. This makes good profit for her as she has no competition in this business. It has helped her raise her living conditions and that of her family. Her second business activity is doing domestic work.

Margarita is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator to be able to store the chickens so that they don't go bad. This is the only way she can have fresh chicken for the people who want this product. Her goals are to make more profit and to support her family and continue to sell portions of chicken and potatoes. She wants her children to be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru:
Равшан мужчина 35 лет,женат,отец троих детей. Равшан в возрасте 20 лет начал работать в пекарне. Со временем накопив немного денег,он решил открыть свою собственную пекарню. В настоящий момент его бизнес цветёт и пахнет. Равшан печёт чудесные лепёшки. Покупатели с утра выстраиваются в ряд,чтобы попробовать горячие лепёшки. Равшан хочет ,чтобы его дети выросли не зная нужд. Поэтому он и его жена трудятся день и ночь.
Равшан хочет закупить в пекарню необходимое сырьё: муку,соль,дрожжи,сахар,соду и необходимое орудие труда. На данный момент Равшан не имеет нужной суммы,поэтому обратился в МДО Арванд. Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Ravshan is 35, married, and has three children. He started working in a bakery when he was 20. Over time he has saved some money and has decided to open his own bakery. His business is currently flourishing. He bakes wonderful lepeshki. People line up every morning to buy them. Ravshan wants his children to grow up without need, so he and his wife work day and night.
Ravshan wants to buy the necessary ingredients for his bakery, such as flour, salt, yeast, sugar, baking soda and the necessary tools. Ravshan currently does not have enough money, so he applied for a loan with MDO Arvand. He thanks them in advance for their support and confidence.

loans.use: to  purchase ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair two tortilla manufacturing machines.

loans.name: Fabiola Bania

texts.es:
Fabiola es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y trabaja como auxiliar contable.
Ella es emprendedora, inteligente, competitiva, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la empresa de transporte aéreo militar (TAM) que se encarga del transporte de pasajeros, carga y correspondencia vía aérea.
Fabiola es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello castaño largo, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el español. En su trabajo ella se encarga de mantener los registros financieros y realiza la mayor parte o la totalidad de la contabilidad financiera, también mantiene el registro de las horas de trabajo de los empleados, las ventas, los gastos, los pagos y las horas facturables para asegurar que los libros financieros sean precisos y que la empresa sea rentable.
Ella estudia la carrera de administración de empresas en la universidad pública, y con su trabajo logra abastecer los gastos de sus estudios superiores. La falta de instrumentos de estudios como la computadora, hacen que el desarrollo de su carrera sea lento, ella desea terminar sus estudios y continuar trabajando para ayudar a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Fabiola solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop para terminar su carrera universitaria y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 23 year old woman. She is single, has no children and works as an accounting assistant. She is entrepreneurial, intelligent, competitive, consistent, responsible and very hard working. She performs her job at the military aircraft transportation company (TAM) that is in charge of transporting passengers, cargo and correspondence by air.

Fabiola is of dark complexion, average stature, has long brown hair and dresses according to fashion. Her mother tongue is Spanish. In her job, she is in charge of maintaining the financial records and performs most or all of the financial accounting. She also maintains the timekeeping records for the employees, their sales, expenses, payments and billable hours to assure that the financial books are correct and that the company is profitable.

She is taking a business administration course at the public university and, with her work, she manages to cover her education expenses. Since she lacks certain educational tools, like a computer, her career is developing slowly. She wishes to finish her education and keep working to help her family.

It is due to these reasons that Fabiola is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to finish her university course and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, to finish her university course and help her family.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Ally is a businessman, aged in his mid-thirties with two schooling daughters. He has had a business of gengeduka (produce stall), selling fruits, vegetables, and other shop items. He has been in this business for three years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Ally runs his business from 7 AM to 8 PM daily. 

He is requesting a fifth loan through Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy genge fruits and vegetables to resell. Ally used the previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to maintain his business stock of fruits and vegetables. His capital is now greater than before and he serves more people, though people still demand yet more additional products. He dreams to open a big shop selling the same and other items. Ally gains a profit which he uses to cover school fees and home food expenses. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Mbayuwayu, which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for his gengeduka.

loans.name: Sonia Dolores

texts.es:
Sonia de 44 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada; su compañero de vida  trabaja de albañil y son padres de tres hijos una estudia  y los otros dos trabajan.

El negocio de Sonia es la venta de pupusas, lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella también se  dedica, ya tiene varios  años de tenerlo vende todos los días a fuera de su  casa puesto que ya tiene sus clientes y su hija le ayuda en la venta de pupusas.            

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  una plancha nueva. El negocio mejorara  mas, porque podrá a atender a sus clientes y la necesidad quedara satisfecha. 
El objetivo de Sonia, es seguir trabajando en su negocio,el cual le da mas ingresos y el préstamo le ayudara mucho el cual seguirá siempre trabajando con CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Sonia, 44 years old, studied until the 9th grade.  She has a partner.  Her life companion is a construction worker and they are the parents of three children, one of whom is still in school, while the other two are working.

Sonia has a business selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas], a skill she learned from her mother who also sells them. Sonia has had this business for several years and she works every day outside of her home since she has many customers and her daughter helps her to sell pupusas. 

She is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to purchase a new grill. Her business will improve because she will be able to wait on customers and the need will be met.

Sonia’s objective is to continue running her business and earning more income. The loan will help her greatly and she will always continue to work with CREDICAMPO.

loans.use: to purchase a new grill.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a first year student pursuing the Bachelors of Science in Accounting at the University of Professional Studies. The loan is to help pay his school fees.

His two nephews, who have been abandoned by their father, push him to go higher in his education, so as to make their lives better and comfortable. 

Being the eye of his family, completion of his education would give him the opportunity to be gainfully employed and assist his family in every area of their lives. And also with the interest he has for touching lives, he believes his community would benefit immensely.

In the next five to ten years, he sees himself as being a chartered accountant and an entrepreneur, owning a bigger group of companies from real estate to manufacturing to distribution, and most importantly touching the lives of people.

But for this loan, his life would have been affected, from his family down to all who stand a chance to benefit from his education. His other alternative would have been to work to accumulate some funds to finance his education.

“There are intelligent, brilliant but needy students in his community and investing in someone like him who is eager to touch lives would have an impact in the community, and the country as a whole”, he says.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI  est un groupe de l’association BADENYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de haricots à l’image de SITAN qui est la seule  personne assise sur la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  préparation et vente de haricot. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
SITAN, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de haricots préparé. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de haricots et une quantité importante d’huiles alimentaires.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU   auprès des grossistes  et vend ses haricots cuits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, au ambulant et dans le marché à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvesti le reste dans son activité de haricots cuisinés.
texts.en:
The Sabali Group is part of the Badenya association in Ouelessebougou.  It is made up of women who are married and are, on average, 45 years old and have 5 children.  They live in large, traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through neighbourhood and family ties.

The women have all worked in retail for several years and are much sought after for their prepared beans. 

In order to better satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the group has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first loan.

Sitan, who is the only woman sitting in the photo, is president of the group and very popular in Ouelessebougou where she sells her beans.  She plans to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of beans and a large quantity of oil, from wholesalers in Ouelessebougou.  She then retails her cooked beans in Ouelessebougou, for cash or on credit, at the market or on foot, to both men and women.

Sitan hopes to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her bean business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy beans and oil for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Rashid is in his mid-40's and married. He has got three children, of whom two are grown and one still at school. Since 2005, he has been a tailor, making a variety of clothes such as dresses and trousers and also repairing clothes. He works from 7:30 AM to 7 PM daily and is able to realize a good profit each month. 

This is his second credit request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among Puma, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Rashid used the previous credit, since repaid, to buy tailoring materials. He still runs the same business and with the new capital injected, he earned profit which he used to cover family welfare costs. He is so thankful for Kiva's support around the world. Its real support changes people's lives. His desire is to one day be able to expand his business. 

Rashid will invest his credit to buy clothes-making materials and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ener Miguel

texts.es:
Ener es un hombre de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

El monto un café internet desde hace varios años al notar que en su localidad no existían este tipo de negocios y la gente lo necesitaba.

El tiene 31 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un computador. Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Ener is a man of good ideas and a creative mind. He is always trying to find work to expand his family income. He started an internet cafe many years ago when he noticed that, in his town, this type of business did not exist and the people needed it. He is 31 years old and has "all the batteries installed" to face the challenges that life has prepared for him.

He is requesting a loan to buy a computer. With this money, he will be able to invest in his business and attract more customers thereby impacting his profits in a positive manner.

His biggest dream is to have a large internet cafe with good income and to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy a computer to improve his service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tobacco farm equipment and supplies to grow her business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 62 years old and married with six children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Miguela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tobacco seeds and farming equipment.

loans.name: Ramwidzai

texts.en: Ramwidzai is a 31-year-old businesswoman with three children. When she is not producing cured tobacco, Ramwidzai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, community health trainer, and life skills facilitator at local schools in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. With the Kiva loan, she intends to boost her business by purchasing fertilizers and seeds. With her additional profits, Ramwidzai aims to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to boost her business by purchasing fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and expand her tobacco curing facility.

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DAMBE est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   d’articles divers à l’image de ASSETOU  qui est la seule femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des articles divers avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Dambe Group is made up of 5 women who are married and are, on average, 35 years old and have 4 children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Heremakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni.  The women know one another through neighbourhood ties, friendship and business.

In order to improve their working capital and their businesses, the group has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first loan.  The women all sell various products.

Assetou, who is the only woman sitting in the photo, sells various products.  She plans to use her loan to buy various items from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She will then retail her products at the market and at home, for cash or on credit, to both men and women.

Assetou expects to earn a monthly average profit of 15,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is an associate, running a special loan from Esperanza International Dominican Republic's (Esperanza) Water Project, which gives this type of loan to associates and members from social groups in any community Esperanza serves, in order to help their communities.

In this special loan, Rosario is representing his church Iglesia de Dios Casa de Bendicion, from the North of Santo Domingo. They started a water project in order to provide purified water to their community's inhabitants, and Rosario is running a water distribution point to access more families, to provide the service at a low price, but with high quality and the proper standards.

With this loan, Rosario will invest in a pickup truck to distribute the water, to buy 5-gallon bottles and iron shelves to exhibit the water gallon, as well as to improve their distribution point (where they sterilize gallons, and deliver them to the neighbors).

The distribution point is called Agua Bendita (Holy Water). Around 20,000 people live in their neighborhood. Their plan is to distribute purified water, to around 20 - 30% of these families, at a cost of $0.50 USD for a five-gallon bottle of water. With this, Rosario said, they want to impact different areas: economic, health, spiritual, and many others.

This community is in an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo, with many health problems, potable water scarcity, diseases, and distrust of people with other water distributors, etc. With programs like this, the community members could start changing their lives. Rosario thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy a pick up truck,  five-gallon bottles, and iron shelves.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Patricia tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de un joven de 23 años y una niña de 10 años que está en la escuela. Ella ha sido cliente de Fundación durante varios años. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con buena moral de pago,  tiene iniciativa y visión en el desarrollo de su actividad  lo que le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su esposo y su familia.
La señora tiene una empresa familiar: ´´churros papillo´´  la cual  desarrollan  en fiestas y turnos en todo el pais, donde participan con venta de comidas, churros , algodones de azúcar y juegos infantiles, generando ingresos que les permiten cubrir todas sus necesidades familiares y contratar a otras personas en su microempresa.
Desde hace dos años esta con su otra actividad como comerciante ya que sus clientas tenían la necesidad de adquirir productos personales, pero por falta de tiempo no van a comprarlo a las tiendas, por lo que doña Patricia les lleva la mercadería hasta sus casas, le ha resultado muy bien esta idea y cuenta con bastantes clientela. Actualmente requiere de un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que se acerca la temporada alta, que es la navidad. Logra complementar varias actividades, aporta en gran parte económicamente al hogar para los gastos de su hija que está en la escuela, ya que su meta es ver a su hija culminar los estudios.
texts.en:
Patricia is 40 years old. She is mother to a 23 year old young man and a 10 year old girl who is in school. She has been a customer of Fundacion for many years. She has proven to be a responsible person with good morals in relation to repayments. She has initiative and vision to develop her work, which has allowed her to improve her quality of life as well as that of her husband and family.

She has a family business: "churros papilla" which conducts business at parties throughout the country where she participates through sales of food, churros, cotton candy and children's games, generating income that allows her to pay for her family's needs and hire other people in her small business.

She has worked for two years at her other work as a vendor since her customers had the need to acquire personal products but, due to a lack of time, could not go to shops to buy. So Patricia brings merchandise to their house. This idea has turned out very well and she has a lot of customers. Currently, she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise since the high season, Christmas, is approaching.  She manages to perform various work, supporting her home economically and her daughter's school expenses since her goal is to see her daughter finish her education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 18ème prêt. Les 17 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  d’articles divers à l’image de NABINTOU qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djekafo Group is made up of 4 women who are married and are, on average, 48 years old and have 5 children.  They live in traditional, extended  families in the Niebala district of the town of Bougouni.  The women know one another through neighbourhood ties, friendship and business.

In order to improve their working capital and their businesses, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eighteenth loan, the previous seventeen loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Nabintou, who is standing on the right in the photo, sells various products.  She plans to use her loan to buy 5 sacks of rice from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She then sells her rice at the market and at home, for cash or on credit, to both men and women.

Nabintou expects to earn a monthly average profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Sitchonisiwe

texts.en:
Sitchonisiwe is a 30-year-old mother of one. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe.  

Ever since she left school she has been running a business selling groceries. She supplies the community with sugar, rice, tea, stationary, sanitary items, cooking oil, and potato chips. She has managed to save and expand the business to the small shop that she now operates at the local business center. She serves as a Peer Educator in her community and as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. As a Learner Guide she teaches students study skills and about their well being. 

With the Kiva loan Sitchonisiwe is going to make bulk purchases to reduce her costs and increase sales volume and profits. She hopes to be economically stable so that she can support her siblings through school.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, tea, stationary, sanitary items, cooking oil, and potato chips.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 26 years old. She lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe with her family. Theresa has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

In addition, Theresa has been farming tobacco for one year now, and she is very proud of how far she has come.

With the Kiva loan, Theresa will buy more inputs to increase her yields. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy more inputs to increase her yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith resides at Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Faith has been farming tobacco for one year now, and it has helped her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, Faith will buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to increase her yield. Her hope is to grow the business and have more tobacco. This will bring stability to her business, and will enable her to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to increase her yield.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is an associate, running a special loan from Esperanza International Dominican Republic's (Esperanza) Water Project, which gives this type of loan to associates and members from social groups in any community Esperanza serves, in order to help their communities.

Joaquin, with his church, runs a water project, called Agua Viva.  Around 25,000 people live in their neighborhood. Their plan is to distribute purified water, around 3000 thousand people, and the five-gallon bottles cost around $0.50 USD. With this, Joaquin said, they want to impact different areas: economic, health, spiritual, and many others.

Joaquin is representing his church from the community of Bayona, from the North of Santo Domingo. They (the church is named Iglesia de Dios M.I Central) started a water project in order to provide purified water to their community's inhabitants.  Joaquin is running a Water distribution point, called Agua Viva Delivery, this loan is to buy a pick-up truck, water filter tanks and other investments in their water plants. This loan is to reinvest in this water project.

This community is in an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo, with many health problems, potable water scarcity, diseases, and distrust of people with other water distributors, etc. With programs like this, the community members could start changing their lives. This church is committed to start as many projects as it can, to contribute to the development of this community.

In the picture you can see the pick-up truck that they got to distribute the water; this is one of the investments.

loans.use: To buy a truck and to buy water filters

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 27-year-old married woman with two children from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She and her husband own a tobacco farming business, and it is their only source of income. Judith produces almost 30 hundred-kilogram bales of cured tobacco every season. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community, focusing on teaching students life skills. 

Judith intends to use the Kiva loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment for the farm, and she looks forward to seeing her business flourishing. Most importantly, Judith hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment for the farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
-   
Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin,  Rose  est  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est Célibataire  et  mère  d'un enfant. Adzo fait  de la restauration du ayimolou et  s’approvisionne  4 Fois par  mois  au  marché gbossimé et  revend  domicile  . Rose sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the Tokoin district of Lomé.  She is single and has one child.  Rose makes ayimolou (a dish of rice and beans) for sale in her restaurant business.  She buys her supplies four times a month at the Gbossimé market, and sells her food from her home.

Rose has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 2 drums of oil and 2 cartons of spaghetti for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Soemeton

texts.fr:
_ 
Soemeton a 31 ans, Mariée et mère de 4 enfants résident à Tokoin. Elle  fait de la  restauration du haricot. Elle s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au  marché gbossimé et revend dans les quaritiers environnant et est ambulante. Soemeton sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en:
Soemeton is 31 years old, married and has four children.  She lives in Tokoin, and runs a restaurant business.  She buys her supplies twice a month from the Gbossimé market, and sells her food on foot in the surrounding neighbourhoods.

Soemetom has requested this loan in order to expand her restaurant and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 25 bowls of beans for use in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Yeukai

texts.en:
Yeukai is a 27-year-old married mother of two. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers every week at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, facilitating study and life skills sessions. In addition, Yeukai farms tobacco for a living. 

She wishes to improve herself financially, and give her family a higher standard of living. Yeukai will use the Kiva loan to purchase tobacco seeds, fertilizer, and farm implements to boost production. Her hope is to be able to cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco seeds, fertilizer and farm implements to boost production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of shirts, jeans, trousers, shoes, dresses, and skirts to reduce costs and boost her sales.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 25-year-old married mother of one. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, facilitating study and life skills sessions. Violet sells farm produce such as beans, round nuts and ground nuts. She wishes to improve herself financially and give her family a higher standard of living. 

Violet will use the Kiva loan to purchase her products in bulk to reduce the costs, as well as boost sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia lives in the Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe, where she has been giving back to her community by volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Olivia buys and sells clothing for a living. She has been doing this business for a year now. 

With the Kiva loan, Olivia hopes to purchase more stock to increase her sales. Additional profits would mean she will be able to cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en:
Faalagi is a 50-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 11 years of experience with this business. 

Faalagi needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Faalagi has been a member of SPBD since 2003.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is a 49-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Loleta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a gas bottle and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Loleta has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, a large frying pan, cooking oil, a gas bottle and a new oven

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 20 years old and married with 2 children. She makes and sells elei printed fabric to earn a living and has been doing this for 4 years. 

Sophia has requested a loan to buy fabric, stencils, wooden carved designs, rubber designs, brushes and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, stencils, wooden carved designs, rubber designs, brushes and rollers

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 27 years old and unmarried with 4 children. She makes and sells elei printed fabric to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Pauline has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brushes, fabric, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, fabric, stencils, wooden carved designs and rubber designs

loans.name: Ruhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора добрая девушка. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем. Рухсора окончила Педагогический колледж. Она работает учительницей младших классов в средней школе. Рухсора всегда стремиться усовершенствовать свои знания. Несмотря на трудное условие семейной жизни, она поступила в Педагогический Университет. Теперь она и учиться и работает. Рухсора должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ruhsora is a kind young woman. She is 22 years old. She is not married. Ruhsora graduated from a Pedagogical College. She works as a primary-grades teacher at a secondary school. Ruhsora always tries to advance her knowledge. Despite a difficult family life, she was accepted to the Pedagogical University. Now she studies and works. Ruhsora has to pay for her tuition and requested a loan for this purpose. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell vegetables business. Lilia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mischelle

texts.en:
Mischelle is 26 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mischelle is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mischelle has been farming sugarcane for two years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Monaly

texts.en:
Monaly is 34 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Monaly requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net for fishing.
