Monaly has been in this business for 14 years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business.  She is married and she has four children and she runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family.  

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as candles, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, slippers, shampoo and cards.  She opened her kiosk since 2007 with her own working capital of $600.00.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy candles, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, slippers, shampoo and cards

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 24-year-old mother of one living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide working with students at local schools to help improve their learning and overall well being. She also volunteers by assisting the elderly in her community. Joyce’s ambition to become financially independent led her to rent a table at the local flea market where she sells clothing, accessories, and shoes. Currently, Joyce’s profits barely meet her family’s needs, and she would like to expand her business. 

With a Kiva loan, Joyce will purchase large bales of clothing to increase her stock and expand her profits. This will enable her to provide for herself and her family. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community, as well as further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is  taking a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy more stock to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, slippers, water,soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko) hard drinks (beer), cigarettes, candles, books, shampoo and body lotion. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, slippers, water,soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko) hard drinks (beer), cigarettes, candles, books, shampoo and body lotion.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en: Merita is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business.  She runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, biscuits, body lotion, beer, water, Fanta, Sprite, noodles, salt, sugar and coffee.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00.  Merita is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, biscuits, body lotion, beer, water, Fanta, Sprite, noodles, salt, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and married with 8 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Rosa needs a loan to buy a new watering hose, insecticide, chemicals, sprayers, a tiller and wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Rosa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new watering hose, insecticide, chemicals, sprayers, a tiller and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq  femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des habits friperies, des encens, des mèches et des parures. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits friperies. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies. Elles s’approvisionnent en friperies à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Sitan compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group is made up of 5 women who are married and are, on average, 38 years old and have 3 children.  They live in polygamous families in the Djalakorodji district of Bamako.  The women know one another through neighbourhood ties, family and business.  They sell second-hand clothing, incense, hair extensions and accessories.

In order to improve their stock levels, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Sitan (sitting on the far left in the photo) is well-known for selling second-hand clothing.  She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bales of clothing from Médine.  She will then sell the clothing on foot, for cash or on credit, mainly to women.

Sitan expects to earn a monthly average profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay for healthcare for her children.  She hopes to be able to use this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy several different qualities of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Carla

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2  maiores de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos da 1ª necessidade e ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e no seu negócio. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo produto da 1ª necessidade como: feijão, carne, arroz, refrescos, amendoim, açúcar e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 9º empréstimo na Hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende abrir mais estabelecimentos comercias para responder as necessidades dos seuS clientes e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos, tem como desafio ser grande empreendedora
texts.en:
Carla was born in the Namaacha Province of Maputo and is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and they have 4 children who all study - two of whom are of age. She does not support anyone else.

She owns a commercial establishment where she sells essential products and spends the money she makes on household expenses and on her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by buying essential products such as: beans, meat, rice, sodas, peanuts, sugar and other necessary products. This is her 9th loan with Hluvuku.

In future she plans to open more commercial establishments to meet her clients' demands and guarantee her children's education. Her challenge is to be a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: expand her business by buying essential products such as: beans, meat, rice, sodas, peanuts, sugar and other necessary products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy five-gallon bottles, iron shelves to save and exhibit the bottles, and a pick-up truck

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is a 58-year-old widow with 7 children.  She has a small farm where she raises pigs that she can sell in her community or to the public.  She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Tai needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.  

Tai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water

loans.name: Islomgul

texts.ru: Исломгул трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать 4 детей. Исломгул замужем. Ее муж фермер. Исломгул родилась и выросла в семье скотовода и с детства привыкла к труду. Она помогала родителям откармливать скот.  После того, как она вышла замуж, для нее начались финансовые трудности. Ее муж фермер и имеет небольшой доход. Исломгул с трудностями вырастила своих детей. Буквально 3 месяцев назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она нуждается финансовой поддержке, потому что она планирует купить новую швейную машину. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Islomgul is a hardworking woman. She is a mother of 4 children. Islomgul is married. Her husband is a farmer. Islomgul was born and raised in a family involved in animal husbandry and was used to work since her childhood. She helped her parents raise livestock. She started having financial difficulties after she got married. Her husband is a farmer and has a small income. Islomgul raised her children through hardships. She started her own business in sewing women's clothing just 3 months ago. She needs financial support because she is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. She provides her services at home. Islomgul is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a dry goods-vending business in the Philippines. Wilma has been in this business for eight years. 

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like dresses, shoes, slippers, shorts, etc., to sell to her customers. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like dresses, shoes, slippers, shorts, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
An $800.00 loan is offered to Joanina to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy things every day.  She has been in this business since 2002.  She will use her loan to buy some additional supplies for her kiosk, such as body lotion.  She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.  Her husband is a driver.

Running a business has made Joanina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also is able to help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people wanting to improving their living condition.

loans.use: to buy body lotion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Maria Diocelina

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Peñol, habitan muchas madres emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro para sus hijos; una de ellas es Maria, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías y bordados en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como un hobbie pero que poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de sus tres hijos.

Ella, siendo una madre muy responsable, no tiene muchos recursos, pero si tiene un gran corazón y energía para su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mesa de trabajo, insumos, e iluminación para su negocio.

Con estos elementos podrá tecnificar y mejorar el proceso de fabricación de sus obras, que son vendidas principalmente en almacenes, ferias, y a algunos habitantes del municipio.
texts.en:
In the town of El Peñol there are many enterprising and hardworking mothers who have the desire and strength to get ahead and to fight for a good future for their children.  María is one of those.  She is a woman who, with her charisma and great capacity for work, has been able to overcome various obstacles she has faced in life.

She has a very small business in her home making and selling handicrafts and needlework.  This is a business that she started as a hobby however, little by little, it has developed into a real source of income supporting her three children. She, being a very responsible mother, does not have many resources but she does have a great heart and energy for her family.

María is requesting a loan to purchase a work table, supplies and lighting for her business.  With these elements, she will be able to introduce technology into her work and improve the process of producing her handicrafts, which she sells to stores, at fairs and to some town residents.

loans.use: to purchase a work table, supplies and lighting for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe.  She volunteers every week at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide facilitating study and life skills sessions.  In addition, she sells melamine (plastic) products such as buckets, bowls, plates and cups for a living.  She wishes to improve herself financially and give her family a higher standard of living. 

Mercy will use the Kiva loan to purchase more melamine products to increase her sales volumes and profits.  Her hope is to be able to cater for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more melamine products to sell

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.ru: Сабиха добрая и сильная женщина. Она пережила много трудности в своей жизни. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца. Его сыну 16 лет и он учится в средней школе. Сабиха после смерти мужа начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она вначале продавала продукты питания на лавке на центральной улице. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она имеет свой продуктовый магазин. Ее бизнес является единственным источником семейного дохода. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки продукты питания как хлеб, конфеты, сахар, макароны, колбасные изделия и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sabiha is a kind and strong woman. She has lived through many hardships in her life. She was left without a provider after her husband's death. Her son is 16 years old and attends a secondary school. After her husband's death, Sabiha started her own business in selling food products. At first, she sold food products at a kiosk at a central market. She gradually developed her business and now has her own food store. Her business provides the sole source of income for the family. She is planning to increase her working capital and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy food products, such as bread, candy, pasta, sausages, etc. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, 48 and a mother of five, settled down to make a living in Jimenez with her family. She helped her husband running their fishing business to make a living. For over seven years, it has helped a lot in their daily expenditures. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying fish to sell. 

Aside from fishing, the couple is also engaged in farming. They have their own rice farm as their  main source of income. Recently, Emelia took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is 57 years old and married with two children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Portia has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional electronic mobile load to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic mobile load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 32 years old. She lives in a small village of the Senaki district with her pensioner mother. 

Liana is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of agricultural land, where she grows maize and nut trees. She sells the harvested products at local markets. 

As the income is only seasonal, Liana decided to start an additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3200 Gel to start trade home products. She will purchase linens, towels, and such, and will resell at a higher price among her villagers to increase her income. Liana awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to begin to trade home products and increase her income

loans.name: Analua

texts.en:
Analua is a 28-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Analua needs a loan to buy soft drinks, sandwiches, cakes, pies, snacks, donuts and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Analua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sandwiches, cakes, pies, snacks, donuts and plastic bags

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years and also sells items such as charcoal. 

In the future Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Almagin

texts.en:
Almagin is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Almagin is 36 years old and has six children who are in school.

Almagin has a 'sinamay' weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Almagin has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Almagin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 56 years old, married, and has seven children.  

Remedios is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed and pay laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Remedios has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed and pay laborers' salaries for farm preparation

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Loreta is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Loreta has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental with her parent. She is 22 and a single mom vending snacks in their village to make a living. She has been doing doing this for three years. She was not able to put aside savings for their future needs for her income is only enough for their daily needs. 

To increase her sales, she borrowed a new loan recently  from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. In the future, she plans to build a little shop for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Tagivale

texts.en: Tagivale is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Tagivale needs a loan to buy new chairs, tables, snacks, bread, butter, mayonnaise and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Tagivale has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new chairs, tables, snacks, bread, butter, mayonnaise and soft drinks

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en: Faasulu is a 49-year-old woman who is married with nine children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has eight years of experience with this business. Faasulu has requested a loan to buy thread, a pair of scissors, material, needles, a new sewing machine and a measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy thread, a pair of scissors, material, needles, a new sewing machine and a measuring tape

loans.name: Bermelle

texts.en:
Bermelle, a 40-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from farming coconuts, corn and bananas.

Bermelle, who has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for  PHP 15000 to buy additional items to sell such as  canned goods, bath soap, toothpaste, soft-drinks, beers, candies, coffee, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, bath soap, toothpaste, soft-drinks, beers, candies, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is forty-two years old and married with eleven children, four of whom are in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ellen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ellen has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ellen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cristita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Cristita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers for her business.

Elena has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from farming coconut and vegetables.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is fifty-nine years old, married, and has six children.

Luz and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Luz is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Luz has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Luz can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Leidy de 28 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3º año de bachillerato,esta casada su esposo trabaja de docente en una escuela cercana,viven en casa alquilada,los dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad asisten a la escuela.

Leidy trabaja en el hospital nacional,en cocina ya tiene diez años, el horario de ella es de 7:00 AM a 5:00 PM,descansa un día a la semana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar útiles escolares como:papel boom, lapiceros,sacapuntas,lápiz,borradores y una fotocopiadora, para iniciar con la instalación de una mini librería, ya que donde viven no venden esas cosas,de esa forma lograra mejores ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Leidy es que sus hijos estudien y darles todo lo necesario y siempre mantener su negocio y su trabajo y seguir trabajando con CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Leidy is 28 years old and studied up to her 3rd year of secondary school. She is married and her husband works as a teacher in a school nearby. They live in a rented house with their two children, aged 10 and 8 who go to school. Leidy works in the National hospital as a cook where she has worked for 10 years. Her timetable is from 7am until 5 pm and she has one day per week off work.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy school supplies like paper, pencils, pencil sharpeners, pens, erasers and a photocopier to start a min bookstore as where they live no one sells these things. In this way she can earn more income and improve their quality of living. Leidy's dream is for her children to study and be able to provide them with everything they need. She wants to keep her business running and continue to work with CREDICAMPO.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like paper, pencils, pencil sharpeners, pens, erasers and a photocopier.

loans.name: Djaminate Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Djaminate sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro-Dounfing l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Sirakoro-Dounfing. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce  de, chaussures plastiques de plusieurs sortes, biscuits et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  50 paires de chaussures plastiques à  Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits  et en ambulant à Sirakoro-Dounfing à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djaminate group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 35 years old with five children. They all live in Sirakoro-Dounfing, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Sirakoro-Dounfing.

Members of the group are small retail merchants, dealing in various kinds of plastic shoes, biscuits and cosmetics. Seeking to resupply by paying cash, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Oumou (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling various kinds of plastic shoes. She intends to use her loan to buy 50 pairs of plastic shoes wholesale in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted for cash and on credit, as an itinerant vendor in Sirakoro-Dounfing, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Oumou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 175,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure her children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Marie Nieva

texts.en:
Marie Nieva, a 49-year-old mother of two, settled for a living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. To make a living, she runs a service-based business, operating transportation services in their community. She had a hired man for this business. She earns good income from this business that absolutely meets their needs. 

Marie Nieva became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and had borrowed a new loan to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. 

Her future plan is to acquire more units of motorcycle for her business expansion.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en: Larry is a single entrepreneur living with his parents in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Larry raises pigs for sale. He has been doing this for ten years by raising one or two pigs at a time. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC and is now requesting a new loan to purchase feeding supplies for his pigs. He plans to build a pig shelter in order to raise more pigs in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for his pigs.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married, with four children, three of whom are in school. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marlyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marlyn has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Marlyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is fifty three years old and has four children who are in school.

Clarita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Clarita is taking out a PHP 7000 Housing loan through NWTF to  purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Clarita has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Clarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is taking a loan of USD 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as eggs, milk, noodles, water, wine, soy sour, beer, cigarettes, coffee, and sugar. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of USD 200.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, noodles, water, wine, soy sour, beer, cigarettes, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Kapeneta

texts.en:
Kapeneta is fifty-five years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Kapeneta needs a loan to buy snacks, frozen goods, canned food, bags of rice, sugar, flour and toiletry items. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, frozen goods, canned food, bags of rice, sugar, flour, and toiletry items.

loans.name: Sapuon

texts.en: Sapuon, 53 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community in Siem Reap Province. She has one adolescent and four married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. So far, it is more than twenty years for her of being as a farmer. Sapuon wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is fifty-nine years old, is married, and has nine children. Three of her children are in school.

Editha and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out.

Editha is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Editha has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Editha can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is 60 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Asteria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her fishing business, like fishing net and gasoline. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Asteria has been in this business for 21 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business, like fishing net, and gasoline.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married, with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emma's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Emma is taking out a PHP 7,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Emma has been with NWTF since 2013, in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home.  

In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 56 years old and married.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Paulina is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Daniel que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el es de 32 años de edad  que tiene 3 hijos el primero es de 9 años de edad es estudiante en su comunidad, el segundo de 6 años de edad también estudiante y un último de dos años de edad que aun no estudia.

La actividad que Daniel ha venido realizando desde hace 15 años es la plantación de flores y el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es comerciante en su comunidad.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Daniel es para la compra de semillas de flores y abonos químicos con el fin de obtener buenas cosechas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.

Daniel quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la compra de terreno para dejárselos a sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the earth and it is good to know that there still are people who work taking care of the environment as a productive activity. This is the case with Daniel who since he was small has had the desire to plant in his community. He is 32 years old and has three children. The first is 9 years old and is studying in his community. The second is 6 years old and also is a student and the third child is two years old and doesn't study yet.

The business that Daniel has been doing for the past 15 years is a flower plantation, which he learned from his parents. That is the only inheritance they left him and he has dedicated himself to growing flowers so as to have an economic income for his family and have money to support his family. His other activity is as a merchant in his community. Daniel's purpose requesting the loan is to buy flower seeds and fertilizer with the aim of producing a good harvest to improve the living conditions for himself and his family. Daniel wants to be different from his parents and one of his greatest hopes for the future is to buy land to leave to his children so that they can live in adequate conditions.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Aside from her fishing business, Marina, of Taboo, Jimenez, has her own farm of rice which is their main source of income. She is married and has four children. 

Her previous loan was used for her fishing boat repairs and was successfully repaid. To improve her farm, she recently took a new loan to buy fertilizer. 

In the future, Marina wants is to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 43 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mercedita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mercedita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Saorathana

texts.en:
Saorathana is a “Rising Star” supported by Wedu who dreams of completing her degree and working towards social change in her community.  This is her story:

I am 31 years old and was born in Kampong Thom province from a poor family. I am the 6th child among 7 siblings and have 3 sisters and 3 brothers. My parents value education, so that is the reason they have always pushed me to continue my studies. Fortunately, my sister was able to support me to study at university, and I have received love, support and care from the good hearts of my family. 

I finished my Bachelor’s degree in August 2003 in the field of Accounting. Because of some challenges in life, I couldn’t continue my Master’s degree as soon as my peers. I dreamed to take a Master’s degree of Management because I am poor in management skills and want to improve. I want to be strong and take this chance to support the vulnerable people in my society. I have one dream – I want to see youth in Cambodia have access to good education and strong participation in social development activities to make positive change in my country. 

My dream is to complete my Master’s degree before 2015. I met Wedu in late 2012 and received full scholarship for my first year in March 2013. Now I am requesting a Future Income Sharing Agreement (FISA) for my second year and I will pay it back – I am really happy that this money can go back to support other Rising Stars in the future! Without this help from Kiva and Wedu, I cannot complete this mission on time and would have to extend my study and delay my dream for another two years. 

Wedu not only supports me with my financial need, but I also receive the mentorship program, which gives me a chance to meet with my mentor, Prakash. He is a really helpful person and has helped me to build my strength and confidence. Since July 2012, I am growing up without limitation. We spend much time discussing my goals, my plans and my actions. “Learning by doing” is the most common advice my mentor tells me. I am now walking towards my dream – taking action, step by step, to reach my dream one day. Even if I take “turtle” steps, I have confidence that I will, at last, arrive there successfully! 

Note from Wedu: Saorathana is expected to graduate in March 2015 and will begin making repayments as soon as she has secured gainful employment.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition fees and cost of living expenses

loans.name: Phearong

texts.en:
Phearong is a “Rising Star” supported by Wedu who dreams of completing her degree and working towards social change in her community.  This is her story:

I am 20 years old and was born in a rural area in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. I am the youngest child in my family and also the only one who had the opportunity to study in university. Growing up, I never even dreamed about having this opportunity, as my family is poor. Since I was young, I dreamed of working in a nice office and being able to speak to the public to solve the problems in our situation, but I thought it could only happen in the movies.  

Currently, I am studying my Bachelor’s degree at Royal University of Law and Economics with a major in International Relations. I did not know this major before I chose it, but afterwards, I learned I am very skilled at and passionate about global relations. During this time, the most important thing that also brought me much closer to this dream is Wedu. I got to know Wedu about 2 years ago, and with the financial support and strong relationship with my wonderful mentor, I was able to make a new life for myself. I now feel my life is very important to this world. I have a chance to study at university and I have a chance to work on my personal development with the support of my mentor. Wedu provided these things so that I could put my life on a path to becoming a positive change-maker in my community. 

My dream is big, which is to become a high-ranking official in the Cambodian political system, but for now, I think I am better suited to join an NGO, INGO, or IGO. But wherever I work, I am passionate about making a positive change in my community, as well as my country.  With the many unforgettable experiences of being a young lady from a rural area who moved to the city, studied with privileged students, lived alone in a new place, met both bad people and nice people, understood the different standards of living, and so on, I am very confident in my ability to complete my Bachelor’s degree in order to achieve my dream. In the end, I want to help people in my community as much as I can and take my own unforgettable experiences to help build wonderful lives for the next generation of rural Cambodians.  

Note from Wedu: Phearong is expected to graduate in June 2016 and will begin making repayments as soon as she has secured gainful employment.

loans.use: To pay for university fees and cost of living expenses

loans.name: Trengguli Group

texts.en:
These are the members of Trengguli Farmer Group who are posing at an established BIRU program bio-digester facility, namely Haryadi, Pangat, Dino, Tono and Narno. This farmer group is led by Pangat (44 years old), who is pointing his thumb up. They all live in Trengguli, a tiny village at Karanganyar, Indonesia. Pangat has a family with three school-aged children.

Pangat has high hopes for his family and he strives to improve his economic conditions. He invited four of his fellow farmers to establish a farmer group to develop their business and sharing advantages.  A few years ago, with a minimum investment, he bought some beef-cattle which he fattened for resale. However, he began to see an increasing amount of cow dungs, and he was concerned that it could pollute the water in his community. 

After receiving information from Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and LKM (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Pangat saw an opportunity to reduce the purchase of non- renewable cooking gas, and he also learned about biogas residues (bio-slurry) utilization benefits. He and his farmer friends want to become energy-independent by purchasing bio-digesters. Since prices have increased sharply, Pangat wants to eliminate his dependence of cooking gas. In addition, bio-slurry can be used and sold as organic fertilizer, organic pesticide, and fodder mixture, all of which can increase revenue for his family and his farmer group. It seems like the biogas program would be the perfect solution to his problem, however, Pangat does not have sufficient capital to purchase a bio-digester.  A loan from Kiva will help him and his farmer group to make this purchase possible.

He also hopes that building bio-digesters can create new job opportunities for surrounding community.

loans.use: to build bio-digesters facility and utilize bio-slurry (biogas residues) as organic fertilizers

loans.name: Tomasia

texts.en:
A USD 600 loan is offered to Tomasia to improve her business. She is married. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of USD 100. 

Tomasia will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like a refrigerator, soft drinks (e.g., Fanta, water, Sprite, Sagiko), hard beer, milk, coffee, and sugar. 

Tomasia is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, soft drinks (e.g., Fanta, water, Sprite, Sagiko), hard beer, milk, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Alicia, una mujer con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.

Ella decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es una mujer simpática y servicial, siempre dispuesta a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar un amplio surtido de verduras para abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia para otorgar  a sus hijos un techo digno.
texts.en:
Selling fruits and vegetables is the occupation Alicia has chosen. She is a woman with drive and perseverance to maintain her own business.

She has been working in this business for more than 10 years, starting very early in the morning every day. 

She decided to start this project on seeing the need to earn better income for her family, and since she didn’t have the necessary education for other jobs, she chose to sell fruits and vegetables. 

She is a very pleasant and obliging woman, always ready to look after her clients concerns and wishes.

She is asking for economic assistance to buy a large supply of vegetables to stock her business and sell more. 

Her dream is to have her own house so she can offer her children a real home.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of vegetables to stock her business and sell more.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta is 51 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Edilberta sells used clothing and shoes in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years. 

Edilberta requested another loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bundle of used clothing and shoes to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of used clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Eimer Eulises

texts.es:
Eimer se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de vidriería y vitrinas, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio.
 
Ya que ha laborado 5 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima (vidrios) al por mayor para mejorar su inventario y obtener un mejor descuento.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que actualmente tiene muy poco material para trabajar.

Actualmente vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Elmer has a successful glass and display case business. He is well-known in the area for his good work and service.

Having spent five years developing his knowledge of this industry through his work, Elmer has been able to keep his work going and has tried to improve his family's living conditions.

Elmer is applying for a loan in order to buy prime materials (glass) in bulk in order to increase his stock and benefit from a bulk discount.

With these purchases, Elmer can continue to offer his services as he currently has very little material for his work.

Elmer lives with his wife and two children.

Elmer's biggest dream is to be able to have a large workshop with many employees and, little by little, he will achieve his objective.

Please help a young entrepreneur who wants to get ahead with a loan!

loans.use: to buy prime materials such as glass for his business to increase capital and to be able to support his family.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, de 54 años, inicio con su oficio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Tierra Alta, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostener a su hijo y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida.
 
En el momento en que nació su hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hijo tiene 18 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para iniciar con una obra a todo costo que le generar buenos ingresos, estos materiales serian arena, ladrillos, cemento, entre otros.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Manuel con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Manuel, who is 54 years old, began his work in construction and remodeling homes in the town of Tierra Alta. He began his business with the desire to support his son and offer him a better quality of life.

At the moment when his son was born, he found his motivation to work untiringly and thus to offer him the best for his life and development.

Now his son is 18 years old and has become the joy of this hard-working man.

He is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials to begin an all-inclusive project that will generate good income for him. These materials will be sand, bricks, and cement, among other items.

With this loan he will be able to support his son and his wife, offering them a better quality of life and an optimal economic stability.

Help Manuel with a loan so that he can continue with his business!

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and adobe bricks in order to begin a project and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.name: Monica Cecilia

texts.es:
Monica es una mujer muy trabajadora y organizada, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su motocarro a través de las veredas del municipio de San Rafael posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es una mujer amable, servicial y muy emprendedora, es madre de un hijo de 12 años al cual siempre ha procurado por ofrecerle la mejor educación.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento, reparación y compra de carpa a su motocarro ya que es su único medio de trabajo y sustento.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehiculo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Monica is a very hard-working and organized woman. She earns a living offering personal transportation services in her three-wheeler throughout the lanes of the town of San Rafael, making movement from the community to the different areas of the township possible.

She is a friendly woman, helpful and very entrepreneurial. She is the mother of a 12-year-old son, to whom she has always tried to offer the best education.

She is applying for a loan to do maintenance and repair and buy a canopy for her three-wheeler, since it is her only means of work and sustenance.

With this loan she will be able to improve the condition of her vehicle and continue offering her services with total security, without risking her life or that of her customers.

loans.use: to do maintenance and buy a canopy for her three-wheeled vehicle in order to continue offering quality service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to prepare the food that she sells for her business.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
Sreypao, 33 years old, is an active rice farmer in a small community of Prey Veng Province. She has only one little child. 

To make a living and support her family, Sreypao manages and operates a rice farming business in a small farmland, which is located near her house. So far, she has been a farmer for 14 years.

Sreypao wants to have household energy, at a reduced monthly cost, by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL). After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, television, and radio. 

She is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided her with a special interest rate, lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Dúo Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Flores de Sumpango este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sonia Leticia de 37 años de edad,ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejido tipicos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en: Sonia Leticia, who is 37 years old, is part of the "Dúo Flores de Sumpango" group. For many years she has worked making and selling native weaving. This time she is requesting a loan to buy raw material in order to produce native weaving to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw material to produce and sell native weaving.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
El señor Fausto de 60 años de edad años, vive en la  ciudad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, se dedica al comercio tiene su pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Don Fausto su pulpería le genera los ingresos que necesita para poder sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles educación y alimentación a sus hijos. 
Don Fausto está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, harina, frijoles, queso, etc. Espera que esta inversión que realice le permita salir adelante y poder seguir brindarles educación a sus hijos que están en colegios y universidad y por lo cual él los sigue apoyando para que cumplan sus metas, uno de sus sueños es engrandecer su negocio.
 
 Trojes, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Señor Fausto is 60 years old and lives in the city of Trojes in eastern Honduras. He works in commerce, selling things in his small grocery store for the last 5 years. 
The store generates the income Fausto needs to maintain his family and offer his children education and sustenance. 

Fausto is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, lard, ham, flour, beans, cheese, etc. He hopes this investment will allow him to keep maintaining his family and offer a good education to his children who are in high school and university.One of his dreams is to expand his store. He is thankful for the support offered by Kiva and Prisma Honduras. 

Trojes, Honduras - August 2014.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, ham, flour, beans, cheese, etc. for his grocery store.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo, 51 years old, has four children and settled for a living in Jimenez. He operates their own farm while his wife works as a domestic caregiver. 

He became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and is borrowing a new loan to purchase additional organic fertilizer and pesticide in order to boost his farm. He is hoping that, with this loan, he will have a greener farm and an abundant harvest this cropping season. He will use his profit for his farm expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies such as sweets, cigarettes and fried foods among others, to stock up his business and improve his sales.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 56 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Olivia needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a machete, a crowbar, and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Olivia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a machete, a crowbar, and gloves.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old, married, and has 11 children, four of whom attend school. Virginia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Virginia requested a housing loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  With this loan, Virginia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Dúo Alameda De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Alameda de Sumpango este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Angelina de 48 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años, ella esta contenta porque ha tenido la oportunidad de el apoyo de kiva y gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en su negocio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos para la venta espera que la sigan apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Dúo Alameda de Sumpango group is comprised of Maria Angelina who is 48 years old. She has been making and selling traditional fabrics for a living for several years. 

She is happy because she has had the opportunity to have Kiva's support and she thanks God for the success of her business. This time she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional fabrics. She hopes to continue getting support for her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her ice cream vending business.


Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her ice cream vending business.

loans.name: Maricar Jan

texts.en:
Maricar Jan is twenty-two years old and single.

Maricar Jan and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Maricar Jan is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011.

With your help, Maricar Jan can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Eriza

texts.en:
Eriza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eriza is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Eriza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing gear and equipment for her business.

Eriza has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing gear and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Jimson

texts.en:
Jimson is a 22-year-old, married man with two children, who lives in San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) over a year ago and had successfully repaid his previous loan, used for fertilization of his farm. He continues cultivating the vacant farm to gain better farm produce. 

To restore farm nutrients, Jimson recently took a new loan to purchase manure fertilizer. He plans to cultivate the entire farm in order to generate more income for a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Florencia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal collection products to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal collection products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en:
Luchi is 46 years old and has six children. She is married, and four of her children are currently in school.

Luchi is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Luchi has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed thirteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luchi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old with seventeen children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Virginia's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Virginia is taking out a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Virginia has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 30 years old and married, with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Mareta needs a loan to buy shovels, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, boots, new overalls and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Mareta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy shovels, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, boots, new overalls and crops

loans.name: Kolondalayiri Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogamiques, les membres du groupe Kolondalayiri  ont en moyenne 39 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies) de toutes sortes, de la restauration et du parfum. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramatoulaye (femme arrêtée à droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (friperies) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails  à Hamdallaye en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ramatoulaye compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the Kolondalayiri group are married women who live in monogamous households in Hamdallaye, a district of Bamako. They average 39 years of age and two children each, and they know one another as neighbors and through the income-generating activities that they practice in Hamdallaye. They sell miscellaneous used clothing, perfume, and restaurant services. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ramatoulaye (standing on the right in the group photo) is a successful reseller of used clothing of all kinds. She will use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing, wholesale, in Médine. She retails her merchandise as an itinerant vendor in Hamdallaye, and her clientele consists mainly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Ramatoulaye expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity and to meet some of the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. Melanie has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help Melanie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Alfie Rose

texts.en:
Alfie Rose is 30 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alfie Rose has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Alfie Rose has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and feed for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alfie Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emerlita is forty four years old and has three children who are in school.

Emerlita 's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Emerlita is taking out a PHP 9,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Emerlita has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Emerlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 50 years old and married, with six children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Elena's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ma. Elena has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Elena has taken a 9,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Elena is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 34 year old unmarried woman with no children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 7 years of experience with this business. 

Lisa needs a loan to buy paper plates, soya sauce, plastic spoons and forks, tomato sauce and a new BBQ grill. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Lisa has been a member of SPBD since 2007.

loans.use: to buy paper plates, soya sauce, plastic spoons and forks, tomato sauce and a  new BBQ grill.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 52, married and a mother of two who has settled in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, with her family. She works as a dressmaker in their village while her husband does farming. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and that of her children. 

Adela thinks that buying fabric wholesale will generate a better income for her family. She also needs to make a few renovations to her sewing shop due to various storms that damaged the roof, allowing water to enter and ruin her garments.

For these reasons, Adela is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fabric and to renovate her sewing shop with the profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric and to renovate her sewing shop with the profits.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 8 años, vive con su esposa y juntos han luchado por salir adelante tiene casa propia y tiene 3 hijos  que  dependen de ellos.
Don Juan vive en una  comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar debido a que en su comunidad no tienen el servicio de energía eléctrica y espera que con esta inversión mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y a su vez están muy alegres por que estarían contribuyendo a cuidar el medio ambiente.
Uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos que terminen los estudios. 

Trojes, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old and he has been making a living raising cattle for the past eight years. He lives with his wife and together they work hard to get ahead in life. They have their own house and three children that depend on them. Juan lives in the community of Trojes, in the east of Honduras. 

He is requesting the loan to buy a solar panel, since there is no electricity service in their community. He hopes that this investment will improve the quality of life for him and his family and at the same time, they are very happy because they will be contributing to the protection of the environment. One of his dreams is to see his children finish school.

Trojes, Honduras - August, 2014.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for his home.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Veronica will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jigie

texts.en:
Jigie is 39 years old and has four children. Jigie is married and has four children who are in school.

Jigie is in the agricultural business; she is in pig fattening in the Philippines. Jigie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jigie has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jigie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq  femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont uniquement  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 45 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits (friperies), condiments et charbon du bois. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1ièr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Djélika (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies. Elles s’approvisionnent en habits (friperies) à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit à Daoudabougou  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Djélika compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The five members of the Danaya group are married women who all live in polygamous households in Daoudabougou, a district of Bamako. They average 45 years of age and eight children each, and they know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship, and through their income-generating activities. They sell used clothing, condiments and charcoal.  

To build their inventory, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djélika (sitting at the far right in the group photo) is well regarded as a reseller of miscellaneous used clothing. She will use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing.
