She buys her merchandise in Médine and retails it in Daoudabougou, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Djélika expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which she will use to support her children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes like t-shirts, blouses, socks, etc. to sell for her ready-to-wear clothes business.

Editha has been in this business for 7 years. Editha earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes like t-shirts, blouses, socks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials such as iron, steel, etc.

loans.name: Maria Luningning

texts.en: Maria Luningning is married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. She became a member of Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed a loan to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate the vacant lot of their farm to add to their harvest. In the future, she wants to have a greener farm and to ensure that they have a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is thirty-four years old, married, and has five children who are in school.

Marissa and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Marissa is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Marissa has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Marissa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Lolo est composé équitablement de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent à Sirakoro-Dounfing l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits alimentaires (biscuits), du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Coumba (femme assise devant sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  25 cartons de biscuits en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Sirakoro-Dounfing à une clientèle mixte. Madame Coumba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Lolo group consists of two monogamous and two polygamous women. They are on average 45 years old with four children. They live in Sirakoro-Dounfing, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in food (biscuits), firewood and charcoal. To increase their stock supplies, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan. 

Mrs. Coumba (the woman sitting in front on the photo) has a great reputation selling food products. She intends to use her loan to buy 25 boxes of biscuits wholesale in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Sirakoro-Dounfing to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Counba hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business. She aims to buy a plot of land for residential use through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy food products (biscuits)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace settled for a living in Sinacaban Misamis Occidental with her family. For over 24 years she has been running her general store, and has been able to make improvements on their house and has a motorcycle used for a transportation services business. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for the grocery store. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store and to use a portion to buy new tires. Hopeful this will be enough to sustain their business for a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store and to buy new tires.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with nine children and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with her family. To make a living, Helen helps her husband operate their own farm. She earns a good income from this farm and they also have a fishing business. 

Helen has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy fertilizer. She has planted more crops to gain more farm produce. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es:
Jean es un joven de 21 años, soltero y con todas las ganas de salir adelante. Como tiene muchos deseos de superación, está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Económicas y a la vez trabaja como vendedor en una tienda de aparatos eléctricos; Jean es consciente que trabajar y estudiar a la vez es una ardua labor, pero lo acepta con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia.
Jean está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado quiere iniciar un pequeño negocio, es por ello que comprará artículos para redes de mercadeo para su negocio y así más adelante podrá independizarse, tener su propio negocio y dedicarse por completo a él. Con esto quiere darle lo mejor a su familia y ofrecerle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jean is a young man who is 21 years of age, single, and full of drive to succeed. With the desire to get ahead, he is studying for a degree in Economic Sciences. At the same time, he works as a salesperson at an electronics store. Jean is aware that working and studying is a hard job, but he accepts the situation with great enthusiasm because he wants his family to get ahead.

Jean is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have offered. He wants to start a small business, so he will buy items for establishing a marketing network for his business. This will allow him to become independent going forward. By having his own business, he will be able to devote himself to it full-time. This will allow him to give the best to his family and provide them a better future.

loans.use: to buy products for starting a marketing network business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 49 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Denelvy Franly

texts.en: Denelvy is a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He studies marine engineering. Denelvy lives in a small village, in the city of Ambon in eastern Indonesia, on the island of Ambon. Denelvy’s father works as a paperboy in his village, while his mother is a waitress at a pastry shop. His parents try to collect the results of their labor, to meet their daily needs and to use the remaining part for the cost of education for their children. Sometimes they find it very difficult to fund their children's education. Denelvy is the first child of five siblings and four siblings are still in school. Denelvy wishes to be able to work on a ship as a professional ship technician. He also does not want to bother his parents, because it is too hard for them to find the money so that their children can go to school at all. Denelvy is eager to get a loan from Kiva to help pay for college expenses, so that he can complete his studies, get a job faster, and help his parents.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu is a 34-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Fetu needs a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, a rice cooker, a boiler, sandwiches and pies. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fetu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, a rice cooker, a boiler, sandwiches and pies

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She also sells fish on weekends. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods. She knows that the more items displayed in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source, to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Madelyn dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, etc. needed for her business.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Suai. She is a businesswoman, and most of her daily income is from selling clothes. She is doing this business because many people are interested in her clothes, so many people come to buy her clothes every day. She also has animals in her place, like cows, pigs and chickens.

Laura is now applying for a loan of $1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell, according to what people like, such as trousers, shorts, children's clothes, shirts, long sleeves, short sleeves and other things.

Laura started her business in 2011 with her own working capital of $500.00. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so when she takes a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she is very happy because with this loan she can improve her business management in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, children's clothes, shirts, long sleeves, short sleeves and other things to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 35 years old, lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. To make a living, she grows papaya that she sells in the local community.

Delia, whose membership in Gata Daku MPC has helped her to improve her ability to engage in her business, recently requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer and additional vegetable seedlings. She plans to use the new revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and additional vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya has two children and lives in a rural area in Kampong Speu province. To support his family, he grows rice as his single source of income. He earns about 24,000 KHR a day.

Ya is the leader of his group. He requested a loan from VisionFund, which he will use to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can improve his family's living in a healthy manner.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Chansophy

texts.en:
A resident of Stoeng Meanchey district, Chansophy is 61 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom is studying in university. Her children earn income to support the family by working for a company. 

Her past loans repaid, Chansophy is requesting her third loan from Kiva partner VisionFund to help pay the tuition fees of her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Banking and Finance. She hopes to keep her daughter in university until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 27 years old and works hard to support her family. Jovelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Koy's Group

texts.en: An old man from Kampong Speu province, Koy is 61 years old, and a father of one schoolchild. For his living, he grows rice on one-hectare of farmland to support his family’s condition. He has been involved in this business for ages and earns him about 18,000 KHR per day. This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of three members to get new loan. As a leader, he will spend his loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that his family will be healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Julianis

texts.en:
Julianis is from Maluku Islands, in the village Nusaniwe, the city of Ambon. This region is in eastern Indonesia, which is an area of islands connected by small boats. Because Julianis is from the archipelago, he wants to be a ship technician. Currently he is studying at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara in the Teknika program. 

Julianis worries that he can not complete his studies due to economic factors from an underprivileged family. His father is a farmers working the fields of others; his mother does not have any special skills for work. Julianis is the first child of four brothers. He is the hope for his family and younger siblings.
 
Julianis requested a loan, which he will use to pay for the costs of college. He hopes to be able to help him fulfill his dream, to work as a professional technician on a ship, and to help both his parents and younger siblings.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Edelfonso

texts.es:
Edelfonso tiene 43 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y dos menores hijas de 12 y 4 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en colegio secundario del caserío Lanchepata perteneciente al distrito Santo Tomás que se encuentra a 45 mnts del caserío mirador y su menor de 4 años esta en institución inicial del caserío el Mirador donde viven, Edelfonso y su familia tienen casa propia de material rustico de dos pisos, vive en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío el Mirador del Distrito de Pimpingos; vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Edelfonso es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor, plantación esta en segundo año de producción, tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 04 años en caserío el mirador Distrito de Pimpingos, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito Santo Tomás a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente Edelfonso se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno contando a la fecha con 4 reses, también al cultivo de caña de azúcar y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío el Mirador distrito Pimpingos.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edelfonso, 43, has a stable home with his spouse and his minor children, 12 and 4.  His older daughter studies in the secondary school in the village of Lanchepata which belongs to the district of Santo Tomas some 45 minutes from the village of Mirador.  His younger child, 4, is in the initial institution of the village of Mirador where they live.  Edelfonso and his family have their own, two-story house of rustic materials.  They live in communion with the members of their village.  They live in the rural part of the village of Mirador in the district of Pimpingos.  The residence has running water.
The activity that Edelfonso is involved in is the cultivation of coffee of which he has two hectares of the Catimore variety.  The plantation is in its second year of production.  He has his own agricultural land where his coffee parcel is.  He has been farming for four years in the village of Mirador, Pimpingos District.  He has experience in the coffee cultivation sector.  He sells the product in the Santo Tomas District to buyers of the zone.  Additionally, Edelfonso makes a living in livestock activities raising cattle of which he has four animals.  He also cultivates sugar cane and makes bread products, all of which he produces on his own land in the village of Mirador, Pimpingos District.
The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee in production.  With this, he will be assured of a greater and better production for the 2015 campaign and thus obtain greater income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee in production.  With it, he will be assured of greater and better production.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon is 62 years old and has nine children, two of whom attend school. She is a local farmer from Kampong Speu province. She grows rice on one  hectare of farmland to support her family. 

Sinuon is the leader of a group of four members. She requested a loan from VisionFund, which she will use to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living in good health.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Darlita

texts.en:
Darlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Darlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials such as wood, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Darlita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Linberta

texts.en:
Linberta lives in Suai. She has been involved in business activities since 2009.  She started with her own working capital of $150. She is requesting a loan of $800 because she has a kiosk and she is a tailor.  She is very interested in her business, so she will take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goods such as noodles, sugar, umbrellas, detergents, shampoo, and other things to sell including sewing clothes. 

She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her future income.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, umbrellas, detergents, shampoo, sewing clothes, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Benkadi est constitué de sept  femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou  l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente d’habits, des condiments, des céréales, des jus, des encens, des poissons et des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Sabou (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Sabalibougou  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sabou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of seven married women living in polygamous households. On the average, they are 37 years of age, with four children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a district of Bamako. They know each other through local “tontines” [neighborhood savings groups]  and through their work. The group members work as vendors selling clothing, condiments, cereals, juice, incense, fish and cosmetic products. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan.

Mrs. Sabou (the second one standing from right to left in the photo) is well known as a clothing vendor. She plans to use this loan to buy 35 sets of traditional “pagnes” wax fabric. She stocks up in Bamako. She resells in Sabalibougou, for cash, to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Sabou plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for some minor needs of her children, with the rest invested in her business. Mrs. Sabou is rally counting on this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in achieving her goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter settled for a living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with his family. He has three children, and he operates a service-based business to provide for the needs of his family. For over nine years, his services have been doing well, and he was able to repay successfully his previous loan used for maintenance costs. 

He took a new loan recently to cover motorcycle maintenance costs and to buy new tires in order to replace the old and used tires.

He wants to improve the general living situation of his family, especially to provide his children with a better education in the future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs and to buy new tires in order to replace the old and used tires.

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Norm, 50, is a resident living in Kampong Speu province and she is a mother of three children, one of whom is too young for school. She earns income to support her family condition via rice cropping on one-hectare of farmland. 

This is first time for Norm with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As a leader of the group, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family lives in a good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Indrisalfus Baldinuci

texts.en:
Indrisalfus comes from the area of Flores in eastern Indonesia, precisely in the area of East Nusa Tenggara. Then he moved to Jakarta, followed his parents to finish his high school studies. Currently, Indrisalfus wanders alone to study Commerce's management and harbor administration in the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), the city of Cilacap. Currently he has been accepted as a prospective student in AMN.

Both of his parents work as farmers with only an abnormal and erratic income, because it is influenced by the weather and the growing season. Meanwhile, Indrisalfus was financed by a cousin who works as a technician in a mobile phone company in his city. The expectations from Indrisalfus' parents are that he can learn diligently and quickly to complete college. All efforts are being made in order to help Indrisalfus' parents, although the parents are just  farmers.

Indrisalfus is very upset with the condition of his parents, he is  determined to quickly complete his studies. He hopes, with a loan from Kiva investors, he can help overcome these difficulties. And Indrisalfus hopes to quickly get a job in a shipping company.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita settled for a living at Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 66-years-old and had seven children. To make a living, Elenita helps her husband operate their own farm and at the same time runs a retail store in their village. Her children already have their own family and sometimes help them work on their farm. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure and a portion will be used to buy additional goods for her grocery store.  She wants to save a portion of her revenue for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure and to buy additional goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Rian Ludy

texts.en:
Rian is a prospective student of Nusantara Maritime Academy (AMN) and he studies marine engineering. Rian lives in a small village in the region of Purbalingga, located far from the college. He has just graduated from high school and wants to continue his studies at AMN. He hopes to complete the program of study, but he has concerns about the cost of his studies.

Rian’s father makes a living as a truck driver in an area where revenue is uncertain, and his resulting income is only enough to meet daily needs, so it would be difficult for him to finance Rian's studies. 

In time, Rian wishes to be able to work on a ship as a professional ship technician, because this has been his dream since early childhood. However, Rian also does not want to bother his parents, because his parents had to pay for his sisters' schools.

Rian is eager to get a loan from Kiva, to help him pay for college later, after he has completed his studies. In this way, he can get a job faster and help his parents's economic circumstances.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for 9 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Martinus Fajar

texts.en:
Martinus’ goal is to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN). He is looking to work in a large port in Indonesia, and he wishes to be a student at AMN. He is taking the program in management and harbor administration. 

He comes from the city of Jakarta, in the Kalideres area. His parents are very old, and now they do not work anymore. During school, he was assisted with the costs by his brother, Martin, who has been working and has a family. Martinus feel sad and worried because so far, he has been troublesome to his brother. 

While he wants to continue his studies in AMN, Martinus enrolled to participate in the Kiva Student Loan program. Martin hopes to get a loan from Kiva through the Student Loan program so that he can continue his studies. He is very grateful to Kiva investors who assist him in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang, as the head of Satya Laksana group, coordinates the payment. Together with the other boards, she has collected the payment. Ni Komang maintains two pigs for fattening and has sold them for 8.000.000 IDR. She has spent 2.500.000 IDR for feed and has bought two piglets for 1.000.000 IDR. She earns 4.500.000 IDR before making a payment to MUK. This makes her very happy. Ni Komang hopes MUK will still support the group until they can have enough savings for capital and continue the pig business without borrowing a loan.

For now the Satya Laksana group still needs a loan to continue their pig business. Ni Komang and her husband are hard workers. Beside having pig business, they also work at their garden. Both of their children already work in the city and does not stay with them. With the same loan size, the Satya Laksana continue their business. Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase two more piglets. Now the price for superior piglets is around 600.000 IDR. She will spend 35.000 IDR for daily needs and 100.000 IDR for electricity a month.

One member can’t attend the meeting because she has attended religious ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: to purchase two more piglets.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in Misamis Occidental with her two children. She had a business retailing farm products in town for over five years, while her husband works as a driver. She also had her own farm where she could earn a living.

Julieta had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her retail business. To improve her farm, she took a new loan to purchase manure fertilizer. She plans to improve her store in order to gain more income for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, a 31-year-old married woman with four children, comes from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been running a retail store for over four years, earning well for the family. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. To improve her business, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She wants to have better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married  and a 29-year-old mother of three living in Tudela Misamis Occidental. She has been selling vegetables in their village from her own garden for over two years. She wants to expand her garden to be able to deliver its farm produce in the market. She became a Gata Daku MPC member and is borrowing a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure in order to restore farm nutrients. In the future, she wants to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sarob

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Chhnang province, Sarob is 31 years old. To improve her family condition, she grows rice as her main source of income.

Moreover, she earns extra income for supporting her family by producing palm juice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about KHR 67,000 per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is asking for a loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have enough electricity for use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Vitalii

texts.en:
Vitalii lives with his family, wife, and daughter in the village of Schineni, in the district of Soroca. They have been married for four years; it is a young family, hard-working and energetic. 

In 2012 Vitalii began to occupy himself with raising bred and decorative poultry. At the beginning of the business he had just five pairs of poultry, which he bred for pleasure. During two years he grew fond of this occupation and moved forward to 70 birds, made up of about 20 different breeds. In 2012-2013 he took part at different exhibitions in Moldova with bred poultry. His goal is to develop to the number of 500 poultry. 

The income from his business begins in spring with collecting the eggs that are stored for incubation. The period of collecting  eggs is four months, beginning with February and ending with May. This year he collected about 100 eggs per week. From the beginning of February until May he collected about 1600 eggs. 600 of them were put for incubation, but the rest were sold. The percentage of incubation quality is about 50-60%.

The egg prices are sold for between 20 and 30 MDL/piece. The chicken price starts at100 MDL/piece and reaches 250 MDL. To achieve the goal, Vitalii began the construction of a summer building for poultry with the area of 100 square meters. To finish the building, he needs building materials for the roof: 100 sheets of slate at price of 96 MDL/sheet=9600 MDL. Also, 8 cubic meters of wood at  3000 MDL/cubic meter = 24000 MDL.

His own investment in the building was 40,000 MDL. Vitalii asks for a loan of $3000 to finish the summer building for poultry.

loans.use: complete hen-house construction

loans.name: Elda Basilia

texts.en:
Elda Basilia is 40 years old and is married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, etc.

Elda Basilia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from bicycle transport and food vending.

Elda Basilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a young 24 years old man, unmarried and a graduate of State Agricultural University from Moldova faculty Agronomy. Although most young people go abroad to work (most of all to Russia), he armed himself with courage and decided to stay at home… and not only stayed, but also applied his knowledge from university, starting his own business, a plantation of strawberries. For prosperity of his business, he asks for a loan in sum of $3000 for a term of 12 months, with the reimbursement according to schedule.  

In 2012 he planted 1,000 strawberry plants of a remontant kind (with fructification duration throughout the summer)  ”Albion” brought from France. He had multiplied the plants and extended the planted area. At the moment he has 30 acres of strawberry crops. Mihai is the only person who directs this activity, employing now and then three other workers who help him at picking and caring for the fruit.

Mihail is going to buy about 5 000 square meters of film for protecting strawberries. 1 square meter of film costs 2,60 MLD at present, but its role is multiple: keeping moisture at roots for a longer time, decreasing the degree of water evaporation, and stopping the growth of weeds as well that may appear later. Also due to this film, fruit grows clean, and the risk of being soaked with earth is excluded.
	
It is also necessary to build a pond that would store 30 cubic meters of water necessary for irrigation of plants. Maintaining a constant level of water temperature is very important avoiding in such a way trauma of strawberry bushes (because of too cold water) as well as preventing shortage of water from wells.

And so that Mihai could enjoy the strawberry crop a longer period of time, preventing freezing of the fruit, it is necessary to purchase 5,000 square meters of foil Agril  at 1,80 MLD/ 1 square meter. Agril protects the plants in case of frost for short time, contributing in such way to obtaining fruit for a longer period of time. To fulfill his plans he needs an investment in total amount of 50,810 MLD. For the total sum of investments, 8 000 MLD is a personal contribution, and 42,810 MLD is the sum requested as a loan.

loans.use: to improve his strawberry plantations

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Mr. Oleg lives in the village Rudi, district of Soroca, together with his family: wife, daughter, mother and father. Mr. Oleg's parents are retired. He takes care of an 8 hectare apple orchard with his family. He asks for a loan in the sum of $2,300 to buy a sprinkler. 

Mr. Oleg started his business in agriculture in 2000, when he was employed as a tractor driver for a local association that dealt with an apple plantation. In 2005, he inherited a 3 hectare apple orchard from his parents. Using the experience and knowledge he gained over 5 years, he decided to start his own business in this area. With money made from taking care of the apple tree plantation, Oleg bought an MTZ-80 tractor, a cultivator, disc harrows, a plough, and a sprinkler with a volume of 1000 liters. All the equipment was purchased secondhand; he invested about $14,000. 

In 2010, he planted 2 hectares of orchard, and in 2012, he rented 3 hectares more from other owners. Because of doubling the plot, the irrigation of the orchard became more complicated. The sprinkler with the volume of 1000 liters doesn't cope with the requirements. Facing such problems, Oleg was forced to buy another sprinkler with a volume of 2000 liters, which cost $2,300 secondhand. After buying the sprinkler, Oleg diminished the expenses for diesel oil. The time process of irrigation decreased by half, which gives him the possibility to perform the necessary work for the technology of an 8 hectare orchard.

loans.use: to purchase a sprinkler for his apple orchard

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 36, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland and raises pigs to earn extra income. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now leading her group of two to get new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house has electricity for use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 57 years old and is married with one child.

Alberta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, bath soap, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Alberta has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Alberta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, bath soap, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 57 years old, widowed, and has five children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She plants and harvests vegetables and papaya to make  a living and  has been doing this for over seven years. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying farm chemicals.  To sustained the farm, she took a new loan recently from Gata Daku MPC to purchase manure fertilizer to improve the soil's organic level. In the future, she wants to improve their farm as well as the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer to improve the soil's organic level.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 25 years old and is married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Marian has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marian aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marites has been in this business for two years.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is 47 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Cayetana is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Cayetana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Cayetana has been raising cattle for seven years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cayetana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Fotemogoban sont mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako.Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (gombos), habits et charbon du bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme  assise à l’extrême  droite  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de gombos; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de gombos à Médine en gros; La revente se fait à Hamdallaye à  une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame .espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of Fotemogoban Group are all married, [living] in monogamous and polygamous households. On average, they are 44 years old and have four children. They all live in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in Bamako. They met one another through neighborhood ties and through their businesses in Hamdallaye. The group members run small businesses selling spices (okra), clothing, and charcoal. With the goal of being able to use cash to stock up, the group members have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Salimata (the woman seated at far right in the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of okra; she plans to use her loan to purchase eight sacks of okra, wholesale, in Médine. She will resell them in Hamdallaye to a group of customers primarily made up of women. Mrs. Salimata hopes to see an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and see to her children's health care.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Julio Armando

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 67 años de edad años de edad, vive en una  comunidad de arenales al Oriente de Honduras, junto a su esposa se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 20 años.
Don Julio con esta actividad ha podido salir adelante con su familia y darle los estudios a sus hijos y tiene un hijo que trabaja en estados unidos el cual es de mucho apoyo para el.    
Don Julio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una Planta Solar y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida, espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda y le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida, uno sueño es tener su hogar iluminado.

 Trojes, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Julio is 67 years old, lives in a community of sandy beaches in the east of Honduras. He and his wife have made a living raising cattle for 20 years. Through this business, Julio has been able to do well for his family and to give his children an education. He has a son who works in the United States, who is a great help in supporting Julio. 

Julio is requesting a loan to buy a solar plant to improve his living conditions. He hopes that this investment will be of much help to even marginally improve his and his family’s quality of life. One of his dreams is to have lighting in his home. 

Trojes, Honduras - August 2014.

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for his home.

loans.name: Muñeca Khaterin

texts.es:
Muñeca es madre soltera de una hermosa niña quien es el motor de su vida y a quien quiere darle todas las comodidades que puede ofrecerle dentro de sus posibilidades. Con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en una tienda de venta de electrodomésticos, labora por un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le está yendo bien por su esfuerzo constante y la amabilidad con la que atiende a los clientes.
Muñeca está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar algunos enseres como ollas, un termo, cubiertos, hervidor, entre otros. De esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su hija y así continuará luchando por su hija cada día, más adelante quiere poner su propio negocio y convertirse en una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Muñeca is a single mother of a beautiful girl who is the driving force of her life and who she wants to give everything she possibly can to.
With a lot of effort, she works in a shop selling household appliances. She works for approximately 10 hours a day and believes she is doing well due to her continued hard work and kindness to customers.
Muñeca is grateful to Kiva lenders because their support could allow her to buy certain goods such as pots, a flask, cutlery, a kettle and many others. This will improve the quality of life of her daughter, which she will continue to fight for every day. Later, she wants to own her own business and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy household goods like plates and cutlery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to give assistance and maintenance to her coffee crop.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a starting farmer who set up her own business that she does together with her family. They are engaged in breeding cattle and pigs. 

She lives in the town of Soroca together with her husband and daughter. They are a family of hardworking, united, well-bred people.

In 2006, after Carolina married Andrian, they got a present from Carolina's granny: a milking cow. At first Carolina didn't want to take the cow because she had no possibility of keeping it in town. At the end of the year, they were faced with the problem that Andrian hadn't found a job. This reason influenced their decision to change their dwelling and buy a house beyond the town, in order to occupy themselves with breeding animals. 

After doing the calculations, Carolina proved to her husband that the planned business would bring them a constant profit. By only selling dairy products, they would get at least 1,000 lei a month from a single cow.

So began their small business with only the cow they received as a present from the granny. Over six years, the family created a small farm that consists of nine cows at present: five milking cows, two steers bred for sale and two heifers that will become milking cows later. All these were bred by the family without any investment needed to buy them. Besides cows, there are nine pigs bred at the farm, eight of them are sows that are going to farrow. Little pigs are grown only during the lactation period. Some of them are sold and the rest are kept for growth. Carolina cannot further develop her small business in the stable built in 2009 by her husband Andrian, so she has a room shortage. 

The solution to this problem is to buy a former stable from the village of Pirlita, left over from a kolkhoz (a cooperative agricultural production farm in former USSR). This stable now belongs to people from the village who hold value shares that were divided among them after the dissolving of the kolkhoz. Carolina needs $3,000 to buy and repair this stable. The enlargement of the farm will permit the family to create new jobs for the inhabitants of the village of Pirlita.

loans.use: to buy and repair a stable

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, fruits et légumes, habits, bois et charbon, tubercules et produits cosmétiques. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) à une bonne notoriété, car les fruits et légumes très prises par les femmes à Sabalibougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac d’orange, 40 pastèques, 3 sacs de melons et 30 ananas. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Sabalibougou à une clientèle mixtes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 50 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of six women, most of whom are married and living in monogamous households. On the average, they are 31 years old with two children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a district of Bamako. They know each other through their local “tontines” [neighborhood savings group] as well as through their work. The group members have different lines of business, for example selling fruits and vegetables, clothing, charcoal, yams and cosmetic products. With the goal of expanding their business, the group members have decided to reach out to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan.

Mrs. Mariam (the one seated on the far right in the photo) is a well-known vendor as her fruits and vegetables are in high demand with the women in Sabalibougou. She plans to use her loan to buy one bag of oranges, 40 watermelons, three bags of melons and 30 pineapples. She stocks up in Médine. She sells in Sabalibougou, for cash, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Mariam plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for her needs and reinvest in her business. Her goal is to continue this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso and keep taking out loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: María Pilar

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º año de bachillerato,esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja de albañil, son padres de tres hijos.

María es  empleada en una ferretería por once años,después de salir de estudiar busco trabajo debido a la necesidad que tenia de darles lo mejor a sus hijos,el trabajo le queda cerca, su horario es de  7:00 AM a 5:00 PM.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar arena, cemento, bloque y piedra, para construir un muro alrededor de su casa y construir un  baño que le urge puesto que muy necesario para sus hijos y la necesidad quedara satisfecha 

 El sueño de María es que su casa este en buenas condiciones y siempre mantener su trabajo para poder darles todo lo que necesita sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of high school, and is married. Her husband works as a builder; they are the parents of three children.

María has worked at a hardware store for eleven years, which she began after leaving school to seek work, as she needed to provide for her children. She works close to home, and her hours are from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. 

She needs a loan to buy sand, cement, blocks, and stone, to build a wall around her house, and to build a bathroom. She needs this very much; it is imperative for her children. María’s dream is to have her home in good condition, and to always keep her job, so that she can give her children everything they need.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, blocks, and stone, to build a wall around her house, and to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Miriam Lorena de 27 años de edad,ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de prendas de vestir(uniformes escolares)ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de prendas de vestir, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que Kiva le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Dúo Mujeres Accionistas” is formed by Miriam Lorena. Miriam is 27 years old, and works making and selling clothing (school uniforms). She has been working in this business for several years. 

She is currently requesting this loan to buy materials to make the clothing, which she will then sell. She hopes Kiva can help fulfill this loan, as it has been a big help for her business in the past.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothing, which she will then sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 53 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, responsable, constante y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de batallas, cercana al lago Titicaca.
Tomasa es de tez morena, estatura mediana, viste de forma típica (sombreo, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su trabajo lo realiza en el lago sagrado y las especies que pesca mayormente son; el karachi, mauri y el suche. Estas especies son originarias de la zona y son muy utilizadas en comidas típicas del lugar por lo que su demanda es mayor.
Ella sueña en mejorar su calidad de vida, realizando la compra de material de trabajo como redes de pesca y refaccionar su bote.
Es por esos motivos que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y mejorar sus ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 53, is single, childless and works in the fishing business.
She is an entrepreneur, feisty, strong, responsible, loyal and hardworking. She works near Lake Titicaca.
Tomasa is of dark complexion, of medium height, typically wears a hat, a shawl and a skirt, and her first language is Aymara although she also knows Spanish.
She works on the "sacred lake" and the species she mostly fishes for are: karachi, mauri and suche. These are native to the area and are very typically used in local dishes so the demand is higher.
Her dream is to improve her quality of life by purchasing material like fishing nets and boat repairs. It is for these reasons that Tomasa is applying for a loan; to purchase fishing nets and to improve the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and improve her family's income.

loans.name: Grande  Dame Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six  femmes, les membres du groupe Grande Dame sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 31ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits, condiments et céréales. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1ièr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo)) est une grande vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies. Elles s’approvisionnent en friperies à Médine.    La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit à Daoudabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Grande Dame are married women who all live in polygamous households in Daoudabougou, a district of Bamako. They average 31 years of age and four children each, and they know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship, and through their income-generating activities. They sell clothing, condiments and cereals.  

In order to build their inventory, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan cycle.
Mrs. Fatoumata (sitting 2nd from the right in the group photo) is a successful reseller of clothing. She will use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing. She buys her merchandise in Médine and retails it in Daoudabougou, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which she will use to provide for her children’s healthcare.

Her goal is to bolster her activity through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 46 years old and has one child who is in school. Corazon is married.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Corazon requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, who is married and has a cattle-raising enterprise in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In business for five years now, she has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

In the future, Dorothy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle
